2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — The sky had turned black.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Air India Crash Investigators Focus On a Dangerous Runway and a Pilot’s Actions

2020-08-08.abstract: Berkshire reported earnings of $26.4 billion in the second quarter, a turnaround from its $49.7 billion loss in the first quarter, when the pandemic caused a plunge in the stock market.
2020-08-08.snippet: Berkshire reported earnings of $26.4 billion in the second quarter, a turnaround from its $49.7 billion loss in the first quarter, when the pandemic caused a plunge in the stock market.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: The strong recovery in the stock market — and a surge in the value of Apple’s stock, in particular — drove a rebound in profits for Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway in the second quarter.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Profits Rebound at Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway

2020-08-08.abstract: Co-op boards do not like to get in the middle of resident disputes. But if one shareholder is tormenting another, the issue must be addressed.
2020-08-08.snippet: Co-op boards do not like to get in the middle of resident disputes. But if one shareholder is tormenting another, the issue must be addressed.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Q: The rear windows of my apartment in a Westchester co-op overlook a small outdoor sitting area with views of woods, birds, squirrels and chipmunks. Since spring, a new resident as been grilling there, obliterating the serenity of the space. After shareholders complained, the board insisted he move his grill 10 feet from the wall, but didn’t make any other demands. He’s still out there daily with two grills, chairs and an enormous toy car. He shouts and blasts his music. When I complained to management, I was told that he’s allowed to grill. But what about my comfort and my rights to use the space that he now dominates?
2020-08-08.headline_main: It’s Neighbor vs. Neighbor in a Co-op. Who Wins?

2020-08-08.abstract: Ali Slagle’s chicken recipe, J. Kenji López-Alt empanadas, and more recipes.
2020-08-08.snippet: Ali Slagle’s chicken recipe, J. Kenji López-Alt empanadas, and more recipes.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: The week’s most popular dishes include Ali Slagle’s mayo-marinated recipe for ginger-lime chicken (above), J. Kenji López-Alt’s beef empanadas and Millie Peartree’s mango slaw. Find more recipes in the collection below.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Make This Ginger-Lime Chicken ASAP

2020-08-08.abstract: Indoor air is riskier than outdoor air. So what do you do if it’s really hot out?
2020-08-08.snippet: Indoor air is riskier than outdoor air. So what do you do if it’s really hot out?
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Despite its critical role in our daily lives, air is not something most of us spend a great deal of time thinking about. It’s that easy to take for granted. Unlike water, we don’t need to fill up a cup to consume it. If some escapes from the room, more will find its way back in, whether we open the door or not.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Your Hot-Weather Guide to Coronavirus, Air-Conditioning and Airflow

2020-08-08.abstract: Will Shortz is back to tie us up, but we can get across these nine little puzzles.
2020-08-08.snippet: Will Shortz is back to tie us up, but we can get across these nine little puzzles.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — This is our second set of “Cross Ties” this year, so you may recognize the challenge before us (this puzzle type premiered on March 22, with a spoiler-filled accompanying column).
2020-08-08.headline_main: Variety: Cross Ties

2020-08-08.abstract: The German military’s infiltration by far-right extremists should be a warning for how we confront our own troubled history.
2020-08-08.snippet: The German military’s infiltration by far-right extremists should be a warning for how we confront our own troubled history.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: At the end of May, German police commandos arrived outside a rural home owned by a sergeant major in that country’s most elite special forces unit, the KSK. Buried in the backyard they found a trove of weapons, explosives and Nazi memorabilia. In response, Germany’s defense minister announced that she would disband one-quarter of the unit because of the widespread infiltration of far-right extremists into its ranks. But as several news reports have made clear, it is suspected that the infiltration extends far beyond a single segment of the KSK.
2020-08-08.headline_main: America’s Military Should Confront Its Past, Not Bury It

2020-08-08.abstract: Check out a reading by emerging writers, learn the secrets of Jewish cuisine and channel Rube Goldberg.
2020-08-08.snippet: Check out a reading by emerging writers, learn the secrets of Jewish cuisine and channel Rube Goldberg.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Here is a sampling of the week’s events and how to tune in (all times are Eastern). Note that events are subject to change after publication.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Perfect the Art of Pickling and Ponder a Night of Poetry

2020-08-08.abstract: 100 years ago, Mamie Smith recorded a seminal blues hit that gave voice to outrage at violence against Black Americans.
2020-08-08.snippet: 100 years ago, Mamie Smith recorded a seminal blues hit that gave voice to outrage at violence against Black Americans.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: On Aug. 10, 1920, two African-American musicians, Mamie Smith and Perry Bradford, went into a New York studio and changed the course of music history. Ms. Smith, then a modestly successful singer from Cincinnati who had made only one other record, a sultry ballad that fizzled in the marketplace, recorded a new song by Mr. Bradford called “Crazy Blues.” A boisterous cry of outrage by a woman driven mad by mistreatment, the song spoke with urgency and fire to Black listeners across the country who had been ravaged by the abuses of race-hate groups, the police and military forces in the preceding year — the notorious “Red Summer” of 1919.
2020-08-08.headline_main: A Song That Changed Music Forever

2020-08-08.abstract: It’s one of the best performing assets in the world this year. That’s not a great sign.
2020-08-08.snippet: It’s one of the best performing assets in the world this year. That’s not a great sign.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Gold bugs — investors perpetually bullish on gold — have long been seen as a paranoid fringe of the financial world, holding the shiny asset as a hedge against a disaster they always think is near. But lately, they appear to be on to something. This year, gold is the best performing traditional asset in the world. Its price just topped $2,000 an ounce for the first time. From serious investors to newly minted day traders, everyone is talking up its virtues.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Why Is Everyone Buying Gold?

2020-08-08.abstract: Just because you can’t go to the games doesn’t mean your summer has to be athlete-free.
2020-08-08.snippet: Just because you can’t go to the games doesn’t mean your summer has to be athlete-free.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Even after months of postponed seasons and canceled events, sports leagues continue to struggle to rebound (at least, in the United States). For fans, this means that 2020 will most likely be a year with fewer games and without any in-person games. Fortunately, there’s a raft of podcasts that can give seasoned fans some content to fill that void — and these four shows are so entertaining and enlightening that even the most sports-disinterested person will probably enjoy tuning in. Find them in your listening app of choice.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Sports Podcasts Even a Newbie Can Enjoy

2020-08-08.abstract: Emboldened by Republican divisions and a favorable political landscape, the speaker is refusing to agree to a narrow relief measure, unbothered by charges that she is an impediment to a deal.
2020-08-08.snippet: Emboldened by Republican divisions and a favorable political landscape, the speaker is refusing to agree to a narrow relief measure, unbothered by charges that she is an impediment to a deal.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the clock ticked down Thursday on a self-imposed deadline for a breakthrough in coronavirus relief talks with no deal in sight, Jim Cramer, the brash CNBC host, had an on-air proposal for Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Pelosi Is Playing Hardball on Coronavirus Relief. She Thinks She’ll Win.

2020-08-08.abstract: Though it’s unclear whether he has the authority to do so, President Trump said on Friday that if Congress did not reach an agreement, he would act unilaterally to extend a coronavirus economic aid package.
2020-08-08.snippet: Though it’s unclear whether he has the authority to do so, President Trump said on Friday that if Congress did not reach an agreement, he would act unilaterally to extend a coronavirus economic aid package.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Though it’s unclear whether he has the authority to do so, President Trump said on Friday that if Congress did not reach an agreement, he would act unilaterally to extend a coronavirus economic aid package.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Trump Threatens to Use Executive Order for ‘Critical Relief’

2020-08-08.abstract: The demonstrations were fueled by fury over the corruption and negligence of the country’s ruling elite. Security forces fired tear gas to push back the protesters.
2020-08-08.snippet: The demonstrations were fueled by fury over the corruption and negligence of the country’s ruling elite. Security forces fired tear gas to push back the protesters.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Violent clashes between demonstrators and security forces transformed much of central Beirut into a battle zone of flying rocks, swinging batons and clouds of tear gas on Saturday, as the fury over a huge explosion in Beirut’s port this week fueled attacks on government buildings.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Clashes Erupt in Beirut at Blast Protest as Lebanon’s Anger Boils Over

2020-08-08.abstract: After Ms. Noem, the South Dakota governor, flew to Washington on Air Force One, rumors about her ambitions ensued. She made a second trip to smooth things over with Mike Pence.
2020-08-08.snippet: After Ms. Noem, the South Dakota governor, flew to Washington on Air Force One, rumors about her ambitions ensued. She made a second trip to smooth things over with Mike Pence.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Since the first days after she was elected governor of South Dakota in 2018, Kristi Noem had been working to ensure that President Trump would come to Mount Rushmore for a fireworks-filled July 4 extravaganza.
2020-08-08.headline_main: How Kristi Noem, Mt. Rushmore and Trump Fueled Speculation About Pence’s Job

2020-08-08.abstract: Dynamic duos set out to solve mysteries for others and end up uncovering truths about themselves.
2020-08-08.snippet: Dynamic duos set out to solve mysteries for others and end up uncovering truths about themselves.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Recently my daughter was searching for her sketchbook when she found her missing paintbrushes instead. Such is the recovery of lost belongings. You’re looking for one thing, you find something else. I’ve stumbled onto story ideas this way. I’m so sure I’m writing about a missing brother, when I discover I’m actually writing about empathy and self-acceptance. Most good mysteries strike a graceful balance between plot and character development. These three do just that, by inviting you to look and look again, to uncover the stories underneath.
2020-08-08.headline_main: 3 Graphic Novel Detective Stories

2020-08-08.abstract: Readers offer their ideas in response to the music critic Anthony Tommasini’s suggestion that blind auditions be ended.
2020-08-08.snippet: Readers offer their ideas in response to the music critic Anthony Tommasini’s suggestion that blind auditions be ended.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2020-08-08.headline_main: How to Diversify Orchestras

2020-08-08.abstract: One of the few women in the computer industry in its early days, she paved the way for the efficient, lightning-fast apps of today.
2020-08-08.snippet: One of the few women in the computer industry in its early days, she paved the way for the efficient, lightning-fast apps of today.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Frances Allen, a computer scientist and researcher who helped create the fundamental ideas that allow practically anyone to build fast, efficient and useful software for computers, smartphones and websites, died on Tuesday, her 88th birthday, in Schenectady, N.Y.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Frances Allen, Who Helped Hardware Understand Software, Dies at 88

2020-08-08.abstract: The move highlights the risk of Legionnaires’ disease outbreaks when buildings are reopened after coronavirus lockdowns.
2020-08-08.snippet: The move highlights the risk of Legionnaires’ disease outbreaks when buildings are reopened after coronavirus lockdowns.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: The nation’s foremost public health agency is learning that it is not immune to the complex effects of the coronavirus pandemic.
2020-08-08.headline_main: C.D.C. Closes Some Offices Over Bacteria Discovery

2020-08-08.abstract: As the two parties clash over how to conduct an election in a pandemic, President Trump’s litigiousness and unfounded claims of fraud have increased the likelihood of epic postelection court fights.
2020-08-08.snippet: As the two parties clash over how to conduct an election in a pandemic, President Trump’s litigiousness and unfounded claims of fraud have increased the likelihood of epic postelection court fights.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: The stormy once-in-a-lifetime Florida recount battle that polarized the nation in 2000 and left the Supreme Court to decide the presidency may soon look like a high school student council election compared with what could be coming after this November’s election.
2020-08-08.headline_main: The Voting Will End Nov. 3. The Legal Battle Probably Won’t.

2020-08-08.abstract: Demonstrators took hold of Lebanon’s capital, fueled by widespread outrage after a blast in Beirut’s port that killed at least 154 people and destroyed entire neighborhoods.
2020-08-08.snippet: Demonstrators took hold of Lebanon’s capital, fueled by widespread outrage after a blast in Beirut’s port that killed at least 154 people and destroyed entire neighborhoods.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Demonstrators took hold of Lebanon’s capital, fueled by widespread outrage after a blast in Beirut’s port that killed at least 154 people and destroyed entire neighborhoods.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Protests Erupt on the Streets of a Battered Beirut

2020-08-08.abstract: The servicemen had been missing since the amphibious assault vehicle they were in sank off the coast of Southern California on July 30.
2020-08-08.snippet: The servicemen had been missing since the amphibious assault vehicle they were in sank off the coast of Southern California on July 30.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: The remains of seven Marines and one sailor killed in a training accident off the coast of Southern California late last month were recovered on Friday in a U.S. Navy underwater salvage operation, according to the authorities.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Remains of Sailor and 7 Marines Killed in Training Accident Are Recovered

2020-08-08.abstract: Advocates worked for decades to free him in the murder of his wife’s grandmother in Connecticut; in 2015 a court finally agreed.
2020-08-08.snippet: Advocates worked for decades to free him in the murder of his wife’s grandmother in Connecticut; in 2015 a court finally agreed.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Richard Lapointe, convicted on dubious evidence in 1992 of one of the more shocking murders in recent Connecticut history, fought for more than two decades for his release from prison, with a small army of supporters backing him. In 2015 he and his advocates finally succeeded.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Richard Lapointe, Exonerated in a Murder Case, Dies at 74

2020-08-08.abstract: The Berkshire Theater Group put on the first professional musical in the U.S. since the pandemic lockdown, and it’s a revival in every sense.
2020-08-08.snippet: The Berkshire Theater Group put on the first professional musical in the U.S. since the pandemic lockdown, and it’s a revival in every sense.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: PITTSFIELD, Mass. — And it came about that the faith of the devoted was sorely tested during the months of famine, and there was a great hunger to believe again. Thus on a hazy night in August, several score of them gathered, with their lower faces hidden as the times demanded, in a parking lot in a small city in the lap of the Berkshire Mountains. They were looking for signs of a resurrection.
2020-08-08.headline_main: ‘Godspell’ Review: Musical Theater Rises From the Dead

2020-08-08.abstract: A Sacramento fixture, Mr. Waters drove a 1932 Ford and crossed paths with Patty Hearst and Squeaky Fromme. He died of the coronavirus.
2020-08-08.snippet: A Sacramento fixture, Mr. Waters drove a 1932 Ford and crossed paths with Patty Hearst and Squeaky Fromme. He died of the coronavirus.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Robbie Waters, an Old-School Cop and Legislator, Dies at 84

2020-08-08.abstract: The solutions to combating the coronavirus are no mystery. It’s time to do this right.
2020-08-08.snippet: The solutions to combating the coronavirus are no mystery. It’s time to do this right.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Six to eight weeks. That’s how long some of the nation’s leading public health experts say it would take to finally get the United States’ coronavirus epidemic under control. If the country were to take the right steps, many thousands of people could be spared from the ravages of Covid-19. The economy could finally begin to repair itself, and Americans could start to enjoy something more like normal life.
2020-08-08.headline_main: America Could Control the Pandemic by October. Let’s Get to It.

2020-08-08.abstract: The players, who have pushed for more-frequent virus testing and stronger protection of their status with the team, said Pac-12 Commissioner Larry Scott offered no concrete mandates for the league’s universities.
2020-08-08.snippet: The players, who have pushed for more-frequent virus testing and stronger protection of their status with the team, said Pac-12 Commissioner Larry Scott offered no concrete mandates for the league’s universities.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: When a group of Pac-12 Conference players who are threatening to opt out of the football season met with Commissioner Larry Scott on Thursday night, they had two primary objectives: pushing for more-frequent coronavirus testing and protecting the eligibility and status of players who choose not to play for health reasons.
2020-08-08.headline_main: Pac-12 Players Say Commissioner Was Dismissive of Their Virus Concerns

2020-08-08.abstract: Many sports have returned to play without fans. Golf is deciding a major championship without them. For players used to feeding off the crowd’s energy and reactions, it’s just not the same.
2020-08-08.snippet: Many sports have returned to play without fans. Golf is deciding a major championship without them. For players used to feeding off the crowd’s energy and reactions, it’s just not the same.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For three days of the P.G.A. Championship, golf’s first major of this discombobulated sports year, the world’s best players were introduced at the start of their rounds by a public-address announcer with no public to address.
2020-08-08.headline_main: The Deafening Silence of a Coronavirus Championship

2020-08-08.abstract: Lessons for coronavirus long-haulers from my own experience with chronic illness.
2020-08-08.snippet: Lessons for coronavirus long-haulers from my own experience with chronic illness.
2020-08-08.lead_paragraph: Among the many things that nobody knows about the disease that has overturned our lives is how long its effects last. I don’t just mean the possibility of coronavirus damage lurking invisibly in the heart or lungs or brain. I mean the simpler question of what it takes, and how long, for some uncertain percentage of the sick to actually feel better.
2020-08-08.headline_main: What to Do When Covid Doesn’t Go Away

2020-08-08.abstract: “Wicked Game” is slated for release in October, at the height of the presidential campaign, but Mr. Gates says, “It’s not a salacious book.”

Bush, who died Thursday, was frequently praised for establishing a paradigm for doing that job that many of his successors attempted (or claimed) to follow. 2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: SURVIVING JEFFREY EPSTEIN 8 p.m. on Lifetime. This two-episode special will look into the crimes of Jeffrey Epstein, the wealthy financier and sex offender who died in federal custody last year. For years Epstein had been accused of sexually abusing underage girls, but had avoided federal charges until he was arrested in 2019 for sex trafficking. Epstein’s death, which was ruled a suicide, left many of his accusers angry that he would never stand trial. This documentary focuses on eight of the accusers, who shed light on Epstein and his inner circle.

2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Radhika Kumar goes to work every morning hoping to save lives. As a contact tracer for Los Angeles County, her job, at least on paper, entails phoning people who have tested positive for the coronavirus, along with others they may have exposed, and providing them with guidance on how to isolate so as not to infect others. If that sounds easy, it is not.

2020-08-09.abstract: A jobs report that found  the U.S. economy added 1.8 million jobs in July, and President Trump signed executive orders to extend some of the benefits in the virus relief law.
2020-08-09.snippet: A jobs report that found  the U.S. economy added 1.8 million jobs in July, and President Trump signed executive orders to extend some of the benefits in the virus relief law.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: The July employment report on Friday morning showed that America’s job market appears to be losing steam after two months of improvement. The 1.8 million jobs added in July was a sharp slowdown from the 4.8 million gained in June, as businesses closed again in parts of the country where the virus has surged. The unemployment rate was 10.2 percent in July, down from 11.1 percent in June. Only a little more than 40 percent of the jobs lost since the pandemic hit have been recovered. And even as employers are hiring, other workers are being let go permanently after assuming that their layoffs were temporary.
2020-08-09.headline_main: The Week in Business: The Stimulus Mess

Meera Sodha’s chicken curry (above), which her mom taught her to make, and her naan to go with it, which her aunt taught her to make. I like to make some raita as well. We’ve got a fine recipe for hot mango chutney, too, but I’ll use store-bought. I’m not looking for projects at the end of the weekend, just comfort and deliciousness. I want to eat early, and then go binge “Queen Sugar” for a while. Will you join me?

2020-08-09.snippet: Businesses and the unemployed faced uncertainty as administration officials defended the president’s directives and Democrats criticized them.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s attempt to circumvent Congress to provide coronavirus relief in the absence of a broad agreement resulted in confusion and uncertainty on Sunday for tens of millions of unemployed Americans and countless businesses seeking aid after critical benefits lapsed.

2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: In Columbus, Ohio, judges have relocated eviction hearings to the cavernous halls of the city’s convention center, to ensure there’s plenty of space for the grim business of throwing families onto the street.
2020-08-09.headline_main: The Coming Eviction Crisis: ‘It’s Hard to Pay the Bills on Nothing’

2020-08-09.abstract: In this country, as in Lebanon, everything is now politics.
2020-08-09.snippet: In this country, as in Lebanon, everything is now politics.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: When I first heard the news of the terrible explosion in Beirut, and then the rampant speculation about who might have set it off, my mind drifted back some 40 years to a dinner party I attended at the residence of Malcolm Kerr, then president of the American University of Beirut.
2020-08-09.headline_main: Beirut’s Blast Is a Warning for America

2020-08-09.abstract: “It was like unfinished business,” the former Denver officer said of finding the fugitive, who had been living under an alias in New Mexico for decades.
2020-08-09.snippet: “It was like unfinished business,” the former Denver officer said of finding the fugitive, who had been living under an alias in New Mexico for decades.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: Daril Cinquanta, a retired Denver police officer, never forgot the man who shot him while he was on duty in 1971. So when the man, Luis Archuleta, escaped from prison in 1974, Mr. Cinquanta made it his mission to track him down.
2020-08-09.headline_main: Retired Police Officer Tracks Down Escapee Who Shot Him Almost 50 Years Ago

2020-08-09.abstract: A government exit poll said Aleksandr Lukashenko had won almost 80 percent of the vote. That triggered protests against the repressive regime, and a heavy police response.

2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: [Read more on what’s happening in Belarus: protests, police and government.]
2020-08-09.headline_main: Belarus Says Longtime Leader Is Re-elected in Vote Critics Call Rigged

2020-08-09.abstract: Several states are trying to increase coronavirus testing with faster methods, undeterred by less accurate but quicker readouts.
2020-08-09.snippet: Several states are trying to increase coronavirus testing with faster methods, undeterred by less accurate but quicker readouts.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike DeWine of Ohio, who last week tested positive for the coronavirus, then negative and then negative again, said on CNN on Sunday that his roller-coaster ride should not be reason for people to think “that testing is not reliable or doesn’t work.”
2020-08-09.headline_main: Ohio Governor Says His Flawed Virus Test Shouldn’t Undercut New, Rapid Methods

2020-08-09.abstract: With the regular season winding down, more than hotel envy now afflicts the six lower-rung teams that are living in a lower-rung Disney World resort and trying to crash the N.B.A. playoffs.
2020-08-09.snippet: With the regular season winding down, more than hotel envy now afflicts the six lower-rung teams that are living in a lower-rung Disney World resort and trying to crash the N.B.A. playoffs.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. — Only one of the 22 teams invited to Walt Disney World for the N.B.A. restart arrived with a worse record than the Phoenix Suns. Then Phoenix won its first five seeding games here, including a buzzer-beating upset of the Los Angeles Clippers, and completely changed the tenor of interactions with the other teams at its hotel.
2020-08-09.headline_main: The N.B.A.’s ‘Yacht Club Six’ Seek Respect and a Lifeline

2020-08-09.abstract: Relax, everyone! Lynn Lempel has helped us find something very important.
2020-08-09.snippet: Relax, everyone! Lynn Lempel has helped us find something very important.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — A friend who is a physician once used this puzzle’s theme as a way to explain the distinction between mere forgetfulness and true cognitive decline to me. Well, he didn’t actually use the puzzle, obviously, but the subject of Lynn Lempel’s crossword was a helpful analogy.
2020-08-09.headline_main: The Opposite of Subtle

2020-08-09.abstract: The demands for a change in Lebanon’s leadership are growing louder.
2020-08-09.snippet: The demands for a change in Lebanon’s leadership are growing louder.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — For months, the restaurateurs poured their time and money into a gamble on a new joint called “The Barn.”
2020-08-09.headline_main: Beirut Blast Hit 3 Disparate Neighborhoods. Now They’re United in Rage.

2020-08-09.abstract: The U.S. Women’s Amateur championship concluded on Sunday, but the search by nonprofessionals for competitive women’s golf events has been onerous since the college season was canceled last spring.
2020-08-09.snippet: The U.S. Women’s Amateur championship concluded on Sunday, but the search by nonprofessionals for competitive women’s golf events has been onerous since the college season was canceled last spring.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: ROCKVILLE, Md. — The Jacksonville Amateur Championship in Florida is not a typical stop on the summer circuit for the reigning U.S. Women’s Amateur champion. But Gabriela Ruffels wanted competitive tournament rounds ahead of her title defense, so in July she joined two others as the first women to play in the men’s event.
2020-08-09.headline_main: In Women’s Golf, Virus Upends the Typical Paths to a Pro Career

2020-08-09.abstract: French humanitarian workers, their Nigerien driver and a guide were killed, according to the authorities. The group was visiting an area known for its West African giraffes.
2020-08-09.snippet: French humanitarian workers, their Nigerien driver and a guide were killed, according to the authorities. The group was visiting an area known for its West African giraffes.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — Gunmen killed eight people on Sunday at a wildlife reserve in Niger, including six French humanitarian workers, their Nigerien driver and a guide, according to authorities.
2020-08-09.headline_main: 8 Dead After Attack in a Wildlife Reserve in Niger

2020-08-09.abstract: As the world sketches out post-pandemic plans, Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka, the head of U.N. Women, explains why having more women in leadership positions could lead to better results.
2020-08-09.snippet: As the world sketches out post-pandemic plans, Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka, the head of U.N. Women, explains why having more women in leadership positions could lead to better results.

2020-08-09.headline_main: The Key to an Inclusive Recovery? Putting Women in Decision-Making Roles

2020-08-09.abstract: An injury to Giancarlo Stanton and three narrow losses to a division rival over the weekend slowed some of the Yankees’ early momentum.
2020-08-09.snippet: An injury to Giancarlo Stanton and three narrow losses to a division rival over the weekend slowed some of the Yankees’ early momentum.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: Just more than a quarter into this unusual 60-game season, this is where the Yankees stand: A 10-6 record, leading the American League East. They possess one of the most talented rosters and best records in Major League Baseball, and were leading the American League in runs and home runs as of Sunday afternoon.
2020-08-09.headline_main: Yankees Cool Off in a Heated Series Against the Rays

2020-08-09.abstract: Because Congress controls federal spending, at least some of the measures will almost certainly be challenged in court. Or they may become moot if Congress reaches a deal.
2020-08-09.snippet: Because Congress controls federal spending, at least some of the measures will almost certainly be challenged in court. Or they may become moot if Congress reaches a deal.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: President Trump, in announcing his executive measures on Saturday, said he was bypassing Congress to deliver emergency pandemic aid to needy Americans. But his directives are rife with so much complexity and legal murkiness that they’re unlikely, in most cases, to bring fast relief — if any.
2020-08-09.headline_main: Trump’s Directives Were Supposed to Offer Relief. Most May Not.

2020-08-09.abstract: Jerry Falwell Jr. has courted controversy repeatedly, but a provocative Instagram post led to him stepping aside as Liberty University’s president.

2020-08-09.headline_main: After Falwell Stumbles, His Hometown Sees a Leader in Need of Redemption

2020-08-09.abstract: Some of what we saw was people cosplaying consciousness — symbolism that cost nothing and shifted no power.
2020-08-09.snippet: Some of what we saw was people cosplaying consciousness — symbolism that cost nothing and shifted no power.
2020-08-09.lead_paragraph: We are in a period of post-mortem reflection following the time during which racial justice protests were at their most intense. We now must ask ourselves: What has changed and what hasn’t? Have power and privilege truly been disrupted? Has oppression been alleviated? What will be the legacy of this moment?
2020-08-09.headline_main: In the Wake of Protests

2020-08-09.abstract: Meet the motorcyclists gathered in Sturgis, S.D., for a giant annual rally, with plenty of regard for one another but little for the pandemic.

2020-08-09.headline_main: Scenes From a Biker Rally, Undaunted by the Virus

2020-08-10.abstract: The new referees in American politics are Facebook, Google and Twitter, and they would be wise to pay attention to lessons the old media tried to learn.

2020-08-10.abstract: In the first major tournament since the pandemic stalled the sports world, the title went to a magnetic 23-year-old who turned pro just last year.

2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — In a high-profile attack on free speech and dissent in Hong Kong, the police on Monday arrested Jimmy Lai, a prominent pro-democracy media tycoon, and raided the offices of his newspaper, demonstrating China’s resolve to silence the opposition and bring the city to heel.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Hong Kong Arrests Jimmy Lai, Media Mogul, Under National Security Law

2020-08-10.snippet: On Della’s advice, Perry calls an unexpected witness to the stand. Will the gamble pay off?
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: It’s all connected. This is Perry Mason’s argument as he takes on his star witness (and a hostile one at that), Sgt. Ennis, in court. It beggars belief that an accountant like George Gannon could have executed his two accomplices (both of them professional hoods), driven across town with a bullet wound, then blown his own head off with a shotgun.
2020-08-10.headline_main: ‘Perry Mason’ Season 1 Finale Recap: The Defense Rests

2020-08-10.abstract: A biopic about the aging crime boss starring Tom Hardy arrives on Amazon. And an athletic competition show on NBC closes out its second season.
2020-08-10.snippet: A biopic about the aging crime boss starring Tom Hardy arrives on Amazon. And an athletic competition show on NBC closes out its second season.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: CAPONE (2020) Stream on Amazon and Kanopy; rent on Google Play, iTunes, Vudu and YouTube. The Al Capone of this film is not the iconic bootlegger and crime boss that audiences are likely familiar with. He’s just spent 11 years in federal prison for tax evasion, and neurosyphilis is claiming his mind. As portrayed by Tom Hardy, Capone is “a boogeyman bloated with body fluids,” according to Ben Kenigsberg’s review for The Times. During this twilight period, the retired gangster lives in Palm Island, Fla., in the care of his wife, Mae (Linda Cardellini), and a doctor played by Kyle MacLachlan. Still under surveillance by law enforcement and haunted by the crimes he committed as a younger man, Capone struggles to recall where he hid millions of dollars before he was imprisoned.
2020-08-10.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘Capone’ and ‘The Titan Games’

2020-08-10.snippet: To a degree not seen before, players are kneeling for the United States national anthem and speaking out publicly on fighting racism, with backing from the National Hockey League.

2020-08-10.abstract: A fear of hospitals is leading many Mexicans to delay treatment for coronavirus until it is too late for doctors to help them.
2020-08-10.snippet: A fear of hospitals is leading many Mexicans to delay treatment for coronavirus until it is too late for doctors to help them.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — A gray Suzuki stopped outside the General Hospital of Mexico and deposited a heaving Victor Bailón at the entrance. He had refused to come to the hospital for days, convinced that doctors were killing coronavirus patients. By the time he hobbled into the triage area and collapsed on the floor, it was too late.
2020-08-10.headline_main: ‘I’d Rather Stay Home and Die’

2020-08-10.abstract: A fight to rename a metro stop pits those who want to celebrate a revered Black musician against those who want to retain the name of a priest who espoused equal rights for Francophone Quebecers — and also anti-Semitism.

2020-08-10.abstract: Recent research, which found a link between pyrethroids and deaths from heart disease, highlights the limitations of epidemiological research.
2020-08-10.snippet: Recent research, which found a link between pyrethroids and deaths from heart disease, highlights the limitations of epidemiological research.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: With summer here and more people choosing to escape their coronavirus prisons into yards, parks, woods and streets, a recent study suggests yet another potential health risk, albeit one far less concerning than the virus: exposure to pyrethroids, a major group of insecticides widely used to protect against everything from malaria parasites and West Nile virus to bed bugs and ticks, as well as a host of agricultural and garden pests.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Should a Study on Pesticides Affect Our Use of Them?

2020-08-10.abstract: These front-line medical workers are struggling with what comes next.
2020-08-10.snippet: These front-line medical workers are struggling with what comes next.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Once a global epicenter of the pandemic, New York City has — for now — brought things under control. But where does this reprieve leave front-line medical workers?
2020-08-10.headline_main: ‘The Wounds Are Still Fresh’

2020-08-10.abstract: Everyone is stressed and anxious now. We have to find and help the children who are hurting most.
2020-08-10.snippet: Everyone is stressed and anxious now. We have to find and help the children who are hurting most.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Last week, to write about the risks of summer — the recurring safety issues of children being out in the sun, or near the water, I talked to safety-minded pediatric emergency room doctors about what was worrying them, as they thought about the children they might be seeing during their shifts over the coming weeks, and I specified that I wasn’t asking about Covid-19 infection — I was asking about other dangers to children, in this summer shadowed by that virus.
2020-08-10.headline_main: When Things Aren’t OK With a Child’s Mental Health

2020-08-10.abstract: Usually during an economic downturn, people tend to spend less on health care for pets. This time, the opposite is happening.
2020-08-10.snippet: Usually during an economic downturn, people tend to spend less on health care for pets. This time, the opposite is happening.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The human health care system has struggled financially through the coronavirus pandemic, losing billions from the cancellations of lucrative elective operations as patients were first told to stay away from hospitals and then were leery of setting foot in one.
2020-08-10.headline_main: A Rare Economic Bright Spot in the U.S. Health System: The Vet’s Office

2020-08-10.snippet: While Joe Biden has criticized the largest tech companies, his campaign and transition teams have welcomed allies of Facebook, Google, Amazon and Apple onto its staff and policy groups.

2020-08-10.abstract: It’s hot, Donald Trump is still president, the pandemic is still raging, and did I mention that it’s hot?
2020-08-10.snippet: It’s hot, Donald Trump is still president, the pandemic is still raging, and did I mention that it’s hot?
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — August and February are the two months I like least. August because it’s hot and dry and the wildflowers are mostly spent. February because it’s cold and gray and by February I have lived too long without wildflowers. Thanks to climate change, February doesn’t get all that cold anymore, though it’s still gray. February will always be gray in Middle Tennessee.
2020-08-10.headline_main: I Have a Cure for the Dog Days of Summer

2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: There’s a new kind of light fixture elbowing its way into territory once dominated by the chandelier. You may have already spotted it, spreading out above dining tables and cascading down stairwells: the multi-light pendant.

2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: When the coronavirus pandemic first hit in March, many technology start-ups braced themselves for The End, as business dried up, venture capitalists warned of dark times ahead and restructuring experts predicted the beginning of a “great unwinding” after a decade-long boom.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Start-ups braced for the worst, but the worst never came.

2020-08-10.abstract: Marina Moscone makes elegant women’s wear that privileges handcraft and meticulous attention to detail.
2020-08-10.snippet: Marina Moscone makes elegant women’s wear that privileges handcraft and meticulous attention to detail.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: When the New York-based women’s wear designer Marina Moscone was 3, she stole her father’s burgundy leather briefcase and used it to carry around the sketches she made wherever she went. Not long after, she announced to her parents that she was becoming a fashion designer. A few years later, at age 7, she decided that she would eventually move from her native Vancouver, British Columbia, to New York to study at the Parsons School of Design. She had learned about the school while watching reruns of the Canadian TV show “Fashion File.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: A Designer Who Got Her Discipline From Dance

2020-08-10.abstract: The Jamaica-born, London-based Amber Pinkerton makes stylish pictures that lead with her subjects’ humanity.
2020-08-10.snippet: The Jamaica-born, London-based Amber Pinkerton makes stylish pictures that lead with her subjects’ humanity.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Amber Pinkerton never intended for her work to be a commentary on racism, classism or colorism, but perhaps more than any other medium, photography has an uncanny ability to reflect our reality back to us in ways both beautiful and stark. Pinkerton grew up in a creative family in what she describes as a comfortable “bubble” within uptown Kingston, Jamaica. As a child, she would watch her mother making mosaics in the courtyard of their home, her aunts sewing clothes and her older brother sketching anime characters.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Rising Photographer Inspired by Her Home Country

2020-08-10.abstract: The florist creates a wild, sculptural arrangement of plants including golden rain tree, oats, artichoke flowers and green persimmons.
2020-08-10.snippet: The florist creates a wild, sculptural arrangement of plants including golden rain tree, oats, artichoke flowers and green persimmons.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The florist creates a wild, sculptural arrangement of plants including golden rain tree, oats, artichoke flowers and green persimmons.

2020-08-10.abstract: At Cosme, Atla and now Elio, she has reimagined both Mexican cuisine and how professional kitchens are run.
2020-08-10.snippet: At Cosme, Atla and now Elio, she has reimagined both Mexican cuisine and how professional kitchens are run.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: “Can you hug?” This was one of the countless questions the chef Daniela Soto-Innes had to ask herself in May while turning Atla, her contemporary Mexican all-day cafe in New York’s NoHo neighborhood, into a takeout spot that could operate effectively while keeping its staff safe during the pandemic. She and her nine cooks were getting used to working with masks on, but were they allowed to act the way they normally did, she wondered, like some amalgamation of an athletic team and a family? And how could they translate a restaurant built to feel like a laid-back afternoon hangout into an experience people could take home in disposable containers?
2020-08-10.headline_main: Daniela Soto-Innes Is One of the Most Exciting Chefs Working Today

2020-08-10.abstract: Transforming discarded fabrics into forward-looking men’s wear, Priya Ahluwalia draws on her family’s Nigerian and Indian roots.
2020-08-10.snippet: Transforming discarded fabrics into forward-looking men’s wear, Priya Ahluwalia draws on her family’s Nigerian and Indian roots.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: In 1990s South London, a young Priya Ahluwalia would watch as members of her extended family got ready for garage raves, styling themselves in matching two-piece sets, dresses with chain belts and patterned silk shirts. “All the guys wore earrings,” she recalls. “I used to wish I could go party with them, too.” Perhaps her longing helped crystallize these memories, because similar pieces, such as candy-hued sweater vests, vividly patchworked hoodies and jackets made from deconstructed Levi’s, have found their way into some of the 27-year-old British men’s wear designer’s recent collections. In fact, a thread of nostalgia runs through all of Ahluwalia’s designs: In addition to drawing from the aesthetics prominent during her own childhood, she pays homage to those of other cultural epochs, as well as to her family’s Nigerian, Indian and Jamaican heritage and the broader immigrant experience in the United Kingdom.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The British Designer Paying Tribute to the Immigrant Experience

2020-08-10.abstract: Best known for her series of deconstructed flags, Sonya Clark offers poignant, clearsighted reminders of this country’s legacy of racial violence.
2020-08-10.snippet: Best known for her series of deconstructed flags, Sonya Clark offers poignant, clearsighted reminders of this country’s legacy of racial violence.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Sonya Clark’s work is unequivocally political: Her 2019 wall hanging “These days. This country. This history.” consists of the remains of an unraveled American flag onto which the unmistakable X of the Confederate battle flag, also in tatters, has been woven, the two flags hopelessly intertwined. She believes the election of Donald Trump added fuel to her fire, and indeed, these days, as we witness the continuing state-sanctioned murder of Black people, her work feels especially relevant. Yet the western Massachusetts-based Clark, 53, isn’t making work for the news cycle. While some political art can, like Trump himself, feel temporary, a product of and for its time, Clark’s goes to the root of longstanding injustices and hypocrisies woven, if not into the actual flag, then into the metaphorical fabric of American culture.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Artist Unraveling American History

2020-08-10.abstract: Eschewing a Western definition of modernity, Mariam Kamara instead conceives of buildings and spaces that account for how people really live.
2020-08-10.snippet: Eschewing a Western definition of modernity, Mariam Kamara instead conceives of buildings and spaces that account for how people really live.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: At age 6, the architect Mariam Kamara moved with her family from Niamey, the capital of Niger, deep into the country’s vast Saharan interior, not far from the 15th-century city of Agadez, where the narrow streets of the historic center are lined with centuries-old houses built from rust-red adobe. During their five years in the desert, Kamara and her father, a mining engineer, traveled frequently into the nearby mountains, where they visited caves rich with neolithic paintings and polished stone, remnants of a time when the area was green and populated by nomads. “This open archaeological site really gave me a sense of what my region is about,” says Kamara, 41, who splits her time between Providence, R.I., where her husband is a professor of computer science at Brown University, and Niamey, where her firm, Atelier Masomi, has operated since 2014. “It’s not the story we’re fed about Africa being this place with no history.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: In Niger, an Architect Looking to the Country’s Design Traditions

2020-08-10.abstract: Interspersing found footage with original interviews, Ja’Tovia Gary makes poetic video works that elucidate the realities of racial injustice — and how the country might change.
2020-08-10.snippet: Interspersing found footage with original interviews, Ja’Tovia Gary makes poetic video works that elucidate the realities of racial injustice — and how the country might change.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Ti’jhae Beecher is 7 years old when she happens upon the artist and filmmaker Ja’Tovia Gary on the corner of West 116th Street and Malcolm X Boulevard in Harlem in 2019. Gary, flanked by a camera crew and with a microphone in hand, had stopped her to ask a simple question: “Do you feel safe?” Beecher, who is standing with her grandfather, answers yes and proceeds to tell Gary about how she feels prepared to leave the house every day, but that there are times when she is upset about having to wake up early for school. Gary agrees that waking up early is, in fact, the worst, and then asks Beecher if, for the most part, she feels good. Beecher replies plainly: “I don’t feel like I’m in danger.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Artist and Filmmaker Envisioning a Safer World for Black Women

2020-08-10.abstract: With her paisley prints and contemporary silhouettes, Paria Farzaneh shares her singular perspective with an ever-widening audience.
2020-08-10.snippet: With her paisley prints and contemporary silhouettes, Paria Farzaneh shares her singular perspective with an ever-widening audience.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: This past January, during men’s fashion week in London, the designer Paria Farzaneh invited guests to an East London boys’ school for an Iranian wedding. A bride sat onstage in a traditional white lace gown before a banquet of Persian pastries and urns overflowing with pastel-colored roses and baby’s breath. The groom, seated next to her, wore a paisley-printed ski jacket, its high, mouth-covering neck pre-empting the protective masks of the pandemic. An older community leader in a black suit presided over the faux ceremony in Farsi, as the viewers sat divided by gender — men on one side of the aisle, women on the other, though the men outnumbered the women and ended up infringing on their section. This was a deliberate move on Farzaneh’s part intended to highlight the power imbalance she feels in her industry — where a woman truly at the helm of her own brand is still something of a rarity — and was typical of the subtle gestures toward the tensions of our present moment that are embedded in her line. At the end of the ceremony, the groom rose and strode down the aisle, followed by a procession of young men dressed in looks from the fall 2020 collection of Farzaneh’s namesake line, which combined the swagger and oversize silhouettes of streetwear with the understated, earthy palette of hand-printed Iranian textiles.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Designer Bringing Traditional Persian Fabrics to British Men’s Wear

2020-08-10.abstract: The Los Angeles-based sculptor repurposes 40 to 50 pieces of clothing to create each one of her wall-mounted works.
2020-08-10.snippet: The Los Angeles-based sculptor repurposes 40 to 50 pieces of clothing to create each one of her wall-mounted works.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles-based sculptor repurposes 40 to 50 pieces of clothing to create each one of her wall-mounted works.

2020-08-10.abstract: Elizabeth Garouste’s richly layered interiors and fantastical furniture are as appealing now as they were when she first caught Paris’s attention in the ’80s.
2020-08-10.snippet: Elizabeth Garouste’s richly layered interiors and fantastical furniture are as appealing now as they were when she first caught Paris’s attention in the ’80s.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: As a girl, the furniture designer and artist Elizabeth Garouste had a profound fear of the furnishings and objects in her home, in Paris’s Montparnasse neighborhood. “I always thought that things around the house would furtively move themselves, that they had their own souls,” she says in her native French. Garouste was born into a Jewish family in 1946, just after World War II ended, and had a grandmother who didn’t mince words when it came to describing the recent atrocities. “I transferred a kind of terror onto everything,” Garouste reflects, “and, really, I may have decided to make furniture as a means of taming those items that I grew up with.” Her primary aim for the pieces she now creates is to endow each with a buoyant personality.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Designer Who Gives Her Pieces Minds of Their Own

2020-08-10.abstract: The artistic polymath has pushed the limits of genre, exploring ideas about gender and politics in nearly every form imaginable.
2020-08-10.snippet: The artistic polymath has pushed the limits of genre, exploring ideas about gender and politics in nearly every form imaginable.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Juliana Huxtable is not one to sit idle. Since graduating from Bard College in 2010, she has leapt between various corners of the New York arts scene: as the host of Shock Value, a semiregular transgender-inclusive party; as a model; as a member of the arts collective House of Ladosha; and as a creator and performer who has both D.J.ed and shown work at major museums. Coming off her last art show — an array of off-kilter multimedia work titled “Interfertility Industrial Complex: Snatch the Calf Back” that opened at Reena Spaulings Fine Art in New York this past fall — her plan was to focus for a bit on her music, traveling the world for D.J. and music gigs she’d lined up in cities ranging from Amsterdam to Novi Sad, Serbia.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Juliana Huxtable’s Next Chapter

2020-08-10.abstract: Drawing on years of research and working with one of Jaipur’s premier enamel artisans, Alice Cicolini makes pieces destined to become talismans.
2020-08-10.snippet: Drawing on years of research and working with one of Jaipur’s premier enamel artisans, Alice Cicolini makes pieces destined to become talismans.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: It’s telling that it was an artifact, not a stone or a vintage bauble, that set the London-based designer Alice Cicolini on her path to making jewelry. Thirteen years ago, while working as the director of arts and culture at the British Council in India, Cicolini traveled to Mehrangarh, a resplendent 15th-century fort and series of palaces with an accompanying museum in Jodhpur. Among the collection of courtly textiles, armory and miniature paintings, a maharani jewelry box caught her eye. “It would have housed many of the things you need to perform solah shringar,” she explains, referring to the ancient Hindu practice of a bride on her wedding day wearing 16 traditional adornments, from bell-embellished anklets to glass and gold bangles. “The box itself was fairly ordinary looking, but the idea of what its contents constituted was magic to me.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Jewelry Designer Inspired by Ancient Rituals and Artifacts

2020-08-10.abstract: The Los Angeles-based fashion designer hand-embroiders a T-shirt from No Sesso’s spring 2020 collection.
2020-08-10.snippet: The Los Angeles-based fashion designer hand-embroiders a T-shirt from No Sesso’s spring 2020 collection.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles-based fashion designer hand-embroiders a T-shirt from No Sesso’s spring 2020 collection.
2020-08-10.headline_main: T Process | Pierre Davis

2020-08-10.abstract: Each of Aiko Hachisuka’s intricate, hand-stitched pieces is a meditation on memory, materiality and domestic labor.
2020-08-10.snippet: Each of Aiko Hachisuka’s intricate, hand-stitched pieces is a meditation on memory, materiality and domestic labor.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: When, as a young girl in Nagoya, Japan, Aiko Hachisuka observed her mother and grandmother sewing, she didn’t quite know what they were doing — maybe mending a sock or attaching buttons, she thinks now — but she was keenly aware that they were not to be disturbed. “I was very attracted to that focus, and the creative headspace that they were in,” she says. It was the closest thing to a studio practice that she had been exposed to. “I knew I needed to have work myself,” she says. “My first attempt at that was to go and buy a sketchbook.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Artist Making Bulbous, Colorful Sculptures Out of Thrifted Clothes

2020-08-10.abstract: With help from those in her creative community, Pierre Davis has created a truly inclusive brand in No Sesso.
2020-08-10.snippet: With help from those in her creative community, Pierre Davis has created a truly inclusive brand in No Sesso.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: One February during New York Fashion Week, rays of sunlight poured through the windows of Chelsea’s Pier 59 Studios, setting off a glimmer of rhinestones across the butt of a belly-bearing gray velour tracksuit. As the model Maya Monés, her ’60s-inspired shoulder-length wig flipped upward at the ends, made the customary spin at the edge of the catwalk, she brushed her palms across two short words spelled out by the gems, the declaration of a singular presence: “No Sesso.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: A Designer Making Clothes for Black Femmes — and for Everyone Else, Too

2020-08-10.abstract: Using unexpected materials to create lush arrangements, Sophia Moreno-Bunge brings the Californian wilderness indoors.
2020-08-10.snippet: Using unexpected materials to create lush arrangements, Sophia Moreno-Bunge brings the Californian wilderness indoors.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Sophia Moreno-Bunge sees possibilities for floral design everywhere: in mushrooms, seaweed, driftwood, bread, tomatoes on the vine. “It’s the weird, overlooked, maybe forgotten things,” she says of the materials that capture her imagination and coalesce in unexpected arrangements that might combine plumes of papyrus, say, with waxy chartreuse anthuriums and a branch of ripening green lemons. Indeed, Moreno-Bunge is part of a new wave of designers — among them the Berlin-based studio Mary Lennox and the New York-based Joshua Werber — for whom the term florist seems too narrow a definition; they’re artists who not only confirm the obvious appeal of blooms but also reveal the magnificence of their landscapes’ less flamboyant elements: leaves, vegetables, seedpods, weeds and humble grasses.
2020-08-10.headline_main: A Floral Designer Who Forages in the Hills of Malibu

2020-08-10.abstract: Working out of her California kitchen, Sonoko Sakai pays homage to Japanese culinary traditions through recipes, food activism and intimate classes.
2020-08-10.snippet: Working out of her California kitchen, Sonoko Sakai pays homage to Japanese culinary traditions through recipes, food activism and intimate classes.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Wandering among the artisanal shops of Kamakura, Japan, with her grandmother, a young Sonoko Sakai used to watch with fascination as tofu makers, tea roasters and rice millers crafted their products by hand. There was a fishmonger who delicately sliced and dried his fish on wire mesh screens, and a senbei (rice cracker) maker who sat on a tatami mat turning over each crisp, aromatic disc with chopsticks above a charcoal grill.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Acclaimed Soba Maker Who Champions Home Cooking

2020-08-10.snippet: The city briefly raised most of the bridges to the main shopping and business district. Mayor Lori Lightfoot condemned the crowd’s actions as “abject criminal behavior.”

2020-08-10.abstract: 🗣 It’s a relatively light week for earnings, with a majority of the S&P 500 having already reported their latest quarterly results. Notable releases include Simon Property Group on Monday; InterContinental Hotels and SoftBank on Tuesday; Cisco, Lyft and Tencent on Wednesday; and Applied Materials and Deutsche Telekom on Thursday.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: 🗣 It’s a relatively light week for earnings, with a majority of the S&P 500 having already reported their latest quarterly results. Notable releases include Simon Property Group on Monday; InterContinental Hotels and SoftBank on Tuesday; Cisco, Lyft and Tencent on Wednesday; and Applied Materials and Deutsche Telekom on Thursday.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Here’s the business news to watch this week.

2020-08-10.abstract: Tom Rauffenbart had resolved to create a tribute to his partner, the artist David Wojnarowicz. A sewing circle of women took up the cause for both men, stitching through lockdown.
2020-08-10.snippet: Tom Rauffenbart had resolved to create a tribute to his partner, the artist David Wojnarowicz. A sewing circle of women took up the cause for both men, stitching through lockdown.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Since the fall of 2019, six women, some from the art world, others retired social workers, had labored on two AIDS quilts devoted to the memories of the artist David Wojnarowicz and his partner, Tom Rauffenbart. The women converged from all over New York City on the neighborhood of Washington Heights, at the home of Anita Vitale, who had met Mr. Rauffenbart, a fellow social worker, in the 1980s.
2020-08-10.headline_main: AIDS Quilts for an Artist and His Partner, Sewn During a New Pandemic

2020-08-10.abstract: A two-bedroom cottage in Oakland, a 1940 house in Sacramento and a two-bedroom condominium in Culver City.
2020-08-10.snippet: A two-bedroom cottage in Oakland, a 1940 house in Sacramento and a two-bedroom condominium in Culver City.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: A two-bedroom cottage in Oakland, a 1940 house in Sacramento and a two-bedroom condominium in Culver City.
2020-08-10.headline_main: What You Get for $630,000 in California

2020-08-10.abstract: A two-bedroom cottage in Oakland, a 1940 house in Sacramento and a two-bedroom condominium in Culver City.
2020-08-10.snippet: A two-bedroom cottage in Oakland, a 1940 house in Sacramento and a two-bedroom condominium in Culver City.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: This house, at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac in the Fruitvale neighborhood, is within walking distance of a pocket park and an athletic field, as well as a public elementary school. Less than a mile away is Peralta Hacienda Historical Park, a complex that includes the footprints of two adobe homes built in the early 19th century and an 1870 farmhouse where there are exhibits on local history and culture. The nearest BART station is about a 10-minute drive, and downtown Oakland is about 15 minutes away by car.
2020-08-10.headline_main: $630,000 Homes in California

2020-08-10.abstract: The E.P.A. has approved nootkatone, which is found in cedars and grapefruit. It repels ticks, mosquitoes and other dangerous bugs for hours, but is safe enough to eat.
2020-08-10.snippet: The E.P.A. has approved nootkatone, which is found in cedars and grapefruit. It repels ticks, mosquitoes and other dangerous bugs for hours, but is safe enough to eat.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Adding a new weapon to the fight against insect-borne illnesses like Lyme disease and malaria, the Environmental Protection Agency on Monday approved a new chemical that both repels and kills ticks and mosquitoes.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Citrus Flavoring Is Weaponized Against Insect-Borne Diseases

2020-08-10.abstract: The fast-food chain said Steve Easterbrook, who was fired last fall, concealed evidence during an investigation into his conduct.
2020-08-10.snippet: The fast-food chain said Steve Easterbrook, who was fired last fall, concealed evidence during an investigation into his conduct.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Eight months had passed since McDonald’s fired its chief executive, Steve Easterbrook, for sexting with a subordinate. Mr. Easterbrook had apologized and walked away with tens of millions in compensation, and the fast-food chain had moved on under a new chief executive.
2020-08-10.headline_main: McDonald’s Sues Former C.E.O., Accusing Him of Lying and Fraud

2020-08-10.abstract: David Haas, a composer known for “Blest Are They,” “We Are Called,” “You Are Mine” and other favorites, has been accused of sexual abuse and harassment by multiple women, an advocacy group says.
2020-08-10.snippet: David Haas, a composer known for “Blest Are They,” “We Are Called,” “You Are Mine” and other favorites, has been accused of sexual abuse and harassment by multiple women, an advocacy group says.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Several Roman Catholic archdioceses have banned a well-known liturgical composer from performing in their churches and many others have stopped playing his music after dozens of women accused him of sexual misconduct and harassment over more than 40 years.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Catholic Churches Drop Hymns After Accusations Against Composer

2020-08-10.abstract: Daniel Snyder is seeking documents from a former employee to bolster his case asserting a campaign to damage him is being waged as shareholders seek to sell their stake in the team.
2020-08-10.snippet: Daniel Snyder is seeking documents from a former employee to bolster his case asserting a campaign to damage him is being waged as shareholders seek to sell their stake in the team.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Daniel Snyder, the owner of the Washington Football Team, has accused a disgruntled former team employee of taking money and assisting in a campaign to spread damaging information against him, his latest effort to fight back attacks on his ownership of the N.F.L. club.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Washington N.F.L. Team Owner Files Claims Hinting at a Conspiracy

2020-08-10.abstract: Sometimes it feels like the only pleasure available in the day is cooking.
2020-08-10.snippet: Sometimes it feels like the only pleasure available in the day is cooking.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Good morning. How are you doing? It’s been five months now, for some of us, living and working at home, or living at home and doing essential work out in the world, or living at home and not working anywhere. We’re stuck with the kids, the parents, the pod or ourselves alone, together apart, apart together. Grocery runs, a wait at the post office, protests, gas for the truck. Sometimes it feels as if the only pleasure available in the day comes when we can step away, finally, to cook, to make something delicious, something to take our minds off the state of the world.
2020-08-10.headline_main: How Are You Doing?

2020-08-10.abstract: The blending of athletes’ #WeAreUnited and #WeWantToPlay campaigns showed students asserting themselves in ways that have been uncommon (and often stifled) in college sports.
2020-08-10.snippet: The blending of athletes’ #WeAreUnited and #WeWantToPlay campaigns showed students asserting themselves in ways that have been uncommon (and often stifled) in college sports.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Five years ago this month, a push to unionize college football players ended in defeat.
2020-08-10.headline_main: In Push to Play, College Football Stars Show Sudden Unity

2020-08-10.abstract: Delta’s foray into oil refining illustrates some of the reasons the business was in trouble even before the pandemic.
2020-08-10.snippet: Delta’s foray into oil refining illustrates some of the reasons the business was in trouble even before the pandemic.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Jet fuel is known as the Steady Eddie of the refinery business, a predictable profit maker that balances the seasonal gyrations of gasoline and diesel sales. But for airlines, it is a headache — a big and unpredictable expense that confounds managers.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Delta Air Lines Bought an Oil Refinery. It Didn’t Go as Planned.

2020-08-10.abstract: How would Nashville be different if it hadn’t pushed the trio away? A conversation about “Gaslighter” and beyond.
2020-08-10.snippet: How would Nashville be different if it hadn’t pushed the trio away? A conversation about “Gaslighter” and beyond.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: After the killing of George Floyd and the protests for racial justice that followed, the Dixie Chicks finally unloaded their old name because of its unwelcome associations with the Old South. After rebranding as the Chicks, the group released “Gaslighter,” its first new album in 14 years.
2020-08-10.headline_main: The Welcome Return of the Chicks

2020-08-10.abstract: Three brick rowhouses were destroyed in the blast, and firefighters searched by hand for more people who might be trapped in the pile of wreckage.
2020-08-10.snippet: Three brick rowhouses were destroyed in the blast, and firefighters searched by hand for more people who might be trapped in the pile of wreckage.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: A gas explosion leveled three rowhouses in a northwest Baltimore neighborhood on Monday morning, leaving at least two people dead and at least seven others injured, the authorities said.
2020-08-10.headline_main: 2 Dead and at Least 7 Injured in Baltimore Gas Explosion

2020-08-10.abstract: Need to go to the dentist? Here is some guidance for taking care of your teeth during a pandemic.
2020-08-10.snippet: Need to go to the dentist? Here is some guidance for taking care of your teeth during a pandemic.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Need to go to the dentist? Here is some guidance for taking care of your teeth during a pandemic.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Going to the Dentist During a Pandemic

2020-08-10.abstract: City leaders and public health officials are now seeing protests outside their own homes, with some protesters wielding bullhorns, spray paint, and even eggs and paintballs.
2020-08-10.snippet: City leaders and public health officials are now seeing protests outside their own homes, with some protesters wielding bullhorns, spray paint, and even eggs and paintballs.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — The city was exploring a proposal to cut 50 percent of the police department’s budget to promote racial justice and alternatives to policing last month, but Debora Juarez, the first enrolled Native American on the Seattle City Council, was not yet willing to throw her support behind such a steep cut without a plan for how to carry it out.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Taking Protest to the Streets, and the Mayor’s Front Door

2020-08-10.abstract: Amazon said it was rebranding Twitch Prime, in another attempt to crack the video game market after a big-budget game effort failed.
2020-08-10.snippet: Amazon said it was rebranding Twitch Prime, in another attempt to crack the video game market after a big-budget game effort failed.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: BERKELEY, Calif. — Amazon stumbled as it worked to break into the lucrative video game industry. Now it’s trying again.
2020-08-10.headline_main: After a Flop, Amazon Makes Another Foray Into Video Games

2020-08-10.abstract: The cabinet stepped down as fury over a giant explosion last week in Beirut spurred new protests.
2020-08-10.snippet: The cabinet stepped down as fury over a giant explosion last week in Beirut spurred new protests.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Lebanon’s cabinet resigned on Monday, opening up new political uncertainty as the country struggles with a crippling economic crisis and reels from an enormous explosion last week that ravaged swaths of the capital.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Lebanon’s Government Resigns Amid Widespread Anger Over Blast

2020-08-10.abstract: Lawyers for the president said a subpoena seeking eight years of tax returns amounted to illegal “harassment.”
2020-08-10.snippet: Lawyers for the president said a subpoena seeking eight years of tax returns amounted to illegal “harassment.”
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: President Trump, seeking to block a subpoena for his tax returns, plans to ask a federal judge to order the Manhattan district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., to disclose details about his investigation into the president’s business practices, according to a letter filed on Monday.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Trump Moves to Force Manhattan D.A. to Reveal Details of Inquiry

2020-08-10.abstract: A look at one of the entries from last week’s puzzles that stumped our solvers.
2020-08-10.snippet: A look at one of the entries from last week’s puzzles that stumped our solvers.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The Danish-American journalist, photographer and author Jacob RIIS (1849-1914) has been in the New York Times Crossword 180 times, most recently in Jacob Stulberg’s puzzle on Tuesday, Aug. 4.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Who the Heck Is That?

2020-08-10.abstract: We usually think of insects as meals for vertebrates such as frogs. But arthropods may turn the tables more often than you think.
2020-08-10.snippet: We usually think of insects as meals for vertebrates such as frogs. But arthropods may turn the tables more often than you think.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Epomis beetle larvae look delicious to frogs. They’re snack-size, like little protein packs. If a frog is nearby, a larva will even wiggle its antennae and mandibles alluringly.
2020-08-10.headline_main: When Bugs Crawl Up the Food Chain

2020-08-10.abstract: With Congress at an impasse on stimulus talks, disarray over resuming negotiations bodes poorly for reaching a deal this week.
2020-08-10.snippet: With Congress at an impasse on stimulus talks, disarray over resuming negotiations bodes poorly for reaching a deal this week.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Governors across the United States struggled on Monday with how to make good on President Trump’s order that their economically battered states deliver billions more in unemployment benefits to jobless residents.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Governors Say Trump’s Order on Pandemic Relief Could Wreck State Budgets

2020-08-10.abstract: A beach house, a suburban home, a home without children, a home filled with family: These days, everyone wants something that someone else has.
2020-08-10.snippet: A beach house, a suburban home, a home without children, a home filled with family: These days, everyone wants something that someone else has.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: When the coronavirus hit France, Leila Slimani, a popular French-Moroccan novelist, and her family left Paris for their country home. Once there, Ms. Slimani began writing a quarantine diary for the newspaper Le Monde. The response, especially from people in teeny Parisian apartments, was so scathing, she apparently abandoned the series. When the billionaire David Geffen posted photos of his mega-yacht on Instagram while he quarantined in the Grenadines, the backlash led him to turn his account private.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Quarantine Envy Got You Down? You’re Not Alone

2020-08-10.abstract: A collection of short solo works from the Weston Playhouse furthers the redefinition of theater online — and of life in isolation.
2020-08-10.snippet: A collection of short solo works from the Weston Playhouse furthers the redefinition of theater online — and of life in isolation.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Five months into internet exile, playgoers have a lot of questions. Two of the biggest for me are: Is what we’re seeing online really theater? And why so many monologues?
2020-08-10.headline_main: Review: Packing 14 Up-to-the-Minute Monologues in ‘One Room’

2020-08-10.abstract: David Mikics’s entry in the Jewish Lives series captures the greatness of the director of “2001,” “The Shining” and other classics.
2020-08-10.snippet: David Mikics’s entry in the Jewish Lives series captures the greatness of the director of “2001,” “The Shining” and other classics.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: Pauline Kael was no fan of Stanley Kubrick’s movies. She deplored his “arctic spirit.” She compared “A Clockwork Orange” to the work of a Teutonic professor. In her review of “2001: A Space Odyssey,” she wrote: “It’s a bad, bad sign when a movie director begins to think of himself as a mythmaker.”
2020-08-10.headline_main: ‘Stanley Kubrick,’ a Brisk New Biography of a Major Talent

2020-08-10.abstract: The Federal Reserve released detailed data on Monday on its first-ever attempt to get loans to midsize businesses, and the figures show that the program is reaching a diverse — if tiny — set of borrowers.
2020-08-10.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve released detailed data on Monday on its first-ever attempt to get loans to midsize businesses, and the figures show that the program is reaching a diverse — if tiny — set of borrowers.
2020-08-10.headline_main: Fed’s Main Street program funneled its first loans to casinos, roofers and dentists.

2020-08-10.abstract: The police in Hong Kong arrested the pro-democracy media mogul Jimmy Lai, becoming the most high-profile person detained under China’s sweeping legislation.
2020-08-10.snippet: The police in Hong Kong arrested the pro-democracy media mogul Jimmy Lai, becoming the most high-profile person detained under China’s sweeping legislation.
