2020-08-12.abstract: Our critic looks in on a photographer in Los Angeles, a museum in Cape Town, fierce young critics in London and culture workers who are out there fighting for beauty and justice.
2020-08-12.snippet: Our critic looks in on a photographer in Los Angeles, a museum in Cape Town, fierce young critics in London and culture workers who are out there fighting for beauty and justice.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: It’s August; an attempt at a fall culture season beckons, somehow, but a sense of great fragmentation persists. On Instagram I see artists and culture workers in Europe behaving more or less normally for the season — that is to say, on vacation. Elsewhere, new horrors have taken over — as in Beirut, where in the wake of a cataclysmic warehouse explosion, artists are sifting through the rubble of devastated gathering spaces and galleries.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Five Art Accounts to Follow on Instagram Now

2020-08-12.abstract: E-commerce is not a purely online activity. It affects our real world, too, in both constructive and potentially harmful ways.
2020-08-12.snippet: E-commerce is not a purely online activity. It affects our real world, too, in both constructive and potentially harmful ways.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Amazon Is So Much Bricks and Mortar

2020-08-12.abstract: Prosecutors say one defendant set fire to a car parked outside the house of a woman who had publicly accused the singer of abuse.
2020-08-12.snippet: Prosecutors say one defendant set fire to a car parked outside the house of a woman who had publicly accused the singer of abuse.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: For more than a year, the singer R. Kelly has been awaiting trial on federal sexual abuse charges, facing the prospect of watching his accusers and former sexual partners testify against him.
2020-08-12.headline_main: R. Kelly Allies Accused of Using Arson and Bribery to Silence Witness

2020-08-12.abstract: Apple Daily, a pro-democracy paper known for celebrity gossip and hard-hitting investigations, has become a target in Beijing’s new national security law in Hong Kong.
2020-08-12.snippet: Apple Daily, a pro-democracy paper known for celebrity gossip and hard-hitting investigations, has become a target in Beijing’s new national security law in Hong Kong.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — After more than 200 police officers raided the newsroom of Hong Kong’s biggest pro-democracy newspaper, Apple Daily, a staff reporter messaged the editor in chief with a question: Should I still go to work?
2020-08-12.headline_main: ‘We Will Persevere’: A Newspaper Faces the Weight of Hong Kong’s Crackdown

2020-08-12.abstract: Musicians have complained about politicians playing their music at events for years. Now, with Mr. Young suing for copyright infringement, they are trying a new strategy.
2020-08-12.snippet: Musicians have complained about politicians playing their music at events for years. Now, with Mr. Young suing for copyright infringement, they are trying a new strategy.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: On Election Day in 2018, Neil Young posted a frustrated statement about President Trump.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Can Neil Young Block Trump From Using His Songs? It’s Complicated

2020-08-12.abstract: Undermined by the pandemic and a deepening economic crisis, and surrounded by sycophants, Aleksandr Lukashenko badly miscalculated in the recent election.
2020-08-12.snippet: Undermined by the pandemic and a deepening economic crisis, and surrounded by sycophants, Aleksandr Lukashenko badly miscalculated in the recent election.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The autocratic leader of Belarus, never a stickler for accurate vote counting, boasted early in his 26-year rule that he was so popular that he had to falsify his share of the vote because the original number — 93.5 percent — was too implausibly high. He said he made it 86 percent instead.
2020-08-12.headline_main: For Belarus Leader, a Fading Aura of Invincibility

2020-08-12.abstract: He embodied the impolite era of the media mogul, a time before streaming, when movie theaters and cable TV were all the rage.
2020-08-12.snippet: He embodied the impolite era of the media mogul, a time before streaming, when movie theaters and cable TV were all the rage.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: Sumner M. Redstone belonged to the Age of the Media Mogul, a time before Apple, Facebook, Amazon and Google, when street-smart executives like Rupert Murdoch, Barry Diller and John Malone brawled in a bid to dominate the world’s screen time.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Sumner Redstone, Hollywood Brawler

2020-08-12.abstract: The fight over a rezoning plan in Brooklyn has pitted progressives and mainstream Democrats against each other.
2020-08-12.snippet: The fight over a rezoning plan in Brooklyn has pitted progressives and mainstream Democrats against each other.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: A plan to bring tens of thousands of jobs to an overlooked corner of the city just outside Manhattan has become another battleground for New York City leaders. Progressives are attacking mainstream Democrats about their competing visions for the city. A powerful business is on the defensive.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Progressives Killed Amazon’s Deal in New York. Is Industry City Next?

2020-08-12.abstract: In an oral history released after his death, the former national security adviser revealed a few key moments in which his ideas failed in the war against Saddam Hussein.
2020-08-12.snippet: In an oral history released after his death, the former national security adviser revealed a few key moments in which his ideas failed in the war against Saddam Hussein.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: By the time he died last week at age 95, Brent Scowcroft had helped steer the nation through some of the most pivotal events of the modern era. As the much-admired national security adviser to two presidents, he became known as the archetype of a foreign policy steward, the model his successors vowed to emulate, though never as successfully.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Regrets? Even Brent Scowcroft Had a Few

2020-08-12.abstract: As Ms. Harris joined the Democratic ticket, the president wasted no time calling her “nasty” and praising the “suburban housewife” he says will vote for him. His views are out of step with reality.
2020-08-12.snippet: As Ms. Harris joined the Democratic ticket, the president wasted no time calling her “nasty” and praising the “suburban housewife” he says will vote for him. His views are out of step with reality.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the hours since Senator Kamala Harris joined the Democratic presidential ticket, President Trump has responded by sorting women into two categories: the good “suburban housewife” he believes will vote for him, and nasty women who have not shown him or his political allies a sufficient amount of respect.
2020-08-12.headline_main: Kamala Harris Crystallizes Trump’s View of Women: They’re ‘Nasty’ or Housewives

2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: The Augusta National Golf Club announced Wednesday that the 2020 Masters Tournament, postponed from its traditional April date to Nov. 12 to 15, will be held without patrons or guests in attendance. The decision was a response to the coronavirus pandemic and came after many other fixtures of the men’s professional golf schedule, including last week’s P.G.A. Championship, the first major championship of this unconventional year, previously were conducted without spectators.

2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: From the moment Bernie Sanders exited the presidential race in early April, many activists, organizers, progressive groups and elected officials had held out hope that Joseph R. Biden Jr. would elevate one of their ideological allies to the vice presidency — someone like Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts or Representative Karen Bass of California. Kamala Harris, an establishment-friendly senator from California and more of a moderate, was near the bottom of their list.

2020-08-12.snippet: For Constance Paige Young, who was among the counterprotesters injured in Charlottesville, it is a moral obligation to continue showing up.
2020-08-12.lead_paragraph: As Americans continue to protest systemic racism, showing up at rallies and demonstrations day after day in many cities across the country, the motivation for sustained activism is both personal and informed by one’s community. How do people keep going? What galvanizes them? For Constance Paige Young, who was among the counterprotesters injured in Charlottesville, Va., three years ago, after a white man drove his car into the crowd, killing one woman, it is a moral obligation to continue showing up.

2020-08-13.abstract: Selena Gomez hosts a cooking show from quarantine. And a new restoration of a 1960 jazz concert film is on Film Forum’s virtual cinema.
2020-08-13.snippet: Selena Gomez hosts a cooking show from quarantine. And a new restoration of a 1960 jazz concert film is on Film Forum’s virtual cinema.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: SELENA + CHEF Stream on HBO Max. At the start of this quarantine cooking program, Selena Gomez makes a confession: “I can’t even fix eggs properly,” she says. The show pairs Gomez with famous chefs who teach her to do that and more. First up: a video call from the French chef and restaurateur Ludo Lefebvre, who instructs Gomez in the finer points of omelet making (a piece of advice: “give a little massage to the eggs with the butter”), before ramping up the difficulty, moving swiftly to soufflé. Other guest chefs during the show’s 10 episodes include Nancy Silverton, Roy Choi and Tanya Holland.
2020-08-13.headline_main: What’s on TV Thursday: ‘Selena + Chef’ and ‘Jazz on a Summer’s Day’

2020-08-13.abstract: Should there be one designated communicator on a trip to a foreign country or deux?
2020-08-13.snippet: Should there be one designated communicator on a trip to a foreign country or deux?
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Chris writes: My wife, Amanda, expects me to communicate whenever we travel to a foreign country. She would not even say merci in Paris! I speak terribly, but I make an earnest effort. I hope to travel again one day. Before then, I’d like Amanda to learn some basic phrases.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on Making an Earnest Effort

2020-08-13.abstract: He was in robust health, but then his legs hurt, he was chronically congested, even his ears became swollen. What could cause all that?
2020-08-13.snippet: He was in robust health, but then his legs hurt, he was chronically congested, even his ears became swollen. What could cause all that?
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: “Wow, brother, you look awful!” the middle-aged woman called out to the 48-year-old man as he made his way slowly to the table. The siblings were from a large, close-knit family, together (back before Covid-19 hit) to celebrate the birthday of their 8-year-old niece. The woman always described her brother as strapping or robust; he now looked neither. He limped toward the table as if his left leg was somehow too weak to carry him. His normally ruddy complexion looked gray. His face looked both thinner — as if he’d lost weight since she last saw him two weeks earlier — but also fatter, his cheeks chipmunk-swollen, especially strange in his otherwise bony face. One of his ears was the only spot of color on him, fire-engine red and oddly enlarged.
2020-08-13.headline_main: He Was an Active Guy. Suddenly His Legs Ached After a Few Blocks.

2020-08-13.abstract: Nick Anderson was paying less than $1,000 a month in Wisconsin before he moved to New York and got acquainted with city prices. Which of these options would you choose?
2020-08-13.snippet: Nick Anderson was paying less than $1,000 a month in Wisconsin before he moved to New York and got acquainted with city prices. Which of these options would you choose?
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Nick Anderson was paying less than $1,000 a month in Wisconsin before he moved to New York and got acquainted with city prices. Which of these options would you choose?
2020-08-13.headline_main: A Midwest Transplant Tries Not to Break the Bank in Manhattan

2020-08-13.abstract: When it comes to nightmare nuptials, “The Guest List” takes the cake.
2020-08-13.snippet: When it comes to nightmare nuptials, “The Guest List” takes the cake.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: REGRETS ONLY Among this summer’s many cancellations: wedding drama of the kind that leads you to gossip with cousins over mini quiche and lukewarm champagne. The British author Lucy Foley appears to have scratched our itch for matrimonial distraction; her runaway best seller, “The Guest List,” is now in its 10th week on the hardcover fiction list, currently at No. 5. This murder mystery revolves around a wedding, which may be the key to its popularity with the socially distanced set. Foley says: “Maybe people are reading it and thinking, ‘Things could be worse. I could be stuck in the middle of nowhere with this lot.’”
2020-08-13.headline_main: Missing Weddings? Lucy Foley’s Sinister Best Seller Will Cheer You Up

2020-08-13.abstract: Of course they are — and this summer, more than ever, indulge in some page-turning escapism.
2020-08-13.snippet: Of course they are — and this summer, more than ever, indulge in some page-turning escapism.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: What a strange summer this has been. The lead-up was an excruciating blend of boredom and heartbreak, and the actuality is a series of quandaries that feel like an unwinnable round of Scruples: Is it safe to eat a burger off your neighbor’s grill? Do you need to wear a mask while biking? Can the virus survive chlorine?
2020-08-13.headline_main: Are They Still Beach Books if You’re Not Reading Them on the Beach?

2020-08-13.abstract: His family often asks me about Black Lives Matter and racism. My boyfriend is annoyed, but I’m happy to teach them.
2020-08-13.snippet: His family often asks me about Black Lives Matter and racism. My boyfriend is annoyed, but I’m happy to teach them.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: I am a young Black woman who’s been quarantining with my white boyfriend for months. It’s been mostly great for us as a couple. When we visit his family nearby, they often ask me about the Black Lives Matter protests, in which we’re participating. I find them genuinely interested, respectful and curious about why expressions like “All Lives Matter” are racist. I’m happy to engage. But my boyfriend gets furious with them! He turns simple questions into big fights. What am I missing?
2020-08-13.headline_main: My Boyfriend Is Mad At His White Parents for Me. But I Don’t Care.

2020-08-13.abstract: It’s hard to savor the joys of first-time motherhood while your brother fights against cancer.
2020-08-13.snippet: It’s hard to savor the joys of first-time motherhood while your brother fights against cancer.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: My family and I organized a Mother’s Day Zoom in May. My mother isn’t much for gifts, but she lives for family together time. In the age of Covid-19, gathering around a screen with me, my dad and two brothers would have to do.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Waiting for My Baby Boy, Worrying About My Baby Brother

2020-08-13.abstract: We never imagined our marriage would be tested so ferociously. Finding the magic again meant mending the tears in our relationship.
2020-08-13.snippet: We never imagined our marriage would be tested so ferociously. Finding the magic again meant mending the tears in our relationship.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Not too long ago, I found myself sitting at a local coffee shop trying to  focus on the task at hand: writing the introduction to an article concerning a unicorn float. You know, the kind that goes in the pool and shows up all over Instagram by people who don’t appear to have any intention of getting wet? I’ve neither owned nor been on a unicorn float at any point in my life, and can’t particularly say I care one way or another about them. However, here I am. What makes this assignment all the more burdensome is that one hour before, my husband of nearly 10 years told me he no longer wanted to be married to me.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Unicorn Floats and a Marriage Deflated

2020-08-13.abstract: The suburban market is booming and Brooklyn is hot.
2020-08-13.snippet: The suburban market is booming and Brooklyn is hot.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The real estate market in New York City and its suburbs has seen huge changes during the pandemic. The near-total shutdown of the industry predictably put it on pause, but the reopening has sparked a booming, competitive seller’s market, at least in the suburbs. Manhattan is lagging, even in comparison to Brooklyn.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Manhattan Real Estate Recovery Lags

2020-08-13.abstract: From a three-figure Casper with “cozy performance” to a $400,000 Hästens Grand Vividus, people seem to be investing in bedtime.
2020-08-13.snippet: From a three-figure Casper with “cozy performance” to a $400,000 Hästens Grand Vividus, people seem to be investing in bedtime.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Linus Adolfsson opened up the Madison Avenue location of Hästens Sleep Spa on March 1. By March 10, he closed the store, which sells high-end beds, and the three locations he owns in Los Angeles with his business partner Carl Larsson. His reaction involved unprintable exclamations of woe.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Boing! Amid Retail’s Sag, a Nice Bounce for Mattress Sales

2020-08-13.abstract: A poem that reminds us there is always more to come.
2020-08-13.snippet: A poem that reminds us there is always more to come.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Poetry forever grants us leaps and blurs. Sometimes it’s not enough to be where we are. Sometimes we need to be everywhere: present with the lost, held by transient blossoms. Jan Beatty’s new poems in “The Body Wars” shimmer with luminous connection, travel a big life and grand map of encounters. Deeper breath feels present in the poem’s original uses of punctuation — stanzas, even a last one, ending with a colon. More to come? Always more. Most important, “he’s not gone” floats by itself, the truth a daughter tunes to. Selected by Naomi Shihab Nye
2020-08-13.headline_main: Poem: My Father Disappears Into Flowers

2020-08-13.abstract: Opinion’s Jeneen Interlandi and Elizabeth Bruenig join the podcast.
2020-08-13.snippet: Opinion’s Jeneen Interlandi and Elizabeth Bruenig join the podcast.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Listen and subscribe to “The Argument” from your mobile device:
2020-08-13.headline_main: Is Individualism America’s Religion?

2020-08-13.abstract: On the unforgettable heartbreak and enduring pleasures of an Italian neorealist masterpiece.
2020-08-13.snippet: On the unforgettable heartbreak and enduring pleasures of an Italian neorealist masterpiece.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: “People should see it — and they should care.” Those are the concluding words to one of the more passionate raves in the annals of New York Times film criticism: Bosley Crowther’s 1949 review of the Italian movie introduced to American audiences as “The Bicycle Thief.”
2020-08-13.headline_main: Why You Should Still Care About ‘Bicycle Thieves’

2020-08-13.abstract: An outdated culture allowed King Juan Carlos I to become a lobbyist for Arab dictatorships and to hide his fortune for decades.
2020-08-13.snippet: An outdated culture allowed King Juan Carlos I to become a lobbyist for Arab dictatorships and to hide his fortune for decades.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: MADRID — One of my first assignments as a reporter, in 1996, was to interview an alleged lover of the king of Spain, Juan Carlos de Borbón y Borbón. My editors at El Mundo asked me to look into whether Bárbara Rey, a Spanish film and television actress, demanded money from the state in exchange for keeping her relationship with the married king secret. In the end, I didn’t get the interview. Under pressure, Ms. Rey chose to remain silent. Thus our king’s two great weaknesses — women and money — remained the country’s worst-kept secret for another two decades.
2020-08-13.headline_main: The Immoral Double Life of the Former King of Spain

2020-08-13.abstract: How college students can stay healthy during an unpredictable fall semester.
2020-08-13.snippet: How college students can stay healthy during an unpredictable fall semester.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: College life was designed around community and togetherness. Now we are attempting to retrofit it for the opposite — with physical distancing, fewer people and the elimination of most in-person gatherings.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Managing Pandemic Health Risks on College Campuses

2020-08-13.abstract: Restoring the rule of law is not the same as “lock her up.”
2020-08-13.snippet: Restoring the rule of law is not the same as “lock her up.”
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Last week, NPR’s Lulu Garcia-Navarro asked Joe Biden whether, if elected, he could envision Donald Trump being prosecuted. Biden replied that the prosecution of a former president would be a “very, very unusual thing” and probably “not very good for democracy.” The former vice president said he would not stand in the way if the Justice Department wanted to bring a case, but when Garcia-Navarro pressed him, he suggested she was trying to bait him into a version of Trump’s threat against his 2016 opponent: “Lock her up.”
2020-08-13.headline_main: After Trump, America Needs Accountability for His Corruption

2020-08-13.abstract: Virtual school will never be a perfect replacement for in-person learning, but there’s a lot of room for improvement.
2020-08-13.snippet: Virtual school will never be a perfect replacement for in-person learning, but there’s a lot of room for improvement.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: It is becoming clear that many of our nation’s children could be attending school from home for this school year and possibly longer. If educators and families aren’t empowered with the right support and tools, this will evolve from an education crisis to an education catastrophe.
2020-08-13.headline_main: I Started Khan Academy. We Can Still Avoid an Education Catastrophe.

2020-08-13.abstract: Every choice on what to do about schooling amid a pandemic is potentially risky or unfair. Even if the problem is systemic, the angst is personal.

2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: It’s the newest front in America’s parenting wars.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Why Parents, With ‘No Good Choice’ This School Year, Are Blaming One Another

2020-08-13.abstract: An appellate court has reinstated a bizarre grab bag of statutes that were invalidated more than three years ago.
2020-08-13.snippet: An appellate court has reinstated a bizarre grab bag of statutes that were invalidated more than three years ago.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Well, that didn’t take long.
2020-08-13.headline_main: We Just Saw the Future of Anti-Abortion Laws

2020-08-13.abstract: Distrust of the president and his motives hardened the conviction of some educators that teaching in person was unsafe, helping drive union opposition.
2020-08-13.snippet: Distrust of the president and his motives hardened the conviction of some educators that teaching in person was unsafe, helping drive union opposition.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In June, with the coronavirus crisis appearing to hit a lull in the United States, teachers and parents around the country finally began feeling optimistic about reopening schools in the fall. Going back into the classroom seemed possible. Districts started to pull together plans. Then came a tweet.
2020-08-13.headline_main: How Trump’s Push to Reopen Schools Backfired

2020-08-13.abstract: He was a Marxist revolutionary and minister in Afghanistan’s short-lived communist government. But Sulaiman Layeq spent the last decades of his life writing an epic poem about an Islamist insurgent.
2020-08-13.snippet: He was a Marxist revolutionary and minister in Afghanistan’s short-lived communist government. But Sulaiman Layeq spent the last decades of his life writing an epic poem about an Islamist insurgent.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — As the Afghan poet and former leftist revolutionary Sulaiman Layeq was suffering from blast wounds that never healed, his verses dried up.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Rebel Poet’s Death Leaves 40 Years of Epic Afghan Work Unfinished

2020-08-13.abstract: Some hedge funds and private equity firms that lent money to property owners are now suing them for falling behind on interest payments.
2020-08-13.snippet: Some hedge funds and private equity firms that lent money to property owners are now suing them for falling behind on interest payments.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Five months into the pandemic, hotel rooms remain largely unreserved, office space sits empty and hardly anyone is venturing into malls. Commercial tenants are struggling to pay their rents, and property owners are struggling to make payments on the loans they took out to finance the buildings.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Worried Lenders Pounce on Landlords Unable to Pay Their Loans

2020-08-13.abstract: They’re the graduates of public universities, and they’ve stepped into the void of presidential leadership.
2020-08-13.snippet: They’re the graduates of public universities, and they’ve stepped into the void of presidential leadership.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Since the Harvard-Yale game that was the 1988 general election, all U.S. presidents, including the Wharton School graduate currently occupying the White House, have been Ivy League alumni. President Gerald Ford (University of Michigan, ’35) often ditched “Hail to the Chief” as his walk-on music and replaced it with his college fight song, but he never won the Electoral College, having assumed the Oval Office after Richard Nixon resigned.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Joe Biden and the Great Leaders of 2020 Are Part of a Club

2020-08-13.abstract: New Jersey is one of seven states where health clubs have been barred from reopening. The governor says it’s too soon, but some gym owners are rebelling.
2020-08-13.snippet: New Jersey is one of seven states where health clubs have been barred from reopening. The governor says it’s too soon, but some gym owners are rebelling.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In an act of defiance, Joe Logue, a retired Marine, affixed a military gas mask and headphones before beginning his chest-and-arm workout at a New Jersey gym that had gone rogue.
2020-08-13.headline_main: They’re Desperate to Reopen Their Gyms, No Matter What the Law Says

2020-08-13.abstract: The contentious debate about whether to play or cancel summer recruiting showcases has resembled the tense and divided national response to the coronavirus itself.
2020-08-13.snippet: The contentious debate about whether to play or cancel summer recruiting showcases has resembled the tense and divided national response to the coronavirus itself.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: FARMINGTON, Conn. — The Middlesex Bears had waited for months to compete in the New England Cup, an elite recruiting showcase for high school girls’ lacrosse players. Already, the coronavirus pandemic had forced a postponement to late July from June and a change of venue. Then a legal battle between the women’s collegiate lacrosse coaching association and the cup’s organizers had threatened to cancel the showcase at the last minute.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Lacrosse Plays On in the Pandemic, Creating Tough Calls for Families

2020-08-13.abstract: The story of her career can be explained, in part, by a series of dramatic moments during congressional hearings and primary debates. Here are five of them.
2020-08-13.snippet: The story of her career can be explained, in part, by a series of dramatic moments during congressional hearings and primary debates. Here are five of them.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The story of the political career of Kamala Harris can be told, in part, by videotape. Ms. Harris has risen to public attention — and more important, risen to the attention of Joseph R. Biden Jr., who picked her as his running mate on Tuesday — because of a series of often dramatic moments during congressional hearings, town halls and primary debates. Here are five of them, with our commentary.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Should Trump and Pence Be Worried About Kamala Harris? Let’s Go to the Tape.

2020-08-13.abstract: Children who lost their parents in the pandemic are fighting to hold on to what is left of their families.
2020-08-13.snippet: Children who lost their parents in the pandemic are fighting to hold on to what is left of their families.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: For the Fryson brothers, the year had begun on a hopeful note. They had finally reunited with their mother, Beatrice McMillian, after years of being in foster care.
2020-08-13.headline_main: He Is 16 and His Mother Died of Covid-19. What Happens To Him Now?

2020-08-13.abstract: When estranged parents take children across borders, a shadowy industry of “recovery agents” can get them back — for a fee.
2020-08-13.snippet: When estranged parents take children across borders, a shadowy industry of “recovery agents” can get them back — for a fee.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: A few days before Christmas 2013, Stuart Dempster hired a car to take him from Bangkok to the rural town of Ban Phai, in northeastern Thailand. Mr. Dempster, a 55-year-old track and field coach from Australia, was accompanied by a tall, burly security contractor. The two men were preparing to abduct Mr. Dempster’s daughter.
2020-08-13.headline_main: The Three Abductions of N.: How Corporate Kidnapping Works

2020-08-13.abstract: The Donmar Warehouse is the first major playhouse in the city to reopen, with a socially distanced sound installation.
2020-08-13.snippet: The Donmar Warehouse is the first major playhouse in the city to reopen, with a socially distanced sound installation.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Finally, some light in the darkness. The Donmar Warehouse has made stage history as the first playhouse here to open its doors to a paying public in the almost five months since the coronavirus lockdown began. Brave? Yes, and, even better, with a brilliant production.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Some Light in the Darkness for London’s West End

2020-08-13.snippet: Since March, more than 2,800 businesses in the city have permanently closed, and others are barely holding on. Even national chains are leaving.

2020-08-13.abstract: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has revived her “go hard, go early” approach as officials grapple with a mysterious cluster that might have originated in a frozen food warehouse.
2020-08-13.snippet: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has revived her “go hard, go early” approach as officials grapple with a mysterious cluster that might have originated in a frozen food warehouse.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia — As the week began, New Zealanders were celebrating 100 days without community spread of the coronavirus, drinking at pubs, packing stadiums and hugging friends.
2020-08-13.headline_main: New Zealand Beat the Virus Once. Can It Do It Again?

2020-08-13.abstract: Cities, towns, retailers and confectioners across the country are bracing themselves for more subdued festivities this year — if they have them at all.
2020-08-13.snippet: Cities, towns, retailers and confectioners across the country are bracing themselves for more subdued festivities this year — if they have them at all.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Times have changed in Salem, Mass., since the 17th century, when 200 people were accused of practicing witchcraft and 20 were executed for it. Today, the city of 43,000 revels in its macabre lore and has turned Halloween into a monthlong celebration where apple cider is consumed by the gallon, potions and herbs promise protection from evil spirits, and countless children and adults roam the streets in search of sugary and spooky delights.
2020-08-13.headline_main: What Scares Salem? October Without Halloween

2020-08-13.abstract: With the delinquency rate on large commercial loans tied to real estate in the United States nearly doubling in just one month, big banks, which are among the largest real estate lenders, have been generally willing to give property owners time to work things out with tenants. A class of smaller lenders are showing their impatience.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: With the delinquency rate on large commercial loans tied to real estate in the United States nearly doubling in just one month, big banks, which are among the largest real estate lenders, have been generally willing to give property owners time to work things out with tenants. A class of smaller lenders are showing their impatience.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Hedge funds and private equity firms gave loans. Now they’re suing.

2020-08-13.abstract: Hollywood has been unable to restart production on its own soundstages in California. So big movie studios, under pressure to get their production assembly lines running again, have focused on overseas shooting. The “Avatar” sequels are filming again in New Zealand. Sony Pictures has “Uncharted,” its adaptation of a popular video game, going in Berlin, report Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes:
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Hollywood has been unable to restart production on its own soundstages in California. So big movie studios, under pressure to get their production assembly lines running again, have focused on overseas shooting. The “Avatar” sequels are filming again in New Zealand. Sony Pictures has “Uncharted,” its adaptation of a popular video game, going in Berlin, report Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes:
2020-08-13.headline_main: How Hollywood is trying to avoid the virus as it restarts filming.

2020-08-13.abstract: And what else you need to know today.
2020-08-13.snippet: And what else you need to know today.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Over three years, the far-right conspiracy theory QAnon has spread from the outskirts of the internet into the mainstream. And by next year, it will most likely make its way into Congress: A QAnon supporter is almost sure to be elected after winning a Republican House primary runoff in Georgia this week.
2020-08-13.headline_main: The Rise of QAnon

2020-08-13.abstract: Is it possible to limit the power of white parents?
2020-08-13.snippet: Is it possible to limit the power of white parents?
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Public education won’t be fair until school systems limit the power of white parents. But is that even possible? Chana finds two schools that are trying to do just that, and both are actually inside the I.S. 293 building. One is downstairs in the basement, where a charter school called Success Academy Cobble Hill opened about seven years ago. The other is upstairs at the newly-renamed Boerum Hill School for International Studies.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Episode Four: ‘Here’s Another Fun Thing You Can Do’

2020-08-13.abstract: Sarah Friar, a native of Northern Ireland, is chief executive of the social network Nextdoor, a sometimes unruly platform aimed at connection.
2020-08-13.snippet: Sarah Friar, a native of Northern Ireland, is chief executive of the social network Nextdoor, a sometimes unruly platform aimed at connection.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Sarah Friar grew up during the Troubles. Raised in a small town in Northern Ireland, she saw neighbors turn against one another in violence, and also come together in solidarity.
2020-08-13.headline_main: A Lifetime of Seeing the Good and the Bad Between Neighbors

2020-08-13.abstract: Electric Jaguars in Oslo, using tech from a former NASA architect, will soon be able to recharge on special pads embedded under the road.
2020-08-13.snippet: Electric Jaguars in Oslo, using tech from a former NASA architect, will soon be able to recharge on special pads embedded under the road.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Starting next year, two dozen specially outfitted electric Jaguar taxis will roam the streets of the very green capital of Norway. And when they are idling at special taxi lines, they will be able to be recharged from the ground up.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Norwegian Taxis, Wirelessly Charging While They Wait for a Fare

2020-08-13.abstract: The president is demanding schools return to in-person learning. Officials are answering that call. But teachers and their unions say many of those plans are unsafe.
2020-08-13.snippet: The president is demanding schools return to in-person learning. Officials are answering that call. But teachers and their unions say many of those plans are unsafe.

2020-08-13.headline_main: Why Teachers Aren’t Ready to Reopen Schools

2020-08-13.abstract: We do not care for the revolutionary spirit to survive the revolution. The revolution, however, goes nowhere without it.
2020-08-13.snippet: We do not care for the revolutionary spirit to survive the revolution. The revolution, however, goes nowhere without it.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In July 1776, George Washington ordered the brand-new Declaration of Independence read aloud to a jubilant New York City crowd. A small group opted to continue their celebration into the evening. Led by an artillery officer, the revelers toppled the colossal, gilded statue of King George III at Bowling Green.
2020-08-13.headline_main: The Boston Tea Party Was More Than That. It Was a Riot.

2020-08-13.abstract: Two of Germany’s biggest corporations reported huge losses on Thursday, illustrating the degree to which the pandemic has pushed companies to the brink.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Two of Germany’s biggest corporations reported huge losses on Thursday, illustrating the degree to which the pandemic has pushed companies to the brink.
2020-08-13.headline_main: 2 German blue chips, a steel maker and a travel giant, both deep in the red.

2020-08-13.abstract: The monster animal, more closely related to American alligators than modern crocodiles, had teeth the size of bananas and a strange enlarged snout.
2020-08-13.snippet: The monster animal, more closely related to American alligators than modern crocodiles, had teeth the size of bananas and a strange enlarged snout.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: They had teeth the size of bananas, were as long as buses and limos, and preyed on dinosaurs that fed near their waterways.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Terror Crocodile’ the Size of a Bus Fed on Dinosaurs, Study Says

2020-08-13.abstract: Nothing like a pandemic to show people we don’t have it all together.
2020-08-13.snippet: Nothing like a pandemic to show people we don’t have it all together.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Every so often a word bubbles to the surface of our cultural consciousness and then it’s seemingly unavoidable. This year, in addition to the term “trauma,” it’s “vulnerability.” (Both are apt for a time of widespread social inequality, illness and unemployment.)
2020-08-13.headline_main: Why Be Vulnerable?

2020-08-13.abstract: A ride-share driver turns serial killer in this depressing social-media thriller.
2020-08-13.snippet: A ride-share driver turns serial killer in this depressing social-media thriller.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Hideous to look at and agonizing to listen to, “Spree” must hold the record for the greatest number of annoying characters in a single movie. Coarsely merging social-media critique and slasher comedy, this shallow take on the evils of internet addiction is as unoriginal as it is unfunny.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Spree’ Review: Desperately Seeking Likes

2020-08-13.abstract: In this documentary, three women, driven by a desire to reshape their communities, seek office.
2020-08-13.snippet: In this documentary, three women, driven by a desire to reshape their communities, seek office.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In “Represent,” a documentary about women in local politics, getting the vote is only part of the battle.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Represent’ Review: Running for Office, and Seeking More Than Votes

2020-08-13.abstract: This British-Dutch thriller heaps on the supporting characters but doesn’t give them much room to breathe.
2020-08-13.snippet: This British-Dutch thriller heaps on the supporting characters but doesn’t give them much room to breathe.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: “The Bay of Silence” takes its name from a spot on the Ligurian coast of Italy. The waters may teem with tasty seafood, but this thriller, about a man trying to make sense of his wife’s tangled past, is a net full of red herrings.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘The Bay of Silence’ Review: Awash With Secrets

2020-08-13.abstract: An inexperienced teenager and her more sophisticated cousin experience a transformative summer in this smart and sultry coming-of-age story.
2020-08-13.snippet: An inexperienced teenager and her more sophisticated cousin experience a transformative summer in this smart and sultry coming-of-age story.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The French nymph, poised on the precipice of womanhood, has long been an art-house cliché, and “An Easy Girl” knows it. Sensual and sly, this fourth feature from Rebecca Zlotowski — after “Planetarium” in 2017 — is both too clever and too subtle to pander to stereotype. So when we see Sofia (the stunning Zahia Dehar) frolic, bare-breasted, in a secluded cove in Cannes, her teasing of Georges Lechaptois’s camera tells us emphatically that she’s no ingénue.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘An Easy Girl’ Review: Carnal Knowledge

2020-08-13.abstract: This Russian sci-fi horror picture strongly advises that what you find in space should stay there.
2020-08-13.snippet: This Russian sci-fi horror picture strongly advises that what you find in space should stay there.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: This creepy Russian sci-fi horror picture does not take its title from the famous satellite the Soviet Union launched in 1957. Rather, it invokes the literal meaning of the word, which translates to English as “companion.”
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Sputnik’ Review: A Return From Space, With a Little Something

2020-08-13.abstract: Paulo Rocha’s 1966 triumph is set in a Portuguese fishing village, where residents live hand-to-mouth.
2020-08-13.snippet: Paulo Rocha’s 1966 triumph is set in a Portuguese fishing village, where residents live hand-to-mouth.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The Portuguese director Paulo Rocha, who died in 2012, created a memorable body of work, with aesthetic roots both in Italian neorealism and the French New Wave. It’s worth exploring in and of itself and with respect to its continuity with Portugal’s cinema as a whole. He’s different from greats like Manoel De Oliveira (with whom he worked as an assistant) and Pedro Costa, but he shares definite affinities with them.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Change of Life’ Review: A Film From a Portuguese Master, Newly Restored

2020-08-13.abstract: Rudy Garcia-Tolson’s attempt to make a fifth Paralympic swim team after three years of retirement was missing a crucial element — a pool where he could train. Enter Special Agent Mulder.
2020-08-13.snippet: Rudy Garcia-Tolson’s attempt to make a fifth Paralympic swim team after three years of retirement was missing a crucial element — a pool where he could train. Enter Special Agent Mulder.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Along with the rest of the world, athletes have had their careers upended by the coronavirus pandemic. They are giving The New York Times an intimate look at their journeys in periodic installments through the rest of the year. Read Garcia-Tolson’s first installments here and here.
2020-08-13.headline_main: He Needed to Train. David Duchovny’s Pool Was Out There.

2020-08-13.abstract: The new running mate played both defense and offense: This is your morning tip sheet.
2020-08-13.snippet: The new running mate played both defense and offense: This is your morning tip sheet.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The first day of the Biden-Harris ticket kicked off like many Biden events this year: late. It’s Thursday, and this is your politics tip sheet. Sign up here to get On Politics in your inbox every weekday.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Harris Offers a Preview of What She’ll Bring

2020-08-13.abstract: An outdoor exhibition of quarantine stories at the New-York Historical Society offers a healing space for emotionally drained New Yorkers. The museum invites visitors to record their own experiences.
2020-08-13.snippet: An outdoor exhibition of quarantine stories at the New-York Historical Society offers a healing space for emotionally drained New Yorkers. The museum invites visitors to record their own experiences.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: What will it take for New Yorkers to process the events of the past few months — the emotional toll of thousands of deaths, social unrest, economic insecurity and the abrupt cessation of life as we knew it? The New-York Historical Society is hoping a new exhibition, humble but moving, can offer a space for some of our feelings to catch up with us.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Tales of Hope and Resilience as a Museum Reopens

2020-08-13.abstract: After a disputed election, the police cracked down violently on protests. But demonstrations continued, calling for the longtime president to resign.
2020-08-13.snippet: After a disputed election, the police cracked down violently on protests. But demonstrations continued, calling for the longtime president to resign.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: After the longtime president of Belarus, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, claimed 80 percent of the vote in what many Western governments said was a sham election in August, protesters across the country have continued to turn out in droves, only to be met with a fierce police crackdown as the government tries to maintain its grip on power.
2020-08-13.headline_main: What’s Happening in Belarus?

2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In the hours since Kamala Harris joined the Democratic presidential ticket, President Trump has responded by sorting women into two categories: the good “suburban housewife” he believes will vote for him, and nasty women who have not shown him or his political allies sufficient respect.

2020-08-13.abstract: The violence appeared aimed at scaring off protesters who have taken to the streets since Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, an authoritarian, claimed victory in last weekend’s election.
2020-08-13.snippet: The violence appeared aimed at scaring off protesters who have taken to the streets since Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, an authoritarian, claimed victory in last weekend’s election.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: MINSK, Belarus — Accounts of violent beatings of protesters and mass detentions mounted in Belarus on Thursday as the country’s embattled president, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, deployed brute force to cling to power.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Mass Beatings and Detentions in Belarus as President Clings to Power

2020-08-13.abstract: A global “stalling of mobility,” especially in air travel, has prompted the International Energy Agency to make a slight downgrade in its forecast for oil demand in 2020. The agency said Thursday that demand would fall by 8.1 million barrels a day in 2020, 140,000 barrels lower than last month’s prediction.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: A global “stalling of mobility,” especially in air travel, has prompted the International Energy Agency to make a slight downgrade in its forecast for oil demand in 2020. The agency said Thursday that demand would fall by 8.1 million barrels a day in 2020, 140,000 barrels lower than last month’s prediction.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Air travel is recovering slower than expected, energy agency says.

2020-08-13.abstract: The framework, unlikely to be taken up before the election, proposes protections for athletes who have asserted themselves during the pandemic and sought more ways to earn money.
2020-08-13.snippet: The framework, unlikely to be taken up before the election, proposes protections for athletes who have asserted themselves during the pandemic and sought more ways to earn money.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: College athletes who have asserted themselves in recent months on many issues, including social justice matters, the right to cash in on their fame, and improved health and safety conditions if they are to play football this fall during the pandemic, gained powerful backing on Wednesday with Democratic senators announcing a framework for a college athletes’ bill of rights that would support those causes.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Democratic Senators Suggest Bill of Rights for College Athletes

2020-08-13.abstract: Using crowd-control weapons, agents were able to extract people who were detained on one of the buses after hundreds of protesters in Bend, Ore., blocked the vehicles from moving.
2020-08-13.snippet: Using crowd-control weapons, agents were able to extract people who were detained on one of the buses after hundreds of protesters in Bend, Ore., blocked the vehicles from moving.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Dozens of federal agents were deployed in Bend, Ore., late Wednesday after protesters stood for hours to block the path of buses that held two people who had been seized by immigration agents, according to witnesses and videos from the scene.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Protesters Blocked ICE Buses in Oregon. Federal Agents Responded in Force.

2020-08-13.headline_main: He Wasn’t Toscanini, but He Made Orchestras Sing

2020-08-13.abstract: She is adding sizzle, bringing in lots of cash, carving out an anti-Trump role and seemingly confounding the Republican opposition.
2020-08-13.snippet: She is adding sizzle, bringing in lots of cash, carving out an anti-Trump role and seemingly confounding the Republican opposition.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: When Joseph R. Biden Jr. dialed up Senator Kamala Harris on a videoconference call and asked her The Question — “You ready to go to work?” he said, to which she replied, “Oh my God, I am so ready” — his choice as vice president was a well-kept secret but hardly a surprise.
2020-08-13.headline_main: 5 Takeaways From Kamala Harris’s First Full Day on the Biden Ticket

2020-08-13.abstract: A rather conventional documentary about a fashion designer whose creations were anything but.
2020-08-13.snippet: A rather conventional documentary about a fashion designer whose creations were anything but.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: You can count on one hand the number of photos of the Belgian fashion designer Martin Margiela on the internet. Which is to say that the first documentary about his life and career is called “Martin Margiela: In His Own Words” for a reason — he is the film’s narrator, offering sensible and diligent assessments of his own work and gosh-golly takes on his influence, but not much more. Only his hands — lovely, patient — appear onscreen.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Martin Margiela: In His Own Words’ Review: A Visionary’s Handiwork

2020-08-13.abstract: He led The Detroit Free Press at 33, then gave up journalism for Hollywood. “Absence of Malice” was one result; an Oscar for “Out of Africa” was another.
2020-08-13.snippet: He led The Detroit Free Press at 33, then gave up journalism for Hollywood. “Absence of Malice” was one result; an Oscar for “Out of Africa” was another.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Kurt Luedtke, a former newspaper executive who forged a successful second career writing Hollywood screenplays, notably for “Absence of Malice” and the Oscar-winning “Out of Africa,” died on Sunday at a hospital in Royal Oak, Mich. He was 80.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Kurt Luedtke, Newspaperman Turned Screenwriter, Dies at 80

2020-08-13.abstract: It took him decades before he felt comfortable sharing the horrors he witnessed during the Holocaust. He died of the coronavirus.
2020-08-13.snippet: It took him decades before he felt comfortable sharing the horrors he witnessed during the Holocaust. He died of the coronavirus.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.
2020-08-13.headline_main: David Galante, Who Spoke Belatedly About Auschwitz, Dies at 96

2020-08-13.abstract: In March and April, death rates rivaled those seen during the country’s deadliest pandemic, a new study finds. “What 1918 looked like is basically this.”
2020-08-13.snippet: In March and April, death rates rivaled those seen during the country’s deadliest pandemic, a new study finds. “What 1918 looked like is basically this.”
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: The 1918 influenza pandemic is the deadliest in modern history, claiming an estimated 50 million lives worldwide, including 675,000 in the United States.
2020-08-13.headline_main: In N.Y.C.’s Spring Virus Surge, a Frightening Echo of 1918 Flu

2020-08-13.abstract: President Trump announced that Israel and the United Arab Emirates would establish “full normalization of relations” and that in exchange Israel would forgo for now “declaring sovereignty” over occupied West Bank territory.
2020-08-13.snippet: President Trump announced that Israel and the United Arab Emirates would establish “full normalization of relations” and that in exchange Israel would forgo for now “declaring sovereignty” over occupied West Bank territory.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Israel and the United Arab Emirates reached a landmark accord sealed by President Trump on Thursday that could presage a broader realignment in the region as the two agreed to “full normalization of relations” in exchange for Israel suspending annexation of occupied West Bank territory.
2020-08-13.headline_main: Israel and United Arab Emirates Strike Major Diplomatic Agreement

2020-08-13.abstract: Government efforts to subsidize wages and prevent layoffs have kept many in jobs, but they aren’t sheltering an army of precarious workers.
2020-08-13.snippet: Government efforts to subsidize wages and prevent layoffs have kept many in jobs, but they aren’t sheltering an army of precarious workers.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Thierry Hombert stepped onto the balcony of his sparsely furnished apartment and took one last long look around. When the coronavirus hit France, the short-term catering gigs on which he lived for a decade disappeared, and he was now selling his home to make ends meet.
2020-08-13.headline_main: In Europe, Millions of Jobless Are Falling Through the Cracks

2020-08-13.abstract: The teenager was attacked in an apartment building near Yankee Stadium. The police later arrested the brother of his former girlfriend.
2020-08-13.snippet: The teenager was attacked in an apartment building near Yankee Stadium. The police later arrested the brother of his former girlfriend.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: Winston Ortiz was shy teenager who family members said had become depressed in recent days over a breakup with his first girlfriend. So, he was excited when he heard from her on Wednesday afternoon, they said, and he left his family’s Bronx apartment in high spirits.
2020-08-13.headline_main: 18-Year-Old Dies After He Is Stabbed and Set on Fire in the Bronx

2020-08-13.abstract: The Police Department said that the use of the dogs in arrests would be suspended until the city could review its policies and practices.
2020-08-13.snippet: The Police Department said that the use of the dogs in arrests would be suspended until the city could review its policies and practices.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: [Update: Officer who ordered police dog to bite a Black man is charged with assault.]              The authorities in Salt Lake City suspended the use of police dogs in arrests after one bit a Black man who was on one knee with his hands in the air during an incident in April, the mayor said on Wednesday.

Moderate Republicans fretted over its potential to hurt their party’s image, while more conservative lawmakers carefully sought to harness its grass-roots energy. Sympathetic media outlets covered its rallies, portraying it as an emerging strain of populist politics — a protest movement born of frustration with a corrupt, unaccountable elite.

It’s a good moment to get attention for a scary-monster series that rejuvenates the horror genre by making the heroes Black and putting America’s racist history at the center of the story.

2020-08-13.abstract: The winning if overly eager-to-please documentary “Boys State” looks at an annual educational program for teenage boys.
2020-08-13.snippet: The winning if overly eager-to-please documentary “Boys State” looks at an annual educational program for teenage boys.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: American democracy is alive and well, or at least functioning, in “Boys State,” a happy pill of a documentary. Each year, thousands of high-school boys congregate in their home states for some intense governance cosplay sponsored by the American Legion. In a single whirlwind week, participants are embedded in opposing parties — like Federalists and Nationalists — decide platforms and run for office, including governor. The movie focuses on the 2018 edition of Texas Boys State, when some 1,000 teens embraced ideals and engaged in a lot of hoo-ha togetherness.
2020-08-13.headline_main: ‘Boys State’ Review: Give Me a Teen and I’ll Show You a Politician

Not that any of that is over.

2020-08-13.abstract: The Houston rapper and singer has been making music with a close-knit team for five years. A 44-second track released in July brought his message to a larger audience.
2020-08-13.snippet: The Houston rapper and singer has been making music with a close-knit team for five years. A 44-second track released in July brought his message to a larger audience.
2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Tobe Nwigwe has spent five years as an independent rapper and singer on the Houston scene, building an audience — including fans like Erykah Badu and Michelle Obama — with weekly song drops that unfailingly arrive with a brand-new video. His plan has always been consistency, not virality. But sudden, unexpected fame arrived last month after he released a track that called attention to the police killing of Breonna Taylor in Kentucky.

2020-08-13.lead_paragraph: In March 2019, the Smithsonian’s National Portrait Gallery opened an exhibition called “Votes for Women: A Portrait of Persistence.” As curator, I visited archives around the country looking for original objects and images that would reveal new aspects of the suffrage movement. I wanted to widen the story and address the roles played by women of color, especially.

Basically he speaks to this young grasshopper’s potential, a moment that made me wonder if there were any Scientologists on board, before dropping some wisdom on her. If you’ve seen a lot of action movies, you know what’s next: confusion, scares, brinkmanship, big and bigger bangs — anything new just won’t do.

2020-08-14.abstract: Bear Grylls hosts a new reality competition show on Amazon. And Edward Norton’s “Motherless Brooklyn” adaptation airs on HBO Signature.
2020-08-14.snippet: Bear Grylls hosts a new reality competition show on Amazon. And Edward Norton’s “Motherless Brooklyn” adaptation airs on HBO Signature.
2020-08-14.lead_paragraph: WORLD’S TOUGHEST RACE: ECO-CHALLENGE FIJI Stream on Amazon. You have to feel some sympathy for the competitors featured in this adventure series: As an opening montage shows participants climbing, hiking and paddling through rugged terrain, the show’s host, Bear Grylls, explains that each day of the competition “will present a new array of relentless challenges designed to break them down physically, mentally and emotionally.” Soon after, Grylls offers an addendum: “All of them,” he says, “are going to suffer.” So it seems safe to say that the show — like the competition itself — is not for the faint of heart. It pits dozens of teams from many countries against each other in an 11-day race all over Fiji.
2020-08-14.headline_main: What’s on TV Friday: ‘World’s Toughest Race’ and ‘Motherless Brooklyn’

2020-08-14.abstract: This was Europe’s chance to beat back coronavirus before winter comes. We’re wasting it.
2020-08-14.snippet: This was Europe’s chance to beat back coronavirus before winter comes. We’re wasting it.
2020-08-14.lead_paragraph: EDINBURGH, Scotland — This spring, when Western Europe became an epicenter of the coronavirus pandemic, countries imposed strict lockdowns: In France, a person needed a permit to go shopping; Spain required children to stay indoors the entire day; in Scotland and Wales, people could go outside for a walk only once a day and had to stay within a five-mile radius. Thanks to this, European countries were able to not only flatten the Covid-19 curve but to also keep levels of infection very low.
2020-08-14.headline_main: We Will Pay for Our Summer Vacations With Winter Lockdowns

2020-08-14.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, says the nation is facing “two crises at the same time” — fighting the spread of the coronavirus and coping with extensive flood damage. But Mr. Kim has ordered his country not to accept any international aid for fear that outside help might bring in Covid-19, the state news media reported on Friday.
2020-08-14.headline_main: North Korea, Fighting to Hold Back Virus and Floods, Says No Thanks to Outside Aid

2020-08-14.snippet: Wolfram Eilenberger’s “Time of the Magicians” elegantly traces the life and work of four figures who transformed philosophy in the 1920s.
2020-08-14.lead_paragraph: In the autumn of 1922, as Germany was convulsed by food shortages and soaring inflation, the philosopher Martin Heidegger wrote a letter to his wife about the intricate choreography required to secure the most basic needs. “Mother asks if they should send potatoes even before 1 Oct; I answered yes and sent the money at the same time,” he explained. “What should I do when the potatoes arrive?”
2020-08-14.headline_main: How Wittgenstein and Other Thinkers Dealt With a Decade of Crisis

2020-08-14.lead_paragraph: HABEN: The Deafblind Woman Who Conquered Harvard Law, by Haben Girma. (Twelve, 288 pp., $16.99.) In this inspiring memoir, Girma recounts her Eritrean-American childhood, her parents’ harrowing refugee experience, her triumph as the first deafblind graduate of Harvard Law School and her career as an advocate fighting for people with disabilities. Along the way, she helps build a school in Mali, develops an innovative text-to-braille communication system, climbs an iceberg in Alaska and meets with President Obama at the White House.
