2020-08-21.abstract: The iconic Arecibo radio telescope is temporarily crippled by an accident.
2020-08-21.snippet: The iconic Arecibo radio telescope is temporarily crippled by an accident.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: The road to Arecibo Observatory in northwestern Puerto Rico winds upward through farms and rainforest. Chickens run across the road. Then, suddenly, you reach the top: a fence, guards and gleaming white buildings and towers, as if you had stumbled into the lair of a James Bond supervillain.
2020-08-21.headline_main: A Rip in the Fabric of Interstellar Dreams

2020-08-21.abstract: Universities rejected thousands of students when exam results were announced. With those grades now withdrawn, many are demanding places that have already been filled.
2020-08-21.snippet: Universities rejected thousands of students when exam results were announced. With those grades now withdrawn, many are demanding places that have already been filled.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The calls to Newcastle University started early this week, flooding in at the rate of 1,500 in a day. At Reading University, staff were forced to set up a makeshift phone bank in the library. Durham University, facing overwhelming demand for places in September’s freshman class, offered a cash reward to some young people if they deferred their education for a year.
2020-08-21.headline_main: U.K. Exam Chaos Prompts Stampede for College Places

2020-08-21.abstract: A beloved dish from Yotam Ottolenghi’s father inspired this one-pan spaghetti dinner.
2020-08-21.snippet: A beloved dish from Yotam Ottolenghi’s father inspired this one-pan spaghetti dinner.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: LONDON — My father passed away last December. In his final months, he wasn’t the dad I’d known — always terrifically absorbed in anything that came up in conversation. Regardless of whom he was talking to, he would find something genuinely engrossing, an opportunity to learn a fact or communicate one. He also lost his appetite, which was equally shocking, because food remained a spring of little joys for him, even when everything else seemed pointless, painful and confusing.
2020-08-21.headline_main: The Most Comforting Dish of All

2020-08-21.abstract: John David Washington stars as an unnamed, uncreased C.I.A. agent in a spectacle full of scenes running backward and forward.
2020-08-21.snippet: John David Washington stars as an unnamed, uncreased C.I.A. agent in a spectacle full of scenes running backward and forward.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Maybe it is our collective enslavement to the superhero-industrial complex, but right now the movie world is looking for a savior. If it turns out to be Christopher Nolan, it wouldn’t be the first time: Films of his, like “Inception,” “Interstellar” and “Dunkirk,” have, in years past, “saved” summers, reputations, studios. His “Dark Knight” trilogy sure saved the Warner Bros.-DC partnership — in fact possibly he saved that a bit too hard, with franchise filmmakers ever since toiling in his shadow. Can Nolan save cinema from the coronavirus, its deadliest foe yet? Perhaps, if Covid-19 can be tripped up by the grandfather paradox or has a hitherto undiscovered weakness for sharp tailoring.
2020-08-21.headline_main: ‘Tenet’ Review: Christopher Nolan’s Time-Bending Take on James Bond

2020-08-21.abstract: Spicy ramen noodles, braised chicken with artichokes and coconut-gochujang chicken are on the menu this week.
2020-08-21.snippet: Spicy ramen noodles, braised chicken with artichokes and coconut-gochujang chicken are on the menu this week.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Hello! And welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. I’ve always been the kind of person who likes to cook when things feel out of control. My mom died when I was quite young, and the kitchen was her place, so when she died, it became my place, where I escaped to — and still do, to find comfort in making a recipe that will work if I just follow the instructions. How life-affirming, right?

2020-08-21.abstract: In-person concerts are cautiously re-emerging. So two of our critics took in a quartet performance in a parking lot.
2020-08-21.snippet: In-person concerts are cautiously re-emerging. So two of our critics took in a quartet performance in a parking lot.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: MORRISTOWN, N.J. — Live performance ended abruptly in March as the coronavirus spread around the world, putting musicians out of work and audiences out of concert halls. Artists have taken to the internet, sending out livestreams, prerecorded streams, streams from the archives — almost all with the implied caveat that nothing beats the real thing, the real sound.
2020-08-21.headline_main: We Heard Our First Live Music in Months. Nothing Beats It.

2020-08-21.abstract: When did everything get so serious? This ’90s prime-time soap was sensational in every sense.
2020-08-21.snippet: When did everything get so serious? This ’90s prime-time soap was sensational in every sense.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: In the 1994 hit “Reality Bites,” Vickie (Janeane Garofalo) is sitting across from her best friend, Lelaina (Winona Ryder), in a diner, lamenting that she is “maybe, probably,” dying of AIDS. She thinks about it every day, all day, she says, but it’s as if it weren’t even happening to her. It’s as if she were a character “on some crappy show like ‘Melrose Place.’”
2020-08-21.headline_main: ‘Comfort Viewing’: 3 Reasons I Love ‘Melrose Place’

He has trouble pulling shirts on and off himself, and shows absolutely no desire to begin potty training.

2020-08-21.abstract: Plus: A love written in the stars.
2020-08-21.snippet: Plus: A love written in the stars.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: When stay-at-home measures went into effect in March, some new and blossoming relationships were put on pause. Others were prematurely defined as couples hastily began to quarantine under one roof, like Patricia Liu, a rising college senior who moved in with her boyfriend of three months. Their decision to live together led to a deeper connection, but after 48 days of playing house, her boyfriend’s military duty called for a separation with no calls or texts. Soon, letters became the only way to bridge the distance. She wrote one for every day they would be apart, 49 in total.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Love Letter: Surviving the Distance, One Letter at a Time

2020-08-21.snippet: The economy’s rebound showed signs of stagnating. Then enhanced unemployment benefits and a small-business loan program expired.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — America’s economic recovery is in an uneasy pause, with key indicators of hiring, shopping and investment stalling or in retreat in the wake of a resurgence in coronavirus cases across broad sections of the country, and with Congress and President Trump showing no signs of progress on another stimulus deal.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Economic Data Points to Pause in Recovery as Aid Programs Expire

2020-08-21.abstract: The announcement of a cease-fire was a rare positive development in a chaotic conflict plagued by foreign meddling. But skeptics abound.
2020-08-21.snippet: The announcement of a cease-fire was a rare positive development in a chaotic conflict plagued by foreign meddling. But skeptics abound.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Rival political leaders in Libya announced an immediate cease-fire on Friday and called for talks to demilitarize Sirte, the seaside city that has become the focus of international efforts to break the stalemated conflict in the oil-rich but dysfunctional North African nation.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Libyan Rivals Call for Peace Talks. It May Be Wishful Thinking.

2020-08-21.abstract: The Mets’ limited coronavirus infection showed it was probably inevitable it would hit a New York team. When they return, though, they are a team worth watching.
2020-08-21.snippet: The Mets’ limited coronavirus infection showed it was probably inevitable it would hit a New York team. When they return, though, they are a team worth watching.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Health is paramount, of course, and not the usual kind of health we talk about with the Mets. Two members of their traveling party tested positive for the coronavirus on Thursday — one player and one staff member — and Major League Baseball has paused their season in an effort to prevent the spread.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Baseball’s New Game Plan: Wait a Few Days and Hope for Good Health

2020-08-21.abstract: Forty-nine states, Washington, D.C., and two territories have so far signed on to President Trump’s stopgap program to get more money to the jobless. Here’s how it works.
2020-08-21.snippet: Forty-nine states, Washington, D.C., and two territories have so far signed on to President Trump’s stopgap program to get more money to the jobless. Here’s how it works.

2020-08-21.headline_main: $300 Unemployment Benefit: Who Will Get It and When?

2020-08-21.abstract: The postmaster general, under fire for recent changes that have slowed mail delivery, defended his approach and asked Congress to help free the Postal Service from costly retirement obligations.
2020-08-21.snippet: The postmaster general, under fire for recent changes that have slowed mail delivery, defended his approach and asked Congress to help free the Postal Service from costly retirement obligations.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Louis DeJoy, the embattled postmaster general whose cost-cutting and operational changes have prompted widespread concern about mail-in voting, said on Friday he was “extremely, highly confident” the Postal Service could handle the largest vote-by-mail program in American history. He said it was “outrageous” for Democrats to suggest that he might intentionally slow ballot delivery to help President Trump.
2020-08-21.headline_main: DeJoy Tells Senators Election Mail Will Be Delivered ‘Fully and on Time’

2020-08-21.abstract: The new Disney+ film about a talented gorilla might leave you wondering about the real great ape that inspired the story. We have answers.
2020-08-21.snippet: The new Disney+ film about a talented gorilla might leave you wondering about the real great ape that inspired the story. We have answers.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Can a gorilla ape Banksy? That’s the setup of Disney’s new animal rights flick, “The One and Only Ivan,” inspired by the true story of a silverback gorilla who spent 27 years intimidating children at a shopping mall in Tacoma, Wash. In the film, he becomes politicized over his imprisonment and expresses his outrage through art. Directed by Thea Sharrock and based on K.A. Applegate’s Newbery Award-winning book of the same title, this retelling is candy sweet compared with the real Ivan’s cameo in the 1991 documentary “The Urban Gorilla,” which turned him into a 500-pound cause célèbre. This computer-animated Ivan is able to speak for himself (in the voice of Sam Rockwell). As legal efforts in Germany, Argentina and the Balearic Islands have established precedents that could make primate personhood a future civil rights fight, what’s the film’s ratio of fiction to fact? We answer this and other questions below.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Answering the Many Questions About ‘The One and Only Ivan’

2020-08-21.abstract: Hundreds of health workers have tested positive and some have died, while health facilities are overwhelmed and government officials are accused of stealing funds for medical supplies.
2020-08-21.snippet: Hundreds of health workers have tested positive and some have died, while health facilities are overwhelmed and government officials are accused of stealing funds for medical supplies.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — Doctors in public hospitals say they have not been paid, some for as long as six months. They’re furious that they’ve been given faulty protective gear, or none at all. Hundreds of government health workers have fallen sick with the coronavirus, and yet many say their medical insurance was cut in July, just when hospitals became overwhelmed with cases.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Kenya’s Health Workers, Unprotected and Falling Ill, Walk Off Job

2020-08-21.abstract: The prestigious Blu-ray/DVD archive is overwhelmingly white. We want to hear your suggestions.
2020-08-21.snippet: The prestigious Blu-ray/DVD archive is overwhelmingly white. We want to hear your suggestions.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: A report by Kyle Buchanan and Reggie Ugwu looked at the Criterion Collection, the trove of deluxe Blu-rays and DVDs of films by the most highly regarded filmmakers. Of more than 1,000 titles, only six were by African-American filmmakers, and none were by anyone born after 1957.
2020-08-21.headline_main: What Would You Include in the Criterion Collection?

2020-08-21.abstract: When ants are accidentally marked as dead, they find a way to rejoin the living.
2020-08-21.snippet: When ants are accidentally marked as dead, they find a way to rejoin the living.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Every corpse is an ecosystem. Each fallen bird, landed fish, beached whale, decomposing log, plucked flower is destined to change from a conglomerate of giant molecules, the most complex system in the universe known, into clouds and drifts of much smaller organic molecules. The process of decay is driven by scavengers, in nature beginning with vultures and blowflies and ending with fungi and bacteria.
2020-08-21.headline_main: The Zombie Ants

2020-08-21.abstract: Among the performances you can catch online are a one-woman show about sexual assault and riffs on “Heart of Darkness” and “Rocky.”
2020-08-21.snippet: Among the performances you can catch online are a one-woman show about sexual assault and riffs on “Heart of Darkness” and “Rocky.”
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Most Augusts, the Edinburgh Festival Fringe presents thousands of live performances in the Scottish capital, saving some of its most unusual specimens for a subfestival called the Zoo. Not this August, sadly, and yet the cessation of live theater has made the teeming collection of dance, performance and physical theater available to a much wider audience online, under the rubric Zoo TV. Our critics had a look around at offerings — some new, some old, all Fringe — that ranged from unwatchable to unforgettable.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Direct from Edinburgh: Theaters Are Closed, but a ‘Zoo’ Is Open

2020-08-21.abstract: Giorgio Agamben criticizes the “techno-medical despotism” of quarantines and closings.
2020-08-21.snippet: Giorgio Agamben criticizes the “techno-medical despotism” of quarantines and closings.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Stumping for regional candidates in Tuscany this month, Italy’s former interior minister Matteo Salvini waved around a surgical mask — and pointedly did not wear it. Covid-19 has taken more than 35,000 lives since it struck Italy in January. But now the daily death toll is typically in single digits, and Mr. Salvini, the leader of the anti-immigration League party, wants to put the country back to work. “Italians are being held hostage, kept at a distance, masked,” he hollered, “and meanwhile they let thousands of lowlifes land their boats and do what they want, go where they want, spit, infect. Enough is enough!”
2020-08-21.headline_main: Meet the Philosopher Who Is Trying to Explain the Pandemic

2020-08-21.abstract: She was a charismatic and powerful public speaker who pushed for equal pay for equal work, better labor standards and overall empowerment for women.
2020-08-21.snippet: She was a charismatic and powerful public speaker who pushed for equal pay for equal work, better labor standards and overall empowerment for women.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times. This latest installment is one of many ways The New York Times is examining the centennial of the 19th Amendment.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Overlooked No More: Leonora O’Reilly, Suffragist Who Fought for Working Women

2020-08-21.snippet: Ai said the documentary film “Coronation,” which he directed remotely from Europe, “is trying to reflect what ordinary Chinese people went through.”

2020-08-21.abstract: A wheelchair user herself, she helped draft a landmark law and held government posts championing people with disabilities, especially those of color.

A spinal tumor had impaired her mobility — later in life she would be in a wheelchair — but her father had taught her how to play the net, in her own particular way.

2020-08-21.abstract: The speech disorder can play havoc with sociability, relationships, even identity, but there are ways to handle it.
2020-08-21.snippet: The speech disorder can play havoc with sociability, relationships, even identity, but there are ways to handle it.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: For a couple of minutes on Thursday, the sprawling, virtual Democratic National Convention seemed to hold its collective breath as 13-year-old Brayden Harrington of Concord, N.H., addressed the nation from his bedroom, occasionally stumbling on his words. “I’m a regular kid,” he said into a home camera, and a recent meeting with the candidate “made me feel confident about something that has bothered me my whole life.”

2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: In each installment of The Artists, T highlights a recent or little-shown work by a Black artist, along with a few words from that artist putting the work into context. This week, we’re looking at a piece by Erica Deeman, who focuses on portrait photography, exploring questions of race and identity. Her new show, “Familiar Stranger,” opens next week at Anthony Meier Fine Arts.

If there’s no sun in sight, maybe you’ll be inspired by the people who are packing up and temporarily moving to warmer climes. (I have to confess, I’m tempted.) Whatever you end up doing, be sure to make time for some great journalism.

The spotted lanternfly, the Northeast’s pest à la mode, was back.

John Gallagher thought of his sons. Darryl Young thought of his father. Laura McLendon thought of her wedding day.

The campaign wanted him to speak at the Democratic National Convention — not to endorse Mr. Biden, but to put the stakes of this election in historical context.

2020-08-21.snippet: Joseph R. Biden Jr. never wavered from his central message: that President Trump was a danger to American democracy, while he was a stable, experienced leader. Now it will be tested in a fierce battle with the president.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: Staring into the camera, Joseph R. Biden Jr. recalled the white supremacist protests in Charlottesville, Va., declared that the soul of the nation was at stake in this election and, invoking America’s founding creed, claimed history’s call by vowing to defeat a president who he said threatens democracy itself.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Biden Always Had a Simple Message. He Rode It to the Nomination.

2020-08-21.abstract: It was the first time a president has held an East Room funeral for a member of his family in nearly 100 years.
2020-08-21.snippet: It was the first time a president has held an East Room funeral for a member of his family in nearly 100 years.
2020-08-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Growing up in Queens, Robert S. Trump learned to survive in the shadow of a rambunctious older brother, Donald, who monopolized attention. In adulthood, his older brother was his boss at the Trump Organization. And near the end of his life, he became his older brother’s defender, joining him in publicly excoriating their niece, Mary, who had written a memoir about life inside a family she characterized as cold and cruel.
2020-08-21.headline_main: Trump Holds a Rare White House Funeral for His Younger Brother, Robert

2020-08-22.abstract: Will the West take action against whoever may have harmed Aleksei Navalny?
2020-08-22.snippet: Will the West take action against whoever may have harmed Aleksei Navalny?
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Aleksei Navalny — reportedly still in a coma — has finally been allowed to fly to Germany for treatment, so at least the mystery of what caused Russia’s most prominent opposition figure to collapse in terrible agony on a flight over Siberia may be resolved. But if it does turn out to be poison, to which all signs point, it will still not explain who attacked him or why.

2020-08-22.abstract: Trenton Charlson steals a little of our youth.
2020-08-22.snippet: Trenton Charlson steals a little of our youth.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — This is a tough one, and an example of what the street fashion bloggers call “high-low,” a mingling of very opulent clues that require knowledge of opulent things and some nice commercial mentions for hoi polloi. Here’s a weird hint: There are no Zs nor any Qs, which is very strange for a Trenton Charlson puzzle. Every other letter is accounted for.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Hangout for Dorian Gray

2020-08-22.snippet: Courts have long held that tenants can stay away from their apartments for extended periods because of health reasons. But don’t neglect your home.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Q: I live in an Upper East Side apartment with a rent-stabilized lease, which requires me to live there at least 183 days a year. I have been away since the start of the pandemic. What happens if I stay away for more than half the year? And how do I maintain it in the meantime?

2020-08-22.abstract: For many couples whose wedding plans were derailed by the coronavirus crisis, getting a refund or a credit from vendors has been an uphill battle.
2020-08-22.snippet: For many couples whose wedding plans were derailed by the coronavirus crisis, getting a refund or a credit from vendors has been an uphill battle.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Frank Dariano and Sharon Mensah had planned to marry on July 5, with 50 guests in attendance, at a resort in Banff National Park in the Rocky Mountains of Alberta, Canada. But they canceled the wedding shortly after shelter-in-place orders were issued in San Jose, Calif., their hometown. “Our plans really went south as the pandemic started cracking down on international travel,” said Mr. Dariano, an administrative assistant at an outpatient rehabilitation center in Sunnyvale, Calif.

2020-08-22.abstract: Sorting your photographs, whether digital or print or both, can seem daunting. Here are some simple ways to catalog and organize your images.
2020-08-22.snippet: Sorting your photographs, whether digital or print or both, can seem daunting. Here are some simple ways to catalog and organize your images.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Spending more time at home has offered the opportunity to tackle all sorts of ambitious projects, from D.I.Y. focaccia to work-space upgrades. Yet there’s one task that still seems impossible: organizing hundreds, if not thousands — or even hundreds of thousands — of print and digital photographs. The idea of sorting through them feels daunting, so instead you do nothing. The shots pile up; the cycle continues.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Finally Organize Those Photos

2020-08-22.abstract: Researchers discovered a way to awaken dormant stem cells and transform them into cartilage. If the technique works in humans, it may help ease debilitating joint pain.
2020-08-22.snippet: Researchers discovered a way to awaken dormant stem cells and transform them into cartilage. If the technique works in humans, it may help ease debilitating joint pain.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: The painful knees and hips experienced by so many people with osteoarthritis result from a loss of cartilage, which serves as a sort of cushioning in the joints. It had long been thought that cartilage, once gone, cannot grow back.

2020-08-22.abstract: Bolivia was mired in political turmoil when the pandemic hit. The response was chaotic. And the surge in deaths that followed was among the worst in the world, according to an analysis by The New York Times.
2020-08-22.snippet: Bolivia was mired in political turmoil when the pandemic hit. The response was chaotic. And the surge in deaths that followed was among the worst in the world, according to an analysis by The New York Times.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: TARIJA, Bolivia — So many people were dying that the government’s numbers couldn’t be accurate.

2020-08-22.abstract: The tourism operators who depend on the natural wonder, already contending with climate change, have been walloped by the pandemic. The absence of visitors is bad for them — and the reef.
2020-08-22.snippet: The tourism operators who depend on the natural wonder, already contending with climate change, have been walloped by the pandemic. The absence of visitors is bad for them — and the reef.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: CAIRNS, Australia — Diving beneath the ocean, Russell Hosp swam toward the limestone bed of the Great Barrier Reef, where he reattached bits of blue staghorn coral. With tourists gone, he was filling the void with this small act of conservation, which took his mind off the uncertain future on land.
2020-08-22.headline_main: ‘A Bit Surreal’: The Lonely Plight of the Great Barrier Reef

2020-08-22.abstract: Many theater companies are closed, but that doesn’t mean you can’t immerse yourself in the magic of a play.
2020-08-22.snippet: Many theater companies are closed, but that doesn’t mean you can’t immerse yourself in the magic of a play.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: In the United States, stages mostly remain dark. But there is another option for finding that full immersion into the magic of the theater, and that’s through podcasts. These shows, available on most listening apps, will challenge the assumption that you need to be in a theater seat to be transported into another world.
2020-08-22.headline_main: 5 Podcasts to Bring Theater Into Your Home

2020-08-22.abstract: His sudden, unexplained illness comes amid political uprisings in Russia’s Far East, and just weeks before municipal elections take place across the country.
2020-08-22.snippet: His sudden, unexplained illness comes amid political uprisings in Russia’s Far East, and just weeks before municipal elections take place across the country.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Russia’s most prominent opposition figure, Aleksei A. Navalny, arrived in Berlin for treatment on Saturday after falling into a coma in Siberia in what his family and supporters suspect was a deliberate poisoning weeks before nationwide local elections.

2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Correction: Aug. 24, 2020 An earlier version of this article omitted an ingredient. Adding lemon juice to the tomato sauce helps ensure safety in canning. The earlier version also incorrectly used ingredients and procedures that can be dangerous for home canning. Carrots, celery, basil and other low acidic vegetables should not be included in the sauce for canning; they can be added when the sauce is reheated for use. Finally, new jars should be used for canning.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Make and Jar Pomodoro to Last All Year Long

2020-08-22.abstract: I’ve attended every convention since 1988, when Michael J. Dukakis accepted the Democratic presidential nomination. That year, as I exited Atlanta’s rapidly emptying Omni Coliseum after the balloons had dropped, I stopped to chat with a prominent Southern Democratic senator. He was all smiles, sure that the party’s four days of festivities would lead to Mr. Dukakis beating George H.W. Bush. Like thousands of other Democrats in attendance, he thought it was in the bag.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: I’ve attended every convention since 1988, when Michael J. Dukakis accepted the Democratic presidential nomination. That year, as I exited Atlanta’s rapidly emptying Omni Coliseum after the balloons had dropped, I stopped to chat with a prominent Southern Democratic senator. He was all smiles, sure that the party’s four days of festivities would lead to Mr. Dukakis beating George H.W. Bush. Like thousands of other Democrats in attendance, he thought it was in the bag.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Lamenting the loss of the in-person convention.

But their fortune may run out on Sunday, when storms with strong winds, lightning and little rain may return to the region.

2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: CRYPTIC CROSSWORD — It’s always a treat to get a Cox/Rathvon creation on an off week. Those of us who solve the acrostic have an advantage, as we are already on these constructors’ sophisticated and funny wavelength, but you don’t need a fancy surfboard or nerves of steel to hop on — the water is warm, and if you see a shark, just maintain eye contact and soldier on.

2020-08-22.abstract: Like Beau Biden, we have glioblastoma. It doesn’t get the attention it should.
2020-08-22.snippet: Like Beau Biden, we have glioblastoma. It doesn’t get the attention it should.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: If Joe Biden reaches the White House, he will have more direct experience with cancer than most presidents. His eldest son, Beau Biden, died in 2015, at 46 from glioblastoma, the most aggressive form of primary brain cancer. Glioblastoma is deadly — median survival from time of diagnosis is only 14 months — and notoriously difficult to treat.
2020-08-22.headline_main: We Are Living With Brain Cancer. Here’s How Biden Could Help Us.

2020-08-22.snippet: But what Republicans learn from the Trump era will make all the difference.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: It must pain Donald Trump, deep down in his showman’s soul, to have had his convention taken away from him. The arguable peak of his presidency, the hubristic State of the Union that preceded the coronavirus, raised the reality-television elements of the address to new heights — reuniting a military family! Bestowing a Presidential Medal of Freedom! You can only imagine what brazen gimmicks, what WWE stagecraft, Trump would have rolled out for a convention taking place in normal times.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Win or Lose, Trump Will Hold Power Over the G.O.P.

2020-08-22.abstract: When “civilization” oppresses, wilderness is the best therapy.
2020-08-22.snippet: When “civilization” oppresses, wilderness is the best therapy.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: PACIFIC NORTHWEST TRAIL, Mont. — What’s a person to do in a crazy summer when our president endorses a candidate who claims the world is controlled by a “global cabal of Satan-worshiping pedophiles,” when federal agents club a Navy veteran protesting peacefully, when the government delays postal services to impede voting (and thereby kills chicks sent in the mail)?
2020-08-22.headline_main: Fleeing the Trolls for the Grizzly Bears

2020-08-22.abstract: The next president can undo some of the recent efforts to weaken environmental protections. But it’ll take work.
2020-08-22.snippet: The next president can undo some of the recent efforts to weaken environmental protections. But it’ll take work.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: That the Interior Department has now blessed oil and gas drilling in the coastal plain of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge comes as no surprise. It was a foregone conclusion once Lisa Murkowski, in 2017, persuaded her Senate colleagues to authorize drilling in the refuge as part of a tax bill, ending protections that have been in place since the Eisenhower administration.
2020-08-22.headline_main: How to Reverse Course on Trump’s Environmental Damage

2020-08-22.abstract: The virus doesn’t sicken kids as much as adults. But it can still destroy their futures. A child allowance would help.
2020-08-22.snippet: The virus doesn’t sicken kids as much as adults. But it can still destroy their futures. A child allowance would help.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: Three decades ago, a team of researchers at Duke University set off to follow a group of schoolchildren in a stretch of rural North Carolina that happened to include a small reservation. Soon after, the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians opened a casino and began sharing the profits, about $4,000 per adult each year, with every household in the tribe — essentially creating a local version of guaranteed income.
2020-08-22.headline_main: The Coronavirus Generation

2020-08-22.abstract: Early releases of prisoners to protect them from the virus have depleted the ranks of an inmate firefighting program that some say should be abolished anyway.
2020-08-22.snippet: Early releases of prisoners to protect them from the virus have depleted the ranks of an inmate firefighting program that some say should be abolished anyway.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: VACAVILLE, Calif. — They charge into fire zones with 60-pound packs and three-foot chain saws, felling trees and hacking through brush to make wide paths of dirt around anything worth protecting. Bright orange uniforms set them apart from other firefighters — and identify them as inmates of California’s state prisons.
2020-08-22.headline_main: Coronavirus Limits California’s Efforts to Fight Fires With Prison Labor

2020-08-22.abstract: You’d do anything for them in a crisis, but the crisis isn’t going away. Here’s how to get your life back.
2020-08-22.snippet: You’d do anything for them in a crisis, but the crisis isn’t going away. Here’s how to get your life back.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: When pandemic-related shutdowns started, many people rushed to the rescue of their loved ones. They rallied to meet an extraordinary situation and extended themselves in deep and loving ways. They welcomed home adult children with open arms. They jumped to babysit for their grandkids. They volunteered to shop for neighbors and elderly relatives.
2020-08-22.headline_main: How to Set Pandemic Boundaries for Relatives

2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: First published in the 19th century by the French mathematician Édouard Lucas, Dots and Boxes was called La Pipopipette.

2020-08-22.abstract: Barbara Lin’s puzzle hits all of the right notes.
2020-08-22.snippet: Barbara Lin’s puzzle hits all of the right notes.
2020-08-22.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Solving this puzzle is such a pleasure, if it hits your brain the way it did mine and evokes a happy tune. Barbara Lin is a computer engineer, as well as a constructor — this is her third Times puzzle and her Sunday debut. Designing a bit of useful code, filling in every box in a crossword and following a bit of harmonious music are among the satisfying “clicks” that our minds can make. It amazes me when these experiences play off each other (and don’t miss the constructor’s notes for further elaboration on that).
2020-08-22.headline_main: Musical Interlude

2020-08-22.abstract: Party officials in Texas said that the internet-driven conspiracy theory had nothing to do with its use of the slogan “We Are the Storm” — one of the chief rallying cries for QAnon adherents.

2020-08-23.abstract: Paris St.-Germain brought in the Brazilian forward to win games like Sunday’s Champions League final. The key to achieving his goal, and the club’s, may be realizing he doesn’t have to do it alone.
2020-08-23.snippet: Paris St.-Germain brought in the Brazilian forward to win games like Sunday’s Champions League final. The key to achieving his goal, and the club’s, may be realizing he doesn’t have to do it alone.
2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: Neymar was as good as his word. As he stepped off Paris St.-Germain’s bus a couple of hours before his team’s Champions League quarterfinal against Atalanta, all the pieces were in place. He had his sunglasses perched on his head. He had a speaker blaring “Hoje É Rave,” by the Brazilian D.J.s Bárbara Labres and MC WM. And, as he had promised, he had his hair cut into a mohawk.

2020-08-23.abstract: An HBO documentary series delves into the downfall of Nxivm. And Itsaso Arana stars in a languid summer film set in Madrid.
2020-08-23.snippet: An HBO documentary series delves into the downfall of Nxivm. And Itsaso Arana stars in a languid summer film set in Madrid.
2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: THE VOW 10 p.m. on HBO; stream on HBO Max. In 2019, Keith Raniere, the leader of the self-improvement group known as Nxivm, was convicted on charges of racketeering and sex trafficking, his trial exposing the shadowy organization’s inner workings. The group had attracted high-profile members — including the “Smallville” actress Allison Mack and the heiress Clare Bronfman — and in 2017, troubling reports of coercion, blackmail and abuse began to surface. This nine-part documentary series examines the disturbing practices that made headlines, but it also delves deeper into the organization to understand why people joined in the first place. Through interviews with former members, the filmmakers Jehane Noujaim and Karim Amer explore the fall of the organization and the emotional toll that it took on those hoping it could help them lead a better life.
2020-08-23.headline_main: What’s on TV Sunday: ‘The Vow’ and ‘The August Virgin’

2020-08-23.abstract: Immediately after the Civil War ended, the South began a campaign to deny the true meaning of the conflict.
2020-08-23.snippet: Immediately after the Civil War ended, the South began a campaign to deny the true meaning of the conflict.
2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: He had tried, and failed, once before. In 1859, the Virginian Edward Alfred Pollard, a journalist and Southern partisan, had published a defense of slavery, “Black Diamonds Gathered in the Darkey Homes of the South.” Then came the election of Abraham Lincoln, the Civil War, the Emancipation Proclamation and the 13th Amendment, which abolished the system of slavery Pollard had hoped to preserve. After the Confederate surrender at Appomattox in April 1865, he turned to a new project, publishing, in 1866, a book titled THE LOST CAUSE: A NEW SOUTHERN HISTORY OF THE WAR OF THE CONFEDERATES.
2020-08-23.headline_main: The South’s Fight for White Supremacy

2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: Over the years, Bobby Fouther has watched the historic center of African-American life in Portland bloom, shrink and expand again. The 69-year-old artist was born into a creative family from the neighborhood of Albina, which he remembers filled with jazz music and beauty. “Black artists were thriving here in the 1950s,” he recalled. “My parents had turned our grandfather’s garage into a miniature theater, where my stepfather and his friends would perform late into the night.”

2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Mornings in the city begin with “sticky bombs,” explosives slapped onto vehicles that go up in flames. With night comes the dread of hit-and-run assassinations in the nearby suburbs — government employees shot dead by motorcycle-riding insurgents who roam free.
2020-08-23.headline_main: With Delay in Afghan Peace Talks, a Creeping Sense of ‘Siege’ Around Kabul

2020-08-23.abstract: This is democracy, at a social distance.

2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: For the first time in the history of our democracy, the Democratic National Convention was not a gathering in person for delegates to debate their chosen primary candidates, hammer out a platform, and ultimately nominate their candidates for America’s top officers. As opposed to a traditional crowded convention hall spectacle, delegates and candidates gathered online this year. From Zoom rooms, Google hangouts and other online spaces they gathered remotely from homes across the country.

Lukashenko of Belarus promised to crush with an iron fist the protests that have broken out since his re-election this month, tens of thousands of people took to the streets of the capital, Minsk, on Sunday to show their determination to force him out of office.

It was the 99th anniversary of one of the deadliest race riots in American history, when a Black neighborhood in the city was destroyed by a white mob in 1921.

2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: In that moment of elation, the cameras hunted for despair. They found it in the slight, forlorn shape of Neymar, sitting on Paris St.-Germain’s bench, a perfect picture of heartbreak. Neymar, with tears in his eyes. Neymar, staring into the middle distance. Neymar, with his head in his hands.

They were repeating a message that is part of a predictable summer routine on the Gulf Coast as hurricane season reaches its climax.

2020-08-23.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — Twitter hid one of President Trump’s tweets behind a notice warning users that the message violated company rules against dissuading people from voting. Mr. Trump posted the tweet, which said that ballot drop boxes were not being sanitized to prevent the coronavirus and could be used for fraud, about five hours before Twitter took action on Sunday.

2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: LOVE ISLAND 8 p.m. on CBS. The British dating show’s American spinoff returns for a second season tonight with a two-hour premiere. The host Arielle Vandenberg welcomes a new cast of single men and women to an isolated location where they’ll live together in proximity under the watchful eye of the show’s many cameras. For this installment, participants will be sequestered in the Cromwell hotel in Las Vegas, not an exotic international site, because of the coronavirus pandemic, which also delayed the season’s debut. A provisional coupling will kick things off, then the contestants will have be paired up at each subsequent recoupling ceremony to remain in contention for the $100,000 prize. They’ll also have to ingratiate themselves to viewers and their fellow “islanders,” whose votes occasionally determine who departs.

2020-08-24.abstract: The notion that history can be rewritten is a powerful one. It starts by taking the pen from the authors we’ve always had — and giving it to someone else.
2020-08-24.snippet: The notion that history can be rewritten is a powerful one. It starts by taking the pen from the authors we’ve always had — and giving it to someone else.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: This is a magazine devoted to documenting visual culture, whether those visuals come from the worlds of fashion, theater, film, architecture or art. Some of the most striking visuals from the past half-year in America — and there have been many — have concerned the removal or defacement of monuments dedicated to figures from the Confederacy, whose placement in public spaces mostly in the South are, for many of us, an insult, if not an assault. I am not Black, but I keenly remember the discomfort and inexplicable shame I often felt while attending my freshman-year public high school, Robert E. Lee, in Tyler, Texas. Lee was a Confederate general, a slave owner and a commander in the Confederate Army during the American Civil War. (The middle school I attended in Tyler, Hubbard, was also named for a former Confederate officer, who later became the state’s governor.) A large portrait of Lee hung in the school gym, and whenever I saw it, I felt as if my right to this country, to Americanness, was being challenged. Why, more than a century later, was someone who had fought for something this country now purported to be against still being honored?
2020-08-24.headline_main: Rethinking Who and What Get Memorialized

2020-08-24.abstract: With colonialist statues being toppled in America and beyond, T asked five artists to envision a different kind of memorial, one that embodies this moment of reckoning.
2020-08-24.snippet: With colonialist statues being toppled in America and beyond, T asked five artists to envision a different kind of memorial, one that embodies this moment of reckoning.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: ACCORDING TO DATA compiled by the Southern Poverty Law Center, some 100 monuments to Confederate generals and politicians have been removed from American public land since June 2015, when Dylann Roof, a then 21-year-old white supremacist, murdered nine Black parishioners in a mass shooting at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, S.C., in a state that, at the time, still flew the Confederate flag over its capitol. More than a third of these monuments have been removed since May 25 of this year alone, when a Minnesota police officer named Derek Chauvin, who has been charged with second-degree murder, was caught on video kneeling on the neck of George Floyd, an unarmed Black man, for more than eight minutes while Floyd pleaded for his life. (As a point of comparison, for the nearly 100 years between 1923 and 2015, only nine such monuments were removed.)
2020-08-24.headline_main: America’s Monuments, Reimagined for a More Just Future

2020-08-24.abstract: CNN examines the state of women’s rights in America, 100 years since the suffrage movement. And Ethan Hawke stars in an unorthodox biopic.
2020-08-24.snippet: CNN examines the state of women’s rights in America, 100 years since the suffrage movement. And Ethan Hawke stars in an unorthodox biopic.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: WOMEN REPRESENTED: THE 100 YEAR BATTLE FOR EQUALITY 10 p.m. on CNN. Last Tuesday, the United States celebrated the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment, which gave women the right to vote. To commemorate the milestone, CNN’s Erin Burnett takes a look back at the history of the women’s suffrage movement, and examines where the country currently stands on gender equality and how far it still has to go. The 90-minute special features conversations with Melinda Gates, Roxane Gay, Cecile Richards and others who discuss the prospects of America’s first woman president, inequities in the workplace and the legacy of the #MeToo movement.
2020-08-24.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: A CNN Special and ‘Tesla’

2020-08-24.abstract: Once again, a prominent critic of Moscow has mysteriously fallen ill. And once again, poison appears to be the culprit.
2020-08-24.snippet: Once again, a prominent critic of Moscow has mysteriously fallen ill. And once again, poison appears to be the culprit.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Aleksei A. Navalny, the outspoken Russian dissident who fell into a coma last week, was a victim of poisoning, German doctors said Monday, adding him to the ranks of Russians stricken by mystery illness after drawing the wrath of Moscow.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Aleksei Navalny, Putin Critic in a Coma, Was Poisoned, German Doctors Say

2020-08-24.abstract: A review of studies confirms an old home remedy: honey for colds.
2020-08-24.snippet: A review of studies confirms an old home remedy: honey for colds.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Honey is a traditional home remedy for colds. Now a review of studies provides scientific evidence that honey does indeed have a modest but significant beneficial effect on coughs and other respiratory symptoms.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Honey May Ease Coughs and Other Respiratory Symptoms

2020-08-24.abstract: The suit escalates a bitter back-and-forth between the popular video app and American officials.
2020-08-24.snippet: The suit escalates a bitter back-and-forth between the popular video app and American officials.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — TikTok sued the U.S. government on Monday, accusing the Trump administration of depriving it of due process when President Trump used his emergency economic powers to issue an executive order that will block the app from operating in the country.
2020-08-24.headline_main: TikTok Sues U.S. Government Over Trump Ban

2020-08-24.abstract: Combinations of Slim Aarons-inspired shades, retro stripes and abstract patterns that bestow a sense of freedom.
2020-08-24.snippet: Combinations of Slim Aarons-inspired shades, retro stripes and abstract patterns that bestow a sense of freedom.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Vibrant Fashions to Brighten One’s Look and Mood

2020-08-24.abstract: Strict rules and player sacrifices allowed Europe’s leagues to complete their schedules. But the coronavirus hasn’t abated, and the new season brings new risks.
2020-08-24.snippet: Strict rules and player sacrifices allowed Europe’s leagues to complete their schedules. But the coronavirus hasn’t abated, and the new season brings new risks.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Van-Tam made no attempt to sugarcoat it. Amid soccer’s coronavirus hiatus, as sports leagues around the world tried to figure out a way to return to the field as a pandemic raged, Van-Tam, the deputy chief medical officer of Britain, had been invited to join a Zoom call with the captains of the Premier League’s 20 clubs.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Soccer Played Through the Pandemic. Now It Has to Do It All Again.

2020-08-24.abstract: A mother raising a deaf son paradoxically lives in a house full of noise. But she learns from him how to unplug and disconnect.
2020-08-24.snippet: A mother raising a deaf son paradoxically lives in a house full of noise. But she learns from him how to unplug and disconnect.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: In my house, mornings begin with a bang. Usually, from a door being thrown open, followed by the belligerent bellow, “Ma! Milk!” that sounds more like it came from a pro wrestler than the pajama-clad 6-year-old crashing into my bedroom. It’s 6 a.m. (if I’m lucky) and my eyes are still shut, but my ears are wide open.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Getting Your Kids to Turn It Down a Notch (or Several)

2020-08-24.abstract: Vice President Mike Pence took the stage to accept his renomination Monday morning as the Republican National Convention kicked off, pitching the Trump-Pence ticket as leaders of a party that stood for “free market economics, secure borders” and the “right to life.”
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Vice President Mike Pence took the stage to accept his renomination Monday morning as the Republican National Convention kicked off, pitching the Trump-Pence ticket as leaders of a party that stood for “free market economics, secure borders” and the “right to life.”
2020-08-24.headline_main: Pence tells the convention he and Trump will defend borders and the ‘right to life.’

2020-08-24.abstract: Fires have chewed through 1.4 million acres in the state this year. By this point in 2019, 56,000 acres had burned.
2020-08-24.snippet: Fires have chewed through 1.4 million acres in the state this year. By this point in 2019, 56,000 acres had burned.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California on Monday addressed a state besieged by wildfires of staggering scale and spread, assuring residents that “we’ve deployed every resource at our disposal” as the number of active fires grew to 625.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Scope of California Wildfires Is Staggering

2020-08-24.abstract: The discovery of hundreds of gold coins dating to the ninth century could help archaeologists better understand the history of the region.
2020-08-24.snippet: The discovery of hundreds of gold coins dating to the ninth century could help archaeologists better understand the history of the region.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The treasure needed to be secured. So the hoard of 425 gold coins was stowed in a clay jar, its lid secured with a nail, and stashed in the sands of what is now central Israel.
2020-08-24.headline_main: 1,100-Year-Old Treasure Is Unearthed by Teenagers in Israel

2020-08-24.abstract: Despite the recession, polling data and interviews with voters and political analysts suggest that a confluence of factors is raising the president’s standing on the economy issue.
2020-08-24.snippet: Despite the recession, polling data and interviews with voters and political analysts suggest that a confluence of factors is raising the president’s standing on the economy issue.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: It is an enduring political question amid a pandemic recession, double-digit unemployment and a recovery that appears to be slowing: Why does President Trump continue to get higher marks on economic issues in polls than his predecessors Barack Obama, George W. Bush and George H.W. Bush enjoyed when they stood for re-election?
2020-08-24.headline_main: Why Trump’s Approval Ratings on the Economy Remain Durable

2020-08-24.abstract: Concern about global warming is steady despite other crises, a survey found, and the number of voters who are deeply engaged on the issue is rising sharply.
2020-08-24.snippet: Concern about global warming is steady despite other crises, a survey found, and the number of voters who are deeply engaged on the issue is rising sharply.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The number of Americans who feel passionately about climate change is rising sharply, and the issue appears likely to play a more important role in this year’s election than ever before, a new survey shows.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Climate Is Taking On a Growing Role for Voters, Research Suggests

2020-08-24.abstract: Before franchises dominated completely, great actors joined flashy directors in originals like “Collateral” and M. Night Shyamalan’s “The Village.”
2020-08-24.snippet: Before franchises dominated completely, great actors joined flashy directors in originals like “Collateral” and M. Night Shyamalan’s “The Village.”
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: No one else is going to say it, so allow me: 2004 was a good movie year. So good that this month’s edition of The Box is a sequel to last month’s. That one was set the late June weekend that “Fahrenheit 9/11” opened up top and “The Notebook” was still a sleeper. This one finds us in the first full weekend of August, when “Collateral” knocked “The Village” to second place.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Plot Twist! Why 2004 Was a Surprising Year for Movies

2020-08-24.abstract: Swaying disillusioned Republicans and unaffiliated voters has become a point of emphasis for former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., whose campaign released on Monday a list of 27 former Republican members of Congress who had endorsed him against President Trump.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Swaying disillusioned Republicans and unaffiliated voters has become a point of emphasis for former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., whose campaign released on Monday a list of 27 former Republican members of Congress who had endorsed him against President Trump.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Over two dozen Republicans who served in Congress endorse Biden.

2020-08-24.abstract: Fabiana Pierre-Louis, 39, will also be the only Black judge currently seated on the state’s highest court.
2020-08-24.snippet: Fabiana Pierre-Louis, 39, will also be the only Black judge currently seated on the state’s highest court.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Fabiana Pierre-Louis, a daughter of Haitian immigrants, is on track to become the first Black woman to sit on New Jersey’s highest court, serving at a time when the state and the country remain deeply divided over racial and economic injustice.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Daughter of Immigrants to Be 1st Black Woman on N.J. Supreme Court

2020-08-24.abstract: A virus that once paralyzed tens of thousands of children a year is said to have been eradicated on the African continent, though a minor strain still infects hundreds.
2020-08-24.snippet: A virus that once paralyzed tens of thousands of children a year is said to have been eradicated on the African continent, though a minor strain still infects hundreds.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — Africa is set to announce that it has stamped out wild poliovirus after a three-decade campaign against a disease that once paralyzed 75,000 children on the continent every year.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Africa Celebrates the End of the Wild Poliovirus (but Not the End of All Polio)

2020-08-24.abstract: A look at how U.S. colleges and universities are starting the semester, and the challenges for students with special needs.
2020-08-24.snippet: A look at how U.S. colleges and universities are starting the semester, and the challenges for students with special needs.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: In a matter of days, nearly all U.S. colleges and universities will be back in session — whether it’s online, in person, or some combination. Davidson College and The Chronicle of Higher Education are tracking the reopening plans of nearly 3,000 institutions:
2020-08-24.headline_main: Schools Briefing: The Outlook for In-Person Classes

2020-08-24.abstract: The patient did mount an immune response to the new infection, however, and did not experience symptoms.
2020-08-24.snippet: The patient did mount an immune response to the new infection, however, and did not experience symptoms.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: A 33-year-old man was infected a second time with the coronavirus more than four months after his first bout, the first documented case of so-called reinfection, researchers in Hong Kong reported Monday.
2020-08-24.headline_main: First Documented Coronavirus Reinfection Reported in Hong Kong

2020-08-24.abstract: While Louisiana’s governor said the region caught a big break as Tropical Storm Marco faded, evacuation orders were issued as communities prepared for Laura’s strength.
2020-08-24.snippet: While Louisiana’s governor said the region caught a big break as Tropical Storm Marco faded, evacuation orders were issued as communities prepared for Laura’s strength.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Tropical Storm Marco significantly weakened before making landfall on Monday night, largely sparing the Gulf Coast from the “one-two punch” of back-to-back hurricanes that meteorologists had warned might pummel Louisiana and Texas.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Marco Spares Gulf Coast, Which Is Bracing for Tropical Storm Laura

2020-08-24.abstract: American chefs are exploring the possibilities of plant-based salumi, and even home chefs can try their hand.
2020-08-24.snippet: American chefs are exploring the possibilities of plant-based salumi, and even home chefs can try their hand.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Watermelon ham. Radish prosciutto. Jerky sticks made from burdock root.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Charcuterie With All of the Smoke but None of the Meat

2020-08-24.abstract: In a conversation, the Emmy nominees O’Hara, of “Schitt’s Creek,” and Strong, of “Saturday Night Live,” talk about balancing their love of outsize characters with their aversion to the spotlight.
2020-08-24.snippet: In a conversation, the Emmy nominees O’Hara, of “Schitt’s Creek,” and Strong, of “Saturday Night Live,” talk about balancing their love of outsize characters with their aversion to the spotlight.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The 72nd Primetime Emmy Awards will be given out on Sept. 20, so we’re talking to pairs of nominated actors as we look ahead to the ceremony. (Whatever it ends up being.) For a full list of Emmy nominees and other coverage of TV’s top awards, visit nytimes.com/Emmys.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Why Catherine O’Hara and Cecily Strong Love Oblivious People

2020-08-24.abstract: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee and former vice president, seemed to suggest that most taxpayers would avoid increases if he is elected president in November, according to an interview with ABC News that aired on Sunday night.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic presidential nominee and former vice president, seemed to suggest that most taxpayers would avoid increases if he is elected president in November, according to an interview with ABC News that aired on Sunday night.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Biden reiterates a plan to raise taxes on ‘anybody making over $400,000.’

2020-08-24.abstract: Made of a fabric-like paper, these bread bags from the Italian company Uashmama give bread cozy spot on the dinner table.
2020-08-24.snippet: Made of a fabric-like paper, these bread bags from the Italian company Uashmama give bread cozy spot on the dinner table.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The buyers for Food52 have found an unusual item, a bag from Tuscany for keeping bread. It’s fashioned of sturdy washable paper by Uashmama, a company that specializes in the material and uses it for a range of products. The bread bag is made in various colors and in two sizes, suitable for round or oval loaves, cut sections and rolls (but not baguettes). And it comes with a cute terra cotta insert, which, when warmed in the oven, keeps the bread warm in the bag for maybe half an hour. You can use the bags for storing bread, too.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Your Sourdough Deserves This

2020-08-24.abstract: He released eight alt-country albums as a solo artist, seeking to emerge from the long shadow of the outlaw country star Steve Earle.
2020-08-24.snippet: He released eight alt-country albums as a solo artist, seeking to emerge from the long shadow of the outlaw country star Steve Earle.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Justin Townes Earle, an accomplished alt-country singer and songwriter who was a son of the country-rock firebrand Steve Earle, died on Thursday at his home in Nashville. He was 38.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Justin Townes Earle, Singer-Songwriter in Father’s Footsteps, Dies at 38

2020-08-24.abstract: Leonelli Focacceria e Pasticceria is now selling its chocolate chip cookies in a ready-to-bake kit.
2020-08-24.snippet: Leonelli Focacceria e Pasticceria is now selling its chocolate chip cookies in a ready-to-bake kit.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Like many restaurateurs and chefs trying to survive the pandemic, Jonathan Benno has gone into the meal kit business. Along with dinner dishes to assemble at home, his Leonelli Focacceria e Pasticceria in the NoMad section of Manhattan is offering frozen chocolate chip cookie dough, ready to bake. Leave space on the baking sheet: The dough makes hefty confections that spread to about four inches in diameter and are thickly peppered with bits of Italian chocolate. You can’t bake just one; the kit comes with a baker’s dozen.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Nothing Beats the Smell of Freshly Baked Cookies

2020-08-24.abstract: Critics say the museum is not doing enough to relate to the predominantly Black city in which it’s located or to the people of color on its staff.
2020-08-24.snippet: Critics say the museum is not doing enough to relate to the predominantly Black city in which it’s located or to the people of color on its staff.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The Detroit Institute of Arts had just avoided selling off parts of its collection to help pay the debts of the city that owned it.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Has the Detroit Institute of Arts Lost Touch With Its Home Town?

2020-08-24.abstract: The Trump Organization has stalled a state inquiry into the financing of four properties for months, Attorney General Letitia James said in court papers.
2020-08-24.snippet: The Trump Organization has stalled a state inquiry into the financing of four properties for months, Attorney General Letitia James said in court papers.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: The New York State attorney general’s office has stepped up its inquiry into whether President Trump and the Trump Organization committed fraud by overstating assets to get loans and tax benefits, asking a judge to order Eric Trump to answer questions under oath and the company to hand over documents, court papers show.
2020-08-24.headline_main: N.Y. Attorney General Asks Judge to Order Eric Trump’s Testimony

2020-08-24.abstract: For most of the past decade, North Carolina was a showcase for the Republican Party’s growth — its strength in the suburbs, in rural areas and in races up and down the ballot proving that it could dominate in parts of the country where demographics favored the Democrats. Now it could be a victim of its own excess.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: For most of the past decade, North Carolina was a showcase for the Republican Party’s growth — its strength in the suburbs, in rural areas and in races up and down the ballot proving that it could dominate in parts of the country where demographics favored the Democrats. Now it could be a victim of its own excess.
2020-08-24.headline_main: This isn’t the convention, or the election, North Carolina Republicans had hoped for.

2020-08-24.abstract: More Than a Vote, a group of athletes headlined by LeBron James, is launching a campaign to address poll worker shortages and the need to keep polling stations open in Black electoral districts.
2020-08-24.snippet: More Than a Vote, a group of athletes headlined by LeBron James, is launching a campaign to address poll worker shortages and the need to keep polling stations open in Black electoral districts.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: More Than a Vote, a collective of athletes headlined by LeBron James that is fighting to combat voter suppression, will announce a multimillion-dollar initiative to increase the number of poll workers in Black electoral districts ahead of November’s general election.
2020-08-24.headline_main: LeBron James and a Multimillion-Dollar Push for More Poll Workers

2020-08-24.abstract: The Olympic great from Jamaica said he would keep to himself for two weeks, but that he felt no symptoms of the virus.
2020-08-24.snippet: The Olympic great from Jamaica said he would keep to himself for two weeks, but that he felt no symptoms of the virus.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Usain Bolt, the Olympic great who won eight gold medals over the course of three Olympics, will quarantine while awaiting results from a coronavirus test he took on Saturday, the sprinter said in an Instagram post on Monday.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Usain Bolt Quarantines as He Awaits Result of Coronavirus Test

2020-08-24.abstract: A reader calls the former vice president our best hope to right the wrongs of the last four years. Also: Oil leasing in the Arctic refuge; Lori Loughlin’s jail sentence; prisoner firefighters; Trump donors.
2020-08-24.snippet: A reader calls the former vice president our best hope to right the wrongs of the last four years. Also: Oil leasing in the Arctic refuge; Lori Loughlin’s jail sentence; prisoner firefighters; Trump donors.

2020-08-24.snippet: Jacob Blake, a Black resident of Kenosha, was shot in the back, setting off condemnations from Wisconsin’s governor and Joe Biden, the Democrats’ presidential nominee.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: [Here’s what we know about the Jacob Blake shooting in Kenosha, Wisconsin.]
2020-08-24.headline_main: Wisconsin Reels After Police Shooting and Second Night of Protests

2020-08-24.abstract: Replete with music, masks and vibrant costumes, “Quince” and “Beast Visit” turn urban green spaces into stages for festivity.
2020-08-24.snippet: Replete with music, masks and vibrant costumes, “Quince” and “Beast Visit” turn urban green spaces into stages for festivity.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Once upon a time I thought all theater was Broadway. My early years as a freelance critic taught me differently. One summer I caught a tiny, low-budget production of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” in a Brooklyn church. Another time I ventured to a nondescript location in Hell’s Kitchen to see an experimental performance-art piece. In both cases I left unsure and a bit frightened, to suddenly see the limits of my perspective, to realize that my conception of theater was so terribly, naïvely narrow.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Outdoors in Bushwick, Gardens of Theatrical Discovery

2020-08-24.abstract: Young people who vote: They are the holy grail of any presidential campaign, but regularly getting them energized and excited is a yet-to-be-cracked formula.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Young people who vote: They are the holy grail of any presidential campaign, but regularly getting them energized and excited is a yet-to-be-cracked formula.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Ilana Glazer brings a ‘Broad City’ approach to energizing young voters.

2020-08-24.headline_main: The N.Y. attorney general asked a judge to order Eric Trump to testify about the Trump family business.

2020-08-24.abstract: “Folklore” has now sold the equivalent of 1.2 million copies, taking into account sales and streams.
2020-08-24.snippet: “Folklore” has now sold the equivalent of 1.2 million copies, taking into account sales and streams.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Rappers, your streaming numbers may be gigantic, but when it comes to the Billboard album chart they are no match for an autographed Taylor Swift CD placed on the counter of an indie record store.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Taylor Swift Spends a Fourth Week at No. 1 Thanks to Full Album Sales

2020-08-24.abstract: After rallies in the capital, Minsk, drew 100,000 people, the authorities arrested two more opposition activists and summoned others for questioning.
2020-08-24.snippet: After rallies in the capital, Minsk, drew 100,000 people, the authorities arrested two more opposition activists and summoned others for questioning.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: MINSK, Belarus — Security forces in Belarus on Monday arrested two of the last high-profile opposition figures not already in jail for protesting against the country’s authoritarian president, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko. The arrests came as a senior United States diplomat met with the embattled president’s most prominent opponent, who fled the country under duress earlier this month.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Day After Mass Protests, Belarus Arrests Opposition Activists

2020-08-24.abstract: Citing the president’s pressure on the F.D.A. to approve the expanded use of plasma, readers worry that hasty measures without sufficient testing will put patients at risk.
2020-08-24.snippet: Citing the president’s pressure on the F.D.A. to approve the expanded use of plasma, readers worry that hasty measures without sufficient testing will put patients at risk.

2020-08-24.abstract: Wild violet corn is a new seasonal offering from Baldor Specialty Foods.
2020-08-24.snippet: Wild violet corn is a new seasonal offering from Baldor Specialty Foods.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Ears of corn with purple kernels among the gold are new on the market from Baldor Specialty Foods, the wholesale company that has been delivering to retail customers during the pandemic. The corn, which comes already shucked in packs of four, is grown in Florida and New Jersey. It has the meaty, rich flavor and texture of mature corn. Baldor also carries baby corn, ears 3- to 6-inches long, sold in the husk. It’s not a dwarf variety, but regular sweet corn grown at Alewife Farm in Kingston, N.Y., and picked very young; even the central cob is tender. The smallest ones can be enjoyed raw in an assortment of crudités; larger ones are better sliced thin into a stir-fry or taco, or parboiled whole and served as a side dish. The season on these new varieties will extend into September.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Corn With a Purple Blush

2020-08-24.abstract: Perfect for an antipasto platter, these preserved tomatoes, artichokes and zucchini also work nicely in a sandwich.
2020-08-24.snippet: Perfect for an antipasto platter, these preserved tomatoes, artichokes and zucchini also work nicely in a sandwich.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Though Missy Robbins is known for homemade pasta at her two Brooklyn restaurants, Lilia and Misi, she is also an expert when it comes to preparing vegetables. Jarred marinated and grilled artichokes (16 ounces, $17), slow-roasted tomatoes in olive oil (12 ounces, $18), and lemon and garlic marinated zucchini (6 ounces, $16) are superb additions to salads, antipasto platters, sandwiches and even pasta dishes. The preserves are all from MP Specialties, one of the departments in her online store, and available for pickup at locations throughout the tristate area.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Jarred Vegetables From the Chef Missy Robbins

2020-08-24.abstract: Organic Mixology’s new chocolate and sea salt liqueur adds a sophisticated note to cocktails like the sidecar.
2020-08-24.snippet: Organic Mixology’s new chocolate and sea salt liqueur adds a sophisticated note to cocktails like the sidecar.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Organic Mixology, or OM, a line of intriguing liqueurs in combinations like Meyer Lemon & Ginger, has introduced a Dark Chocolate & Sea Salt flavor. This is not your often-cloying garden-variety chocolate spirit, but one that showcases the bitterness of dark chocolate, with the salt a subtle grace note. The company suggests using it in a sidecar or espresso martini, but I successfully added a splash to an iced coffee shakerato. And I was pleased at how nicely it came through in a 3-2-1 cocktail of dark rum, chocolate liqueur and elderflower liqueur.
2020-08-24.headline_main: This Chocolate Liqueur Is a Keeper

2020-08-24.abstract: Injuries to key players lowered the Nets’ ceiling this season. But the looming returns of Kyrie Irving and Kevin Durant bring with them higher expectations.
2020-08-24.snippet: Injuries to key players lowered the Nets’ ceiling this season. But the looming returns of Kyrie Irving and Kevin Durant bring with them higher expectations.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: If the Nets fall in the postseason, but most of the key players aren’t there to see it, did the Nets really fall?
2020-08-24.headline_main: The Nets’ Bridge Year Is Over. Now, the Real Work Begins.

2020-08-24.abstract: Kellyanne Conway, President Trump’s counselor and one of his longest-serving aides, said on Sunday night that she planned to leave the White House next week.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: Kellyanne Conway, President Trump’s counselor and one of his longest-serving aides, said on Sunday night that she planned to leave the White House next week.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Kellyanne Conway is leaving the White House.

2020-08-24.abstract: With the help of the 92nd Street Y, the historian Francine Segan will recount feasts from ancient Egypt, Greece and Rome, along with Victorian England, recipes included.
2020-08-24.snippet: With the help of the 92nd Street Y, the historian Francine Segan will recount feasts from ancient Egypt, Greece and Rome, along with Victorian England, recipes included.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: As you sit at home with that bowl of mac and cheese, you might enjoy some more lavish vicarious treats. The 92nd Street Y has scheduled a course of virtual hourlong talks about the feasts of yore, in Cleopatra’s Egypt, in ancient Greece under Alexander the Great, in gluttonous Roman times during Caesar’s reign, and in Victorian England. The classes, by the food historian Francine Segan, will include easy recipes for foods of those eras to make at home.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Dream of Historic Feasts

2020-08-24.abstract: Hong Kong reinfection, TikTok, Philippines explosions: Here’s what you need to know.
2020-08-24.snippet: Hong Kong reinfection, TikTok, Philippines explosions: Here’s what you need to know.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: A 33-year-old man was infected a second time more than four months after he initially contracted the coronavirus, a team at the University of Hong Kong said on Monday. After getting sick in Hong Kong in March, he tested positive on Aug. 15 after a trip to Spain via the United Kingdom, picking up a strain that was circulating in Europe in July and August.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Your Tuesday Briefing

2020-08-24.abstract: After winning on Sunday, the Japanese driver Takuma Sato revealed he had spent much of the year crashing at a friend’s house in Indianapolis because of the pandemic.
2020-08-24.snippet: After winning on Sunday, the Japanese driver Takuma Sato revealed he had spent much of the year crashing at a friend’s house in Indianapolis because of the pandemic.
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — Takuma Sato, the Japanese driver who has won more than $4.5 million in prize money with two victories now at the Indianapolis 500 since 2017, certainly misses the comforts of home — his home, anyway.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Winning Indy 500s and Surfing Couches

2020-08-24.abstract: In her fourth W.N.B.A. season, Gray said she was ready to do “whatever helps the team.”
2020-08-24.snippet: In her fourth W.N.B.A. season, Gray said she was ready to do “whatever helps the team.”
2020-08-24.lead_paragraph: It takes more than big names to win games in the W.N.B.A. The New York Times is talking to players across the league who are making an impact in their own way.
2020-08-24.headline_main: Dallas Wings Guard Allisha Gray Is a Gamer, in Every Way

2020-08-24.abstract: The California Supreme Court upheld Mr. Peterson’s 2004 conviction for killing his wife, Laci Peterson, but it said the judge’s mistakes had denied him an impartial jury during sentencing.
2020-08-24.snippet: The California Supreme Court upheld Mr. Peterson’s 2004 conviction for killing his wife, Laci Peterson, but it said the judge’s mistakes had denied him an impartial jury during sentencing.

2020-08-25.abstract: The three shoplifting friends return for a final season. And the OWN drama, based on Tyler Perry’s play, is back with new episodes.
2020-08-25.snippet: The three shoplifting friends return for a final season. And the OWN drama, based on Tyler Perry’s play, is back with new episodes.
2020-08-25.lead_paragraph: TRINKETS Stream on Netflix. The three friends at the center of this series — Elodie (Brianna Hildebrand), Tabitha (Quintessa Swindell) and Moe (Kiana Madeira) — are back for the show’s final season. Based on the young adult novel by Kirsten Smith, the series follows these teenagers in Portland, Ore., who form an unlikely bond after attending a Shoplifters Anonymous meeting. Despite keeping their friendship a secret from their classmates, the girls provide one another with support as they navigate abusive relationships, absent parents and compulsions to steal. In Season 2, the girls go public with their friendship, enter into new relationships and try (unsuccessfully) to stay out of trouble.
2020-08-25.headline_main: What’s on TV Tuesday: ‘Trinkets’ and ‘The Haves and the Have Nots’

2020-08-25.abstract: Fill a glass jar one third with rose buds and the rest with honey. Even if you’re skeptical of magic, let yourself enjoy the sweetness.
2020-08-25.snippet: Fill a glass jar one third with rose buds and the rest with honey. Even if you’re skeptical of magic, let yourself enjoy the sweetness.
2020-08-25.lead_paragraph: “Make heart medicine on Fridays,” says Suhaly Bautista-Carolina, 33, an herbalist and community organizer in Brooklyn. In several ancient societies, Friday was associated with a goddess of love, like Venus. In pop culture today, love potions often drug people into a kind of aphrodisiac-fueled craze, subverting individual freewill. A love potion shouldn’t be about trickery, Bautista-Carolina believes; it should be about self-realization. “The first step in being able to love someone else requires you to activate your self-love,” she says. A potion, which she defines as “a practical recipe plus magic,” might help you get there.
2020-08-25.headline_main: How to Make a Love Potion
