2020-08-29.abstract: Michael Hawkins leaves us stranded on a corner.
2020-08-29.snippet: Michael Hawkins leaves us stranded on a corner.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — Another day, another themeless Hawkins puzzle to drive us crazy. (For a fun fact, don’t miss the Constructor Notes.) Michael Hawkins is familiar, with plenty of grids under his belt including a good crunchy Saturday back in July. Today’s puzzle has a lot of offbeat elements to it that made for a pleasant ski run for me, until I skidded on the ice in the southeast corner, flew into the woods and had to wait for a dog to dig me out, the mental equivalent of what happens when I draw enough blanks that I have to leave a puzzle alone for a while. Where does that good dog come from?
2020-08-29.headline_main: Generic Rivalry

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: GET DUKED! (2019) Stream on Amazon. Three troublemaking teenagers and a strait-laced loner head out on a character-building camping excursion in the Scottish Highlands — what could go wrong? In this film, from the music-video director Ninian Doff, the boys encounter trouble in the form of a homicidal couple (played by Eddie Izzard and Georgie Glen) armed and hellbent on maintaining “the integrity of the species.” In her New York Times review, Manohla Dargis wrote that “the movie is loud, busy and cheerfully glib, though at one point — after the weapons and politics have been brandished — it takes a brief turn to sincerity.”

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Resident advisers have always played a key role in how colleges implement behavioral policies. An R.A. will typically oversee a dormitory floor or building; they are responsible for limiting parties and helping new students settle in. At some schools, R.A.s are trained in how to help prevent sexual assault. Now, colleges have drafted them to another front line.
2020-08-29.headline_main: What It’s Like to Be an R.A. Now

2020-08-29.abstract: Online and offline platforms are helping strangers form social connections, which are crucial for our health, especially in a pandemic.
2020-08-29.snippet: Online and offline platforms are helping strangers form social connections, which are crucial for our health, especially in a pandemic.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: A retired teacher, a Midwestern minister and a mother of two teenagers all dial into a Zoom room. For the next 90 minutes, they do something their typical adult lives don’t usually afford them a chance to do: listen to others’ perspectives, and have others listen to them. And after three rounds of answering not-so-standard questions, like “What sense of purpose guides you in your life?”, the group leaves the room, feeling deeply connected.

2020-08-29.snippet: Industry experts share their favorite gifts that are sure to warm any couple’s hearts and home.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: For many couples, the moment they announce their newly engaged status, questions like, “When is the wedding?” and “Where are you registered?” are sure to follow. Creating a gift registry has become an obligatory (and sometimes overwhelming) part of planning a wedding. And, for family and friends, it can sometimes feel as if there’s a fine art to picking the perfect gift that is both practical and special. We asked a few industry pros — from a celebrity planner to a celebrated fashion designer — for their favorite wedding gifts. Here are a few of them.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Wedding Presents That Will Turn Any House Into a Home

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Movies have always been escapist: During the Great Depression, audiences flocked to cinemas in an attempt to forget their worries, at least for a while. Today, as the pandemic continues, drive-in theaters have been popping up all over. In Astoria, Queens, the Bel Aire Diner started one in its parking lot, while Walmart has turned parking lots at 160 of its Supercenter locations into outdoor movie theaters with free showings through Oct. 21.

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Thousands of Germans angered over restrictions intended to control the coronavirus marched in Berlin on Saturday, but the police dispersed them after an hour because many were violating the very social-distancing rules championed by Chancellor Angela Merkel that they say threaten their rights and livelihoods.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Berlin Police Halt March Against Coronavirus Restrictions, Saying Protesters Risked Spreading Disease

2020-08-29.abstract: “Squeeze Me,” Hiaasen’s new novel, is an unabashedly political satire full of his signature high jinks.
2020-08-29.snippet: “Squeeze Me,” Hiaasen’s new novel, is an unabashedly political satire full of his signature high jinks.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Back in 2016, when reality TV stars were still funny, Carl Hiaasen wrote a book, “Razor Girl,” taking aim at some. They were the Nance brothers, an ersatz crew of bayou types who actually came from a wealthy Milwaukee suburb and had to be coached to sound like Cajuns (except for the racial and ethnic slurs, which they had down pat). The book holds up even though its “Duck Dynasty” muses have moved on.
2020-08-29.headline_main: A Python Ate the President’s Neighbor? Only in Carl Hiaasen’s Florida

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Q: My husband and I recently decided to separate after many years together. Because we jointly own the house and are both named on the mortgage, I believe we should each be entitled to time living alone there. (Our children are grown, so there are no custody issues.) My husband disagrees and refuses to leave our home for any amount of time. Since I own half the house, do I have the legal right to have it to myself half of the time?

2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After a group of Qaeda suspects was captured in September 2002, the C.I.A. flew Ali Soufan, an experienced F.B.I. counterterrorism agent, to Afghanistan to help interrogate them. But when he arrived, C.I.A. officials abruptly sent word to keep him from the two most significant new detainees.

2020-08-29.abstract: Mikaila Ulmer’s “Bee Fearless” is that rarest of book breeds: the middle grade memoir.
2020-08-29.snippet: Mikaila Ulmer’s “Bee Fearless” is that rarest of book breeds: the middle grade memoir.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: A little more than halfway through “Bee Fearless,” the 10-year-old C.E.O. Mikaila Ulmer has her first encounter with a fancy advertising agency. Its experts love the mission of her lemonade business and wonder if they can help. She takes the meeting, and a designer lets her in on a secret: “It’s not the product you sell but the story you tell.” And so we get this rarest of book breeds: the middle grade start-up memoir, by a teenager.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Catching the Buzz: A Young C.E.O. on Her Lemonade Business, Which Was Inspired by Bees

2020-08-29.abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon draw our attention to a foible.
2020-08-29.snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon draw our attention to a foible.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: ACROSTIC — Today’s excerpt is a thinker. At first, I didn’t easily reconcile its content with its author, whom I admire but know for only one reason (which proves the excerpt’s point, to get meta). After reading an expanded version, I absorbed the meaning a bit better, and I now find it very timely and profound.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Variety: Acrostic

2020-08-29.abstract: A photographer tries to find the moments of stillness.
2020-08-29.snippet: A photographer tries to find the moments of stillness.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: This year’s conventions were not typical ones for photographers to shoot. Absent the massive crowds, bustling auditoriums and balloon fanfare of conventions past, they were left staring at candidates through a screen.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Conventions to Match a Surreal Year

2020-08-29.abstract: A modern-day Scheherazade uses storytelling to survive the fifth grade.
2020-08-29.snippet: A modern-day Scheherazade uses storytelling to survive the fifth grade.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: When I was growing up, my bedtime stories involved great warriors and kings, the heroes of ancient Persia. Many came from the “Shahnameh,” an epic Persian poem that weaves the history of Iran like a colorful tapestry. In “Everything Sad Is Untrue,” Daniel Nayeri weaves an equally rich history of his family’s journey from Iran to America.
2020-08-29.headline_main: From Iran to America, One Epic Tale at a Time

2020-08-29.abstract: A Japanese company said it had completed a manned flight of its electrical vertical takeoff and landing machine. Experts say the technology needs work and that it will be expensive.
2020-08-29.snippet: A Japanese company said it had completed a manned flight of its electrical vertical takeoff and landing machine. Experts say the technology needs work and that it will be expensive.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: In the 1880s, the first automobile was developed and about two decades later, the Wright brothers in North Carolina invented the first successful airplane. Today, the world is closer to combining those two concepts as a Japanese tech company said it completed a manned test flight of a “flying car.”
2020-08-29.headline_main: Humans Take a Step Closer to ‘Flying Cars’

2020-08-29.abstract: Nominated for two Oscars, “Honeyland” charted the tensions between a hermitic beekeeper and her disorderly neighbors. Now the filmmakers are struggling to disentangle themselves from their subjects.
2020-08-29.snippet: Nominated for two Oscars, “Honeyland” charted the tensions between a hermitic beekeeper and her disorderly neighbors. Now the filmmakers are struggling to disentangle themselves from their subjects.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: BEKIRLIJA, North Macedonia — When the producer and two directors of “Honeyland” returned to the setting of their documentary in North Macedonia for the first time since it earned two Oscar nominations in February, something fundamental had changed.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Film Crew Spent 3 Years in Remote Balkan Hamlet. Will They Ever Leave?

2020-08-29.abstract: It can be like therapy, only cheaper, and provides a chronicle of our times.
2020-08-29.snippet: It can be like therapy, only cheaper, and provides a chronicle of our times.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Looking for a way to relax in these tense times? A way to know yourself better? To improve your writing and the stories you tell others about yourself? To create something that outlasts you? And for psychotherapy, on the cheap? What better time than now to start writing a journal.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Now Is the Time to Start Keeping a Journal

2020-08-29.abstract: This year is ‘almost like a full reset. A horrible reset, but a full reset.’
2020-08-29.snippet: This year is ‘almost like a full reset. A horrible reset, but a full reset.’
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: During a usual school year, Maria Davis-Pierre is one of those parents who regularly reach out to their children’s teachers. A mother of three in Lake Worth, Fla., and the founder of the parenting organization Autism in Black, Ms. Davis-Pierre checks in monthly via email and requests meetings upon receiving progress reports, working with her kids’ teachers to make sure that her eldest daughter especially — who is 8 and on the autism spectrum — is meeting her goals and getting the most from her schooling. “Especially for Black parents, we have to let them know that we’re involved,” Ms. Davis-Pierre said. “We want to know what’s going on.”
2020-08-29.headline_main: How to Forge a Solid Parent-Teacher Relationship

2020-08-29.abstract: Get rid of moderators? Use a chess clock? Hold them virtually? Eliminate debates altogether? Readers offer their suggestions.
2020-08-29.snippet: Get rid of moderators? Use a chess clock? Hold them virtually? Eliminate debates altogether? Readers offer their suggestions.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2020-08-29.headline_main: Ideas for Better Political Debates

2020-08-29.abstract: Can Britain reopen its schools safely? The Tory government is confident it can, but after an exam grading fiasco, trust in the government is running low.
2020-08-29.snippet: Can Britain reopen its schools safely? The Tory government is confident it can, but after an exam grading fiasco, trust in the government is running low.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When pupils return to Southend High School For Boys next week, the cafeteria will serve takeout food only and lunch will be eaten outside. Lessons will stretch to two-and-a-half hours to reduce the need to switch classrooms. And new equipment has been bought to spray the sports changing rooms with disinfectant.
2020-08-29.headline_main: U.K. Braces for School Return Amid Fears of Virus Spike

2020-08-29.abstract: In Lafayette, La., frustration and fatigue set in after storms, a pandemic and now a fatal police shooting that some residents believe is being overshadowed.
2020-08-29.snippet: In Lafayette, La., frustration and fatigue set in after storms, a pandemic and now a fatal police shooting that some residents believe is being overshadowed.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live Hurricane Sally updates and our map tracker.]
2020-08-29.headline_main: In One Louisiana City, a Police Shooting, a Pandemic and a Hurricane

2020-08-29.abstract: One person was critically hurt after a New Jersey Transit bus struck a barrier on a ramp at 39th Street and Ninth Avenue in Manhattan, the authorities said.
2020-08-29.snippet: One person was critically hurt after a New Jersey Transit bus struck a barrier on a ramp at 39th Street and Ninth Avenue in Manhattan, the authorities said.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Sixteen people were hurt, one critically, in a bus crash on a ramp near the Port Authority terminal in Manhattan on Saturday morning, the authorities said.
2020-08-29.headline_main: 16 Injured in Bus Accident Near Port Authority

2020-08-29.abstract: The Trump campaign wants to lure back moderates who believe that the president has lurched too far right and openly courted extremists.
2020-08-29.snippet: The Trump campaign wants to lure back moderates who believe that the president has lurched too far right and openly courted extremists.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: President Trump and his party are entering the nine-week stretch until Election Day with their success riding on a hope that enough voters come to the following conclusion: You’re not as bad as we thought.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Trump’s Strategy: Make ‘Wobbly Republicans’ Think Their Party Is Great Again

2020-08-29.abstract: If you’ve decided to temporarily relocate, make sure your essential correspondence and eagerly anticipated packages can find you.
2020-08-29.snippet: If you’ve decided to temporarily relocate, make sure your essential correspondence and eagerly anticipated packages can find you.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: With many employers allowing staffers to work remotely well into 2021, you may be considering a temporary move. Perhaps you have relatives who need help with child care, or elderly parents to look after. Or maybe, if you’re going to be all alone for the next few months anyway, you’ve decided having deer as neighbors in a tiny house in the woods sounds better than communing with the roaches in your apartment.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Have a New Address? Don’t Lose Your Mail

2020-08-29.abstract: In an 11th-hour twist, Beijing raised a potential hurdle for a sale of TikTok, further roiling the race to buy the Chinese-owned app.
2020-08-29.snippet: In an 11th-hour twist, Beijing raised a potential hurdle for a sale of TikTok, further roiling the race to buy the Chinese-owned app.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: As the sale of TikTok enters its final stages, Beijing is saying it wants the last word.
2020-08-29.headline_main: TikTok Deal Is Complicated by New Rules From China Over Tech Exports

2020-08-29.abstract: Why are some schools pressuring student-athletes to play a game that could expose them to the coronavirus?
2020-08-29.snippet: Why are some schools pressuring student-athletes to play a game that could expose them to the coronavirus?
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: For more than six months now, many workers deemed essential have had to strap on face masks for shifts at meatpacking plants, Walmarts, grocery stores, hardware stores and restaurants. It is a necessary sacrifice for the nation’s well-being. But at universities across the country, while scores of professors, staff and students start the academic year remotely to curb the spread of the coronavirus, another class of worker will be asked to strap on protective gear to do their job — without the face coverings: college football players.
2020-08-29.headline_main: College Football Is Not Essential

2020-08-29.abstract: Threatening to turn families out of their homes during the coronavirus fight isn’t just morally suspect; it’s dangerous.
2020-08-29.snippet: Threatening to turn families out of their homes during the coronavirus fight isn’t just morally suspect; it’s dangerous.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: A year and a half ago, Jhon Loaiza and his wife, Sugey Bedoya, moved with their three daughters — now 12, 5 and 3 — from a two-bedroom apartment in New York City to a compact brick ranch house in San Antonio. They loved that house — its fenced-in backyard and four whole bedrooms, each with soft tan carpet — and their new city. They would walk by the river with ice cream or ride bikes after Sunday church. At night, Mr. Loaiza would put on salsa or reggaeton, twirling his girls around the living room and laughing. His broad smile forced his dimples to crease in.
2020-08-29.headline_main: The Rent Eats First, Even During a Pandemic

2020-08-29.abstract: He uses scare tactics about “law and order.” But what distinguishes this White House is its ties to criminals.
2020-08-29.snippet: He uses scare tactics about “law and order.” But what distinguishes this White House is its ties to criminals.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Even as President Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination on the White House lawn, lawbreakers rampaged through the capital.
2020-08-29.headline_main: The Lawbreakers Trump Loves

2020-08-29.abstract: President Trump met with state and local officials in Louisiana and Texas after Hurricane Laura devastated the region. Many people still have no electricity or running water.
2020-08-29.snippet: President Trump met with state and local officials in Louisiana and Texas after Hurricane Laura devastated the region. Many people still have no electricity or running water.

2020-08-29.abstract: There’s no denying his charm and genuine passion for baseball. But his habit of overstepping boundaries would have made him an uncomfortable presence if he had succeeded in purchasing the Mets.
2020-08-29.snippet: There’s no denying his charm and genuine passion for baseball. But his habit of overstepping boundaries would have made him an uncomfortable presence if he had succeeded in purchasing the Mets.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: From the very start, Alex Rodriguez has been an achiever. He was the first overall draft pick at 17 years old and a batting champion at 21. He was the richest player in baseball at 25 and a three-time most valuable player at 32.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Denying Alex Rodriguez, Mets Avoid a Risky Presence in the Owner’s Box

2020-08-29.abstract: Olivia Mitra Framke’s puzzle has subtle and unpredictable ramifications.
2020-08-29.snippet: Olivia Mitra Framke’s puzzle has subtle and unpredictable ramifications.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: *Important note for electronic solvers: The center box of this puzzle, which falls between 62- and 63-Across, is notably shaded gray in the print version, which makes it stand out from the beginning of the solve. This small difference alters the whole feel of working the puzzle, which is kind of confusing but appropriate, as you will see.
2020-08-29.headline_main: All Aflutter

2020-08-29.abstract: The Democratic presidential nominee hit back at attacks delivered at the Republican National Convention.
2020-08-29.snippet: The Democratic presidential nominee hit back at attacks delivered at the Republican National Convention.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: Follow our latest coverage of the Biden vs. Trump 2020 election here.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Biden, Speaking to National Guard Group, Takes Aim at Republican Criticism on Crime

2020-08-29.abstract: So many people have been chasing the 50 stragglers that the animals got spooked and split off into singles and pairs, complicating efforts to catch them, a sheriff said.
2020-08-29.snippet: So many people have been chasing the 50 stragglers that the animals got spooked and split off into singles and pairs, complicating efforts to catch them, a sheriff said.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: After more than 100 bison escaped from a feedlot in southern Nebraska, local residents hopped into pickup trucks and onto horses and four-wheelers to try to catch the fleeing animals.
2020-08-29.headline_main: Bison Are On the Run After 125 Escape a Nebraska Feedlot

2020-08-29.abstract: The cancer that killed Chadwick Boseman is the second-leading cause of cancer deaths in the United States, and rates are rising among younger people.
2020-08-29.snippet: The cancer that killed Chadwick Boseman is the second-leading cause of cancer deaths in the United States, and rates are rising among younger people.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: In the wake of Chadwick Boseman’s death from colon cancer at age 43, many people have questions about the disease, especially about the risk of colon cancer in younger people. Here’s what is known and what experts recommend.
2020-08-29.headline_main: What to Know About Colon Cancer

2020-08-29.abstract: Comfortable urban elites long tolerated the eccentricities of the country’s ruler, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko. Then came the coronavirus and a blatantly falsified presidential election.
2020-08-29.snippet: Comfortable urban elites long tolerated the eccentricities of the country’s ruler, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko. Then came the coronavirus and a blatantly falsified presidential election.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: MINSK, Belarus — Denis Dudinsky, the longhaired and mustachioed host of “Good Morning Belarus!,” can still hear the producer’s nervous voice in his ear any time his banter approached something remotely political.
2020-08-29.headline_main: ‘Something Broke Inside Belarusians.’ Why an Apolitical People Rose Up

2020-08-29.abstract: The actor, who died Friday at 43, exploded the parameters of what biographical moviemaking ought to be.
2020-08-29.snippet: The actor, who died Friday at 43, exploded the parameters of what biographical moviemaking ought to be.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: The problem with dignity is that there’s not much an actor can do with it. Not when he’s playing Jackie Robinson or Thurgood Marshall, not when you’re the leader of a made-up African kingdom, like Wakanda.
2020-08-29.headline_main: It’s Hard to Make Dignity Interesting. Chadwick Boseman Found a Way.

2020-08-29.abstract: Lawmakers in both parties worry the move will block their ability to question and test intelligence assessments that can be crucial to ensuring that foreign powers do not undermine election results.
2020-08-29.snippet: Lawmakers in both parties worry the move will block their ability to question and test intelligence assessments that can be crucial to ensuring that foreign powers do not undermine election results.
2020-08-29.lead_paragraph: The nation’s top intelligence officials moved on Saturday to tighten control over the flow of sensitive intelligence about foreign threats to November’s election, telling Congress that they would no longer provide in-person briefings about election security and would rely solely on written updates instead.
2020-08-29.headline_main: No More In-Person Election Briefings for Congress, Intelligence Chief Says

2020-08-29.abstract: A new crop of activists has joined the ranks of protesters in Kenosha, Wis., as police killings across the country spur ordinary people into the streets. Jacob Blake’s family spoke at a rally on Saturday.
2020-08-29.snippet: A new crop of activists has joined the ranks of protesters in Kenosha, Wis., as police killings across the country spur ordinary people into the streets. Jacob Blake’s family spoke at a rally on Saturday.
2020-08-29.headline_main: ‘Enough Is Enough’: New Racial Justice Leaders Rise in Kenosha

2020-08-30.abstract: “This group wants to do both,” Coach Mike Budenholzer said of pursuing a championship without abandoning the team’s efforts to combat police brutality and systemic racism.
2020-08-30.snippet: “This group wants to do both,” Coach Mike Budenholzer said of pursuing a championship without abandoning the team’s efforts to combat police brutality and systemic racism.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla. — It is bound to be forgotten with time that the Milwaukee Bucks, determined as they were in their pursuit of social justice, merely wanted to forfeit a basketball game Wednesday. The Bucks initially believed that they could stage a one-game, spur-of-the-moment walkout, even during the N.B.A. playoffs, without far-reaching consequences.
2020-08-30.headline_main: The Milwaukee Bucks Are Back, but They’re Not Leaving Activism Behind

2020-08-30.abstract: The settlement, which is for more than $470,000, comes after an episode last year in which officers responded to a shoplifting complaint at a Family Dollar store.
2020-08-30.snippet: The settlement, which is for more than $470,000, comes after an episode last year in which officers responded to a shoplifting complaint at a Family Dollar store.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: The city of Phoenix has reached a settlement with a Black family for more than $470,000 after a widely viewed video last year showed police officers drawing their weapons and shouting expletives at the family while responding to a shoplifting complaint.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Phoenix Settles With Black Family After Police Drew Guns Over Reported Doll Theft

2020-08-30.abstract: With a few folds and some tape you can soon be launching soft projectiles.
2020-08-30.snippet: With a few folds and some tape you can soon be launching soft projectiles.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: The use of catapults can be traced to the Greeks, Romans and Chinese more than 2,000 years ago. They were particularly popular during the Middle Ages as a way to launch projectiles over the walls of forts and castles. The catapult mechanism, also known as a lever, was, and still is, used to lift and move objects. If you have ever tossed a ball or played on a seesaw you have experienced the power of a lever.
2020-08-30.headline_main: How to Build a Catapult From Newspaper

2020-08-30.abstract: “It has been challenging mentally and emotionally for me to stay sane,” said Novak Djokovic, who beat Milos Raonic on Saturday while working to create a controversial new players’ association.
2020-08-30.snippet: “It has been challenging mentally and emotionally for me to stay sane,” said Novak Djokovic, who beat Milos Raonic on Saturday while working to create a controversial new players’ association.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: After a six-month break from the tour, you might have expected tennis stars to look fresher than ever as they returned to playing in earnest.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Amid Tennis’s Swirling Storms, a Stubborn Djokovic Claims a Title

2020-08-30.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, August 30, 2020.
2020-08-30.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, August 30, 2020.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: “I’ve been to student funerals. I would prefer not to go to any more.”
2020-08-30.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: District by District, a Plan for In-Person Schooling Falls Apart

2020-08-30.abstract: The self-governing democracy is taking steps to bolster its armed forces in order to deter or defeat an invasion from China — with or without American help.
2020-08-30.snippet: The self-governing democracy is taking steps to bolster its armed forces in order to deter or defeat an invasion from China — with or without American help.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: On a cloudy day last month, thousands of soldiers massed on a beach in central Taiwan for the culmination of five days of exercises intended to demonstrate how the island’s military would repel an invasion from China.
2020-08-30.headline_main: With a Wary Eye on China, Taiwan Moves to Revamp Its Military

2020-08-30.abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Aug. 30, 2020.
2020-08-30.snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, Aug. 30, 2020.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, a picture caption with an article on Page 4 about the golden age of televised theater misidentifies the production company for “Twelve Angry Men.” It was Studio One, not Playhouse 90.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Corrections: Aug. 30, 2020

2020-08-30.abstract: Will he ever face the Japanese people’s calls for accountability?
2020-08-30.snippet: Will he ever face the Japanese people’s calls for accountability?
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Prime Minister Shinzo Abe’s announcement on Friday that he would resign because of poor health was a rather abrupt end for a supposedly strong leader. Mr. Abe has ruled Japan, most recently, for a record seven years and eight months: He is the country’s longest-serving prime minister.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Shinzo Abe Is Quitting, and Leaving a Trail of Scandals Behind

2020-08-30.abstract: A man affiliated with a right-wing group was shot and killed Saturday night. A caravan of supporters of President Trump had driven into downtown Portland.
2020-08-30.snippet: A man affiliated with a right-wing group was shot and killed Saturday night. A caravan of supporters of President Trump had driven into downtown Portland.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — A fatal shooting during a night of political conflict in Portland, Ore., has yet again escalated tensions in the city and further inflamed the issues of crime, protest and race that President Trump is trying to make a focus of presidential politics.
2020-08-30.headline_main: One Person Dead in Portland After Clashes Between Trump Supporters and Protesters

2020-08-30.headline_main: ‘I Turned to See a Man Behind Me Wearing a Sweater That I Also Own’

2020-08-30.abstract: Universities are pioneering technology that could help society combat the pandemic.
2020-08-30.snippet: Universities are pioneering technology that could help society combat the pandemic.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: Thousands of students returning to the Rochester Institute of Technology in New York this month are being asked to wear masks in public, register their health status online each day and electronically log classroom visits for contact tracing if a coronavirus outbreak occurs. But the most novel effort at the school to measure and limit virus spread will require little effort and come quite naturally.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Looking to Reopen, Colleges Become Labs for Coronavirus Tests and Tracking Apps

2020-08-30.abstract: The pandemic is spurring home sales as prosperous city residents seek more space. One listing had 97 showings and received 24 offers.
2020-08-30.snippet: The pandemic is spurring home sales as prosperous city residents seek more space. One listing had 97 showings and received 24 offers.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: Over three days in late July, a three-bedroom house in East Orange, N.J., was listed for sale for $285,000, had 97 showings, received 24 offers and went under contract for 21 percent over that price.
2020-08-30.headline_main: New Yorkers Are Fleeing to the Suburbs: ‘The Demand Is Insane’

2020-08-30.abstract: Limitations imposed by the coronavirus have helped, not hurt, the performances of some world-class athletes.
2020-08-30.snippet: Limitations imposed by the coronavirus have helped, not hurt, the performances of some world-class athletes.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: Ryan Crouser, the 2016 Olympic shot-put champion, expected to defend his gold medal in Tokyo this summer. He did not expect to enter bass-fishing tournaments to stoke competitive fires doused by a coronavirus pandemic.
2020-08-30.headline_main: The Pandemic’s Secret Formula: Backyard Workouts and Lots of Sleep

2020-08-30.abstract: Ayahuasca, a vomit-inducing hallucinogenic brew, draws thousands of people each year — including former soldiers — to jungle retreats that have become an unlicensed and unregulated mental health marketplace.
2020-08-30.snippet: Ayahuasca, a vomit-inducing hallucinogenic brew, draws thousands of people each year — including former soldiers — to jungle retreats that have become an unlicensed and unregulated mental health marketplace.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: GIGANTE, Costa Rica — There was a ghostlike quality to Rudy Gonsior, an American former Special Forces sniper, on the morning he arrived at a jungle retreat to see if a vomit-inducing psychedelic brew could undo the damage years of combat had done to his mind.
2020-08-30.headline_main: ‘A Hail Mary’: Psychedelic Therapy Draws Veterans to Jungle Retreats

2020-08-30.abstract: An ex-boyfriend’s run-ins with the law entangled her even as she tried to move on. Interviews, documents and jailhouse recordings help explain how she landed in the middle of a deadly drug raid.
2020-08-30.snippet: An ex-boyfriend’s run-ins with the law entangled her even as she tried to move on. Interviews, documents and jailhouse recordings help explain how she landed in the middle of a deadly drug raid.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Breonna Taylor’s Life Was Changing. Then the Police Came to Her Door.

2020-08-30.abstract: The MTV Video Music Awards come to New York. And a new documentary retraces a major art world scandal.
2020-08-30.snippet: The MTV Video Music Awards come to New York. And a new documentary retraces a major art world scandal.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: THE MTV VIDEO MUSIC AWARDS 8 p.m. on MTV and the CW; Stream on vma.mtv.com. MTV’s Video Music Awards will go on this year, held at various outdoor locations in New York City. Keke Palmer will host the event, and Miley Cyrus, Lady Gaga and Ariana Grande are scheduled to perform. Lady Gaga and Ariana Grande’s collaboration “Rain on Me” was nominated for seven awards, including video and song of the year. The show will also give out two new awards created because of the coronavirus pandemic: best music video from home and best quarantine performance. Preshow performances and interviews will air ahead of the main event at 6:30 p.m. Eastern on MTV.
2020-08-30.headline_main: What’s on TV Sunday: The VMAs and ‘Driven to Abstraction’

2020-08-30.abstract: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
2020-08-30.snippet: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Homes That Sold for Around $750,000

2020-08-30.abstract: The city is used to holding so many big events, but what is possible with the coronavirus? As the United States Open begins on Monday under a microscope, the answer could be at hand.
2020-08-30.snippet: The city is used to holding so many big events, but what is possible with the coronavirus? As the United States Open begins on Monday under a microscope, the answer could be at hand.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: It was late-March in New York, just five months but seemingly a lifetime ago, and the leaders of tennis in the United States already knew that this year’s U.S. Open would be unlike anything they had ever experienced, if they could stage it at all.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Will the U.S. Open Show That Big Events Can Return to New York?

2020-08-30.abstract: The Oscar-nominated actor narrates “The Autobiography of Malcolm X” in an audiobook project he says “doesn’t change my perspective so much as it amplifies it.”
2020-08-30.snippet: The Oscar-nominated actor narrates “The Autobiography of Malcolm X” in an audiobook project he says “doesn’t change my perspective so much as it amplifies it.”

2020-08-30.abstract: Current and former workers at Carta, a hot Silicon Valley fintech company, said they were belittled, excluded and punished if they spoke up.
2020-08-30.snippet: Current and former workers at Carta, a hot Silicon Valley fintech company, said they were belittled, excluded and punished if they spoke up.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Onstage at an industry conference last year, Henry Ward, chief executive of the financial technology start-up Carta, described his vision for transforming the way that workers get paid.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Preaching Equality, Start-Up Didn’t Practice It With Employees

2020-08-30.abstract: The coronavirus was an opportunity for the Treasury secretary to redefine his legacy, for better or worse.
2020-08-30.snippet: The coronavirus was an opportunity for the Treasury secretary to redefine his legacy, for better or worse.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: One spring day, not long after President Trump signed the largest economic stimulus package in American history in March, a group of his top aides and cabinet officers gathered in the Oval Office.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Steven Mnuchin Tried to Save the Economy. Not Even His Family Is Happy.

2020-08-30.abstract: Common conditions often manifest differently on dark skin. Yet physicians are trained mostly to diagnose them on white skin.
2020-08-30.snippet: Common conditions often manifest differently on dark skin. Yet physicians are trained mostly to diagnose them on white skin.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: In the spring, teenagers started showing up at doctors’ offices in droves with angry red and purple blisters on their fingers and toes. The latest unexpected feature of the coronavirus infection fascinated the public, and suddenly photographs of so-called Covid toes were everywhere on social media.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Dermatology Has a Problem With Skin Color

2020-08-30.abstract: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.

He was 89.

2020-08-30.snippet: Theater in Quarantine’s latest small-scale, digitally savvy production is an adaptation of a Borges story about a man stopping time to stare down death.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: “We cross infinity with every step; we meet eternity in every second,” wrote Rabindranath Tagore. Tagore could have been talking about the beautifully labyrinthine work of the Argentine writer Jorge Luis Borges, which works like a mathematical equation without end, and where time is as flexible as putty.

2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: The decision by the nation’s top intelligence official to halt classified, in-person briefings to Congress about foreign interference in a presidential election that is just nine weeks away exposes the fundamental tension about who needs to know this information: just the president, or the voters whose election infrastructure, and minds, are the target of the hacking?

2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — People use an infinite variety of things and hobbies to distract themselves from troubled times, and I’m no different. My knitting needles are clicking at an impressive rate, and I have recently taken up making fermented foods, like kimchi, dill pickles and sauerkraut, because I am also a kitchen science geek. I’m sure you’re doing all sorts of interesting things, too.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Pass on an Interstate

2020-08-30.abstract: A strange season continued as the Yankees and Mets ended a five-game weekend series at Yankee Stadium on Sunday with two extra-inning games, though each of them lasted only eight innings.

2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: If you had somehow forgotten the uniqueness of the 2020 Major League Baseball season, the Yankees’ weekend series against the Mets had plenty of reminders. They played five games in three days at Yankee Stadium after a Mets player and staff member tested positive for the coronavirus, forcing a postponement of the previous weekend’s series at Citi Field.
2020-08-30.headline_main: It’s Confusing Sometimes, but the Yankees Manage to Stay on Track

2020-08-30.abstract: In a year that has filled morgues, emptied schools, shuttered workplaces, swelled unemployment lines and polarized the electorate, these are a few of the Americans struggling to respond.
2020-08-30.snippet: In a year that has filled morgues, emptied schools, shuttered workplaces, swelled unemployment lines and polarized the electorate, these are a few of the Americans struggling to respond.
2020-08-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — And then Chadwick Boseman died. On a Friday night, a way-too-young Hollywood star who had inspired fans around the world suddenly was gone without warning. After everything else, it was just too much for many. “I HATE 2020” began trending on Twitter. Not for the first time and probably not for the last.
2020-08-30.headline_main: Stories of 2020: Five Lives Caught in a Year of Upheaval and Pain

2020-08-31.abstract: An Amazon sports docuseries returns, this time focusing on the soccer club Tottenham Hotspur. And an athletic competition show prepares for a new season with a special event.
2020-08-31.snippet: An Amazon sports docuseries returns, this time focusing on the soccer club Tottenham Hotspur. And an athletic competition show prepares for a new season with a special event.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: ALL OR NOTHING: TOTTENHAM HOTSPUR Stream on Amazon. Tottenham Hotspur, an English Premier League soccer club located in North London, endured two major upheavals last season: the replacement of its manager Mauricio Pochettino with José Mourinho, and the suspension of league play because of the coronavirus pandemic. This documentary series provides a peek behind the scenes during these difficult periods. Some fans and commentators were skeptical about the decision to hire Mourinho because his managerial style diverges sharply from Pochettino’s, which was successful for several years. After an inconclusive sixth place finish in July, the jury is still out about the choice. Perhaps this series will give a sense of how the coming season will play out.
2020-08-31.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘All or Nothing’ and ‘American Ninja Warrior’

2020-08-31.abstract: After nearly 3,000 tons of ammonium nitrate caused a devastating explosion in Beirut, Lebanon, the West African nation of Senegal discovered the same amount sitting in its port in Dakar.

2020-08-31.headline_main: Eye on Beirut, Senegal Port Rushes to Truck Away Tons of Ammonium Nitrate

2020-08-31.abstract: The problem, a brief but precipitous drop in blood pressure that causes lightheadedness or dizziness when standing up, is called orthostatic hypotension.
2020-08-31.snippet: The problem, a brief but precipitous drop in blood pressure that causes lightheadedness or dizziness when standing up, is called orthostatic hypotension.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: Orthostatic hypotension — to many people those are unfamiliar words for a relatively common but often unrecognized medical problem that can have devastating consequences, especially for older adults. It refers to a brief but precipitous drop in blood pressure that causes lightheadedness or dizziness when standing up after lying down or sitting, and sometimes even after standing, for a prolonged period.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Dizziness Upon Standing Can Lead to Falls and Fractures

2020-08-31.abstract: Because William Blake was right: Every living thing is holy.
2020-08-31.snippet: Because William Blake was right: Every living thing is holy.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: One of my sons noticed it before the rest of us did: a hawk perched on the edge of the birdbath mounted to our deck rail, only a few feet from the back door. One great yellow claw gripped the edge of the shallow bowl; the other claw was curled up and tucked into the bird’s breast feathers as though for sleep. It was the middle of a bright Sunday afternoon, but the hawk had settled in for a stay. Its coloring — the brown streaking, the pale eyes — indicated a young Cooper’s hawk, not long out of the nest.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Hawk. Lizard. Mole. Human.

2020-08-31.abstract: If anyone could outsmart a wildfire, it would seem to be Tad Jones, who lived for decades in a California forest, more a friend of nature than of man.
2020-08-31.snippet: If anyone could outsmart a wildfire, it would seem to be Tad Jones, who lived for decades in a California forest, more a friend of nature than of man.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: LAST CHANCE, Calif. — Even for Last Chance, a rugged community in the forests above the Pacific Ocean where residents mill their own lumber and grow their own food, Tad Jones was particularly ascetic. He shunned electricity and plumbing. He once spent a year living in the hollow base of a redwood tree. For decades he took a vow of silence, scrawling in notebooks or on a tiny chalkboard when he had something to say.
2020-08-31.headline_main: A Vow of Silence, a Cabin in the Woods, a Terrible Wildfire

2020-08-31.abstract: After years of bloodshed, the country’s transitional government reached an agreement with most but not all of the groups fighting in Darfur and elsewhere.
2020-08-31.snippet: After years of bloodshed, the country’s transitional government reached an agreement with most but not all of the groups fighting in Darfur and elsewhere.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — Hoping to put an end to nearly two decades of bloodshed that has left hundreds of thousands dead and millions more displaced, the transitional government of Sudan signed a peace agreement with an alliance of rebel groups on Monday to end fighting in Darfur and the southern regions of South Kordofan and the Blue Nile.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Sudan Signs Peace Deal With Rebel Alliance

2020-08-31.abstract: Theater for One was built on the idea of face-to-face encounters. Moving it online could have been a disaster, but instead it’s a heartbreaker.
2020-08-31.snippet: Theater for One was built on the idea of face-to-face encounters. Moving it online could have been a disaster, but instead it’s a heartbreaker.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: After my first experience of Theater for One — back in pre-pandemic days, when it meant sharing a small booth with an actor who performed a short play for you — I imagined it as what speed dating would be if you fell in love with everyone you met. Sitting that close to an actor’s face, hearing a story I could not avoid being part of because no one else was there to hear it, I was instantly drawn into the uncanny, enraptured collaboration of theater, with its roots in campfire tales and community bonding and a parent’s hushed voice at bedtime.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Review: It’s Just You and Me and the Modem in ‘Here We Are’

2020-08-31.headline_main: John Thompson, Hall of Fame Basketball Coach, Dies at 78

Stopped short, the Blackhawks could only watch as the victorious Vegas Golden Knights hugged out their five-game series win. Both teams then removed the gloves they had been wearing, lining up for the handshakes that hockey tradition demands.

2020-08-31.abstract: The coronavirus is spreading much faster in Spain than anywhere else in Europe. After a relative lull during the summer, experts fear it signals a new surge across the continent.

2020-08-31.headline_main: ‘Here We Go Again’: A Second Virus Wave Grips Spain

2020-08-31.abstract: A new performance series, Arts on the Roof, affords some of the few opportunities to watch live dance in New York this summer and fall.
2020-08-31.snippet: A new performance series, Arts on the Roof, affords some of the few opportunities to watch live dance in New York this summer and fall.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The dancer Chelsea Ainsworth stood before a small outdoor audience on Friday night, about to perform live for the first time in 25 weeks. Beneath her tap shoe-clad feet was a plywood stage that she and her husband, the visual artist Kyle Netzeband, had spent the past two days constructing by hand. The elevator in their East Village building was broken, so they had to lug materials up six flights of stairs. But that wasn’t going to stop them: They were determined to bring dance to a live audience, on the rooftop where the finished stage now stood.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Up on the Roof, Flesh and Blood Dancers Move and Connect

2020-08-31.abstract: It’s the biggest decline of any major economy. Economists say once the impact on the country’s vast “informal” work force is taken into account, the damage might be even worse.

2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — The Indian economy contracted by 23.9 percent in the second quarter, the most drastic fall in decades, as lockdown restrictions meant to contain the spread of the coronavirus wiped out jobs and businesses.
2020-08-31.headline_main: India’s Economy Shrank Nearly 24 Percent Last Quarter

2020-08-31.abstract: I’m no merry home educator, but I’ll be channeling the “Magic School Bus” captain when my children and I return for round two of remote learning.
2020-08-31.snippet: I’m no merry home educator, but I’ll be channeling the “Magic School Bus” captain when my children and I return for round two of remote learning.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: A few of my mom friends have confided in me that they don’t completely mind living and learning in lockdown. After the requisite acknowledgments about their own relative luck in a world in free fall, they lower their voices and make their confessions. One woman, whose family relocated from downtown Manhattan to a cabin upstate, said that she prefers her new “Little House on The Prairie” life, an opinion borne out by her Instagram account’s steady feed of children romping about the woods, scribbling in notebooks and making crafts out of sticks. Another friend, who contracted the coronavirus not long after school closed last March, told me that she has never been so happy as when she’s had her entire family underfoot. “Call me crazy,” she said, “but I like home-schooling.”
2020-08-31.headline_main: This School Year, Unleash Your Inner Ms. Frizzle

2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: With so many oyster producers now shipping directly to home addresses, it pays to be schooled in opening them, a worthwhile party trick that requires guidance and equipment. Both are on offer, along with oyster-friendly wine tastings, at Seamore’s in Battery Park City, part of a group of seafood restaurants with locations around New York City. Bucketlisters.com, an organization that works with tours and experiences in several cities, is the partner here. Each 90-minute session, with socially distant seating, includes a dozen East Coast oysters (four varieties) to pry and slurp, and four wines to sample with them. You get to keep the knife and protective glove.

2020-08-31.abstract: Throughout his career, Simon Watson has brought his unique eye to crumbling castles, monastic apartments and everything in between.
2020-08-31.snippet: Throughout his career, Simon Watson has brought his unique eye to crumbling castles, monastic apartments and everything in between.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: In the 1530s, Cardinal Marcello Cervini, the future Pope Marcellus II, bought Castello Cervini, a medieval monastery surrounded by chestnut trees in Tuscany’s Vivo d’Orcia estate. And while Marcellus II passed away just 22 days after ascending to the papacy in 1555, his family has retained the property for four centuries and counting. By the time the photographer Simon Watson visited, in 2002, Marcellus’s descendants Daria Cervini and her siblings had turned the castle into a summer retreat, but many tokens of the family’s past remained, and a portrait of the ill-fated pope in a crimson mozzetta kept watch over all.
2020-08-31.headline_main: A New Book from a Renowned Photographer of Interiors

2020-08-31.abstract: The Mount Kisco, N.Y., company teamed up with the Metropolitan Museum to create a special assortment of bars as fund-raisers.
2020-08-31.snippet: The Mount Kisco, N.Y., company teamed up with the Metropolitan Museum to create a special assortment of bars as fund-raisers.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: Mast, the chocolate makers originally based in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, but now in Mount Kisco, N.Y., teamed up with the Metropolitan Museum of Art two years ago to create a special assortment of bars for the gift shop, each wrapped in paintings from the Met. Some are notably well matched, like Katsushika Hokusai’s “Under the Wave Off Kanagawa” for a bar of sea salt chocolate, and John Singer Sargent’s “Madame X” with dark chocolate. As a fund-raiser for its 150th anniversary, the collection of chocolate bars in a dozen flavors will benefit the museum. For each $9 bar, $5.50 will go to the Met; for the $100 set, $60 is donated.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Chocolate and Art from Mast and the Met

2020-08-31.abstract: Campus outbreaks are beginning to infect surrounding communities.
2020-08-31.snippet: Campus outbreaks are beginning to infect surrounding communities.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: Outbreaks at colleges across the United States are beginning to spill off campus and infect surrounding communities — a worrisome trend that does not bode well for other school reopenings this fall.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today

2020-08-31.abstract: The board of trustees said an independent forensic firm would look into all facets of Liberty’s operations, including “financial, real estate and legal matters,” while Mr. Falwell was president.
2020-08-31.snippet: The board of trustees said an independent forensic firm would look into all facets of Liberty’s operations, including “financial, real estate and legal matters,” while Mr. Falwell was president.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The board of trustees of Liberty University announced on Monday that it had retained an independent forensic firm to conduct an investigation into the school’s operations under Jerry Falwell Jr., who resigned last week in the wake of a sex scandal after serving as its president and chancellor since 2007.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Liberty Will Investigate University’s Operations Under Jerry Falwell Jr.

2020-08-31.abstract: The 29-minute film follows three professionals as they manage working in male-dominated spaces.
2020-08-31.snippet: The 29-minute film follows three professionals as they manage working in male-dominated spaces.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: To highlight the challenges women face in the restaurant business, not just as chefs but also as owners and in jobs like butchers, KitchenAid, the kitchen appliance company, has commissioned “A Woman’s Place,” a documentary by Rayka Zehtabchi and produced by Digitas, Ventureland and Vox Creative. The 29-minute film follows Karyn Tomlinson, a Minneapolis chef; Marielle Fabie, the chef de cuisine at a ramen shop in Oakland, Calif.; and Etana Diaz, a butcher from Seattle, as they manage working in male-dominated spaces, contend with their parents’ aspirations for them and try to meet their personal goals.
2020-08-31.headline_main: A Documentary on Women in the Restaurant Business

2020-08-31.abstract: Aid to the unemployed saved us from disaster. Now it’s gone.
2020-08-31.snippet: Aid to the unemployed saved us from disaster. Now it’s gone.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: For the most part, America under Donald Trump’s leadership has offered an object lesson in how not to handle a pandemic. Delay and denial deprived us of any chance of containing the coronavirus’s early spread; impatience and further denial led to a huge second wave of infections.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Trump Had One Good Response to Covid-19. His Party Killed It.

2020-08-31.abstract: China’s new export rules, which could delay or scuttle a sale of TikTok, have further turned giant companies into pawns in a geopolitical struggle.

2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On most days, companies like ByteDance, Microsoft, Walmart and Oracle are considered kings within their fields. But over the weekend, it became increasingly clear that they can also be something else: a set of pawns.
2020-08-31.headline_main: TikTok Deal Faces Complications as U.S. and China Ratchet Up Tit-for-Tat

2020-08-31.abstract: He inspired a generation of young, Black players when their acceptance was not taken for granted. He pushed open doors for plenty of coaches, too.
2020-08-31.snippet: He inspired a generation of young, Black players when their acceptance was not taken for granted. He pushed open doors for plenty of coaches, too.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The story, as John Thompson Jr. often shared it, was that he was told by the Georgetown president, upon being hired to coach the university’s moribund men’s basketball program in the spring of 1972, that it would be great if he could win a few games. Maybe even qualify for a slice of postseason affirmation in the National Invitation Tournament.
2020-08-31.headline_main: John Thompson’s Success at Georgetown Made Him Ahead of His Time

2020-08-31.abstract: A new book dives into the history, including the ties to government food policies in Europe, the United States and elsewhere.
2020-08-31.snippet: A new book dives into the history, including the ties to government food policies in Europe, the United States and elsewhere.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The potato, as Rebecca Earle, the author of “Feeding the People,” this detailed, scholarly survey, puts it, is “a fantastically successful global food stuff.” It was all but unknown before the 16th century outside its native Andean region, where it had been appreciated for some 10,000 years. Healthful, tasty and economical, it has been tied to government food policies in Europe, the United States and elsewhere, notably for nourishing workers. Issues of class, colonialism, commercial agriculture, peasant farming and government regulation versus freedom of choice are clearly (and densely) laid out and documented. A handful of recipes includes one from The New York Times in 1943 for a layered, jellied meat and potato loaf.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Learn About ‘The Politics of the Potato’

2020-08-31.abstract: The agency’s new guidelines are wrong, so states have to step up on their own to suppress the coronavirus.
2020-08-31.snippet: The agency’s new guidelines are wrong, so states have to step up on their own to suppress the coronavirus.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: We were startled and dismayed last week to learn that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, in a perplexing series of statements, had altered its testing guidelines to reduce the testing of asymptomatic people for the coronavirus.
2020-08-31.headline_main: It Has Come to This: Ignore the C.D.C.

2020-08-31.abstract: The agency weakened Obama-era rules meant to keep metals and other pollution out of rivers and streams, saving industry tens of millions of dollars.
2020-08-31.snippet: The agency weakened Obama-era rules meant to keep metals and other pollution out of rivers and streams, saving industry tens of millions of dollars.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration on Monday relaxed strict Obama-era standards for how coal-fired power plants dispose of wastewater laced with dangerous pollutants like lead, selenium and arsenic, a move environmental groups said would leave rivers and streams vulnerable to toxic contamination.
2020-08-31.headline_main: E.P.A. Relaxes Rules Limiting Toxic Waste From Coal Plants

2020-08-31.snippet: The documents were seized in a case against the president’s former aide, who is accused along with three others of a fraudulent scheme to build a border wall, prosecutors said.

Bannon, the former adviser to President Trump who is charged with defrauding donors to a private group that promised to build a wall on the Mexican border, the government said on Monday.

2020-08-31.abstract: This new branch of Butterfield Market have opened up the former Dean & DeLuca location in part to observe social distancing.
2020-08-31.snippet: This new branch of Butterfield Market have opened up the former Dean & DeLuca location in part to observe social distancing.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The spacious former Dean & DeLuca on the Upper East Side has now become a branch of Butterfield Market, a store that has been on Lexington Avenue since 1915. The owners, Evan and Joelle Obsatz, and their father, Alan Obsatz, have added features like a sushi counter, an appetizing department and a pizzeria, which are not in the original. They also opened up the white-tiled space, with fewer counters clogging central aisles, in part to observe social distancing and also for a more expansive look. The new market sells produce, groceries, dairy, baked goods and, soon, meat and seafood. But there is a greater emphasis on prepared food to meet a demand that the owners recognize as having become more necessary with the pandemic. They are also geared up for home delivery.
2020-08-31.headline_main: An Upper East Side Market With Space to Move

2020-08-31.abstract: If a Grand Slam tournament happens and there are not 50,000 daily spectators there to watch it, is it really a scene? The players are making it one.
2020-08-31.snippet: If a Grand Slam tournament happens and there are not 50,000 daily spectators there to watch it, is it really a scene? The players are making it one.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: The four biggest tournaments in tennis, known as the Grand Slams, so clearly reflect the cities in which they take place.
2020-08-31.headline_main: The Bizarro 2020 U.S. Open Begins

2020-08-31.abstract: With the coronavirus spreading fast in Gaza, the sides agreed to stop bombarding each other, and Israel said it would resume fuel supplies. A cash infusion from Qatar helped seal the deal.
2020-08-31.snippet: With the coronavirus spreading fast in Gaza, the sides agreed to stop bombarding each other, and Israel said it would resume fuel supplies. A cash infusion from Qatar helped seal the deal.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — With the coronavirus spreading fast through the Gaza Strip, the Palestinian militant group Hamas agreed Monday night to cool its latest round of hostilities with Israel in exchange for a cash infusion from Qatar and for Israel’s agreement to let fuel flow back to Gaza’s power station, officials said.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Israel and Hamas Agree to Cool Hostilities, for Now

2020-08-31.abstract: Charged with creating an animated mystery series, Mr. Ruby and his writing partner, Ken Spears, came up with a show that endures more than 50 years later.
2020-08-31.snippet: Charged with creating an animated mystery series, Mr. Ruby and his writing partner, Ken Spears, came up with a show that endures more than 50 years later.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: “Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!” the ghostly, goofy animated mystery series featuring a ragtag quartet of teenage sleuths and a cowardly Great Dane with a gruff bark who leads the gang in and out of trouble, was a hit from its first episode in 1969.
2020-08-31.headline_main: Joe Ruby, a Creator of ‘Scooby-Doo,’ Is Dead at 87

2020-08-31.abstract: Hound’s Tree of Mattituck, N.Y., has a selection of more than 80 wines all from New York State.
2020-08-31.snippet: Hound’s Tree of Mattituck, N.Y., has a selection of more than 80 wines all from New York State.
2020-08-31.lead_paragraph: Hound’s Tree of Mattituck, N.Y., in Long Island’s North Fork wine country, has opened an inviting tasting room attached to its new working winery in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. It’s worth a visit, even if it means sipping socially distanced outdoors, for one of the best New York State and especially Long Island wine lists you’re likely to find, with a selection of more than 80 in a vast range of varietals and styles. About a quarter of the wines are made from grapes cultivated on Hound’s Tree’s own 30-acre estate, established five years ago by Alex Rosanelli, a winemaking aficionado from New York who is on track to become a master of wine. His approach is a minimal-intervention style. For now the wines are made at another facility on the North Fork, but they will soon be produced in the Brooklyn location. To accompany the wines served by the taste, glass and bottle, there are oysters, small plates, charcuterie and cheeses.
2020-08-31.headline_main: An Inviting Brooklyn Tasting Room for New York Wines
